{"uri": "8233019944", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "07:22:38", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T07:22:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T07:17:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8274509906768799, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-13650555/Former-lady-Melania-Trump-makes-rare-appearance-Republican-conventions-night.html", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the...", "body": "MILWAUKEE (AP) - Melania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump\u00b4s life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump\u00b4s family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven\u00b4s Symphony No. 9 played.\n\nRepublican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump is joined on stage by former first lady Melania Trump at the Republican National Convention Thursday, July 18, 2024, in Milwaukee. (AP Photo/J. Scott Applewhite)\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump\u00b4s two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n-\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.\n\nRepublican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump, center, stands on stage with Melania Trump and other members of his family during the Republican National Convention, Thursday, July 18, 2024, in Milwaukee. (AP Photo/Julia Nikhinson)\n\nRepublican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump, center, stands on stage with Melania Trump and other members of his family during the Republican National Convention, Thursday, July 18, 2024, in Milwaukee. (AP Photo/Julia Nikhinson)\n\nFormer first lady Melania Trump waves during the final day of the Republican National Convention Thursday, July 18, 2024, in Milwaukee. (AP Photo/Paul Sancya)\n\nAs former first lady Melania Trump watches, Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump signs paperwork to officially accept the nomination during the final day of the Republican National Convention at the Fiserv Forum, Thursday, July 18, 2024, in Milwaukee. {"uri": "8232701671", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "02:16:58", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T02:16:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T02:15:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://expressdigest.com/melania-trump-joins-donald-as-he-signs-paperwork-to-be-the-republican-nominee-just-days-after-surviving-assassination-attempt/", "title": "Melania Trump joins Donald as he signs paperwork to be the Republican nominee just days after surviving assassination attempt", "body": "Melania Trump, in a bright red skirt suit, joined her husband Donald Trump in signing the paperwork for him to become the Republican presidential nominee.\n\nThe former first lady did not join the rest of the Trump family in walking out into the convention hall to listen to Hulk Hogan address the crowd.\n\nIvanka Trump, Don Jr., and Tiffany were all with their father in the main box in the convention hall. They listened and cheered with the crowd while Hulk Hogan and Eric Trump fired up the delegates.\n\n'Four more years,' they cheered.\n\nThe former president was surrounded by his children and grandchildren as he prepared to address the convention.\n\nMelania Trump joins Donald Trump as he signs the paperwork to be the Republican nominee\n\nMelania was spotted boarding Trump Force One in Newark, N.J., on Thursday night for the flight to Milwaukee. She was joined by Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner.\n\nShe is not scheduled to address the delegates, despite being offered the chance to do so.\n\nShe did speak to delegates at the 2016 and 2020 conventions but, this election year, she has stayed in the shadows while her husband runs for a second term.\n\nIvanka Trump is at the convention in her 'personal capacity' to support her father, sources close to her said.\n\nShe has stayed away from politics since her father decided to run for a second term, despite previously being involved in his campaigns and his administration.\n\nHer brothers have stayed active. Both Don Jr. - who addressed the convention on Wednesday - and Eric have been surrogates on the campaign trail. Eric's wife Lara joined the Republican National Committee to help run the former president's re-election effort.\n\nThe family has gathered around its patriarch since an assassin attempted to kill him on July 13th.\n\nMelania Trump, who rarely makes public statements, spoke to the horror when she realized her and son Barron's life were on the brink of 'devastating change' after the hearing the news about her husband's assassination attempt.\n\nThe former first lady called the gunman a 'monster' and described the moment she watched the bullet strike her husband's ear at a Pennsylvania rally in front of thousands of his adoring fans.\n\n'A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,' Melania said in an emotional statement on X on Sunday morning.\n\n'When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband.'\n\nShe called for people to 'reunite' and said she is thinking of her fellow Americans.\n\n'This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence,' her statement continued.\n\n'The winds of change have arrived. For those of you who cry in support, I thank you. I commend those of you who have reached out beyond the political divide - thank you for remembering that every single politician is a man or a woman with a loving family.'\n\nThere was no sign of Barron Trump on Thursday, the last night of the Republican National Convention, when the party crowns Donald Trump as its nominee.\n\nThe former president's youngest son attended his first political rally in early July, the week before the assassination attempt on his father. There he stood up and waved to the crowd, garnering massive cheers his father's faithful.\n\nThe 18-year-old graduated from high school in May and is expected to attend college in the fall.\n\nHis graduation was the last time Donald and Melania Trump were seen in public together.\n\nEarlier this summer, Barron Trump declined Florida's offer to be a delegate to the Republican National Convention this summer.\n\nA week after the state announced the 18-year-old would represent it at Donald Trump's nomination, Melania Trump's office announced Barron had 'prior commitments.'\n\n'While Barron is honored to have been chosen as a delegate by the Florida Republican Party, he regretfully declines to participate due to prior commitments,' the Office of Melania Trump said.\n\nNo further details were given.\n\nFormer President Donald Trump, Lara Trump, Eric Luke Trump, and Carolina Dorothy Trump watch Eric Trump address the convention\n\nAs Usha Chilukuri Vance, Ivanka Trump former first lady Melania Trump and Eric Trump watch, Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump and Republican vice presidential candidate Sen. JD Vance, R-Ohio, sign paperwork to officially accept the nomination\n\nJared Kushner, former White House senior adviser, Ivanka Trump, former White House senior adviser, Tiffany Trump and her husband Michael Boulos, attend the final day of the Republican National Convention\n\nMeanwhile, Melania Trump has appeared publicly with her husband for campaign events just three times: his campaign kickoff in November 2022 at their Mar-a-Lago home, in March when she accompanied her husband to vote in the Florida presidential primary, and in April when she appeared at his side at a high-dollar fundraiser in Palm Beach.\n\nIn March, as she walked into the polling place, Melania was asked then if she would join the former president on the campaign trail.\n\nHer response: 'Stay tuned.'\n\nMelania Trump notably skipped the first presidential debate in Atlanta. Trump walked off the stage alone while Joe Biden was accompanied by Jill Biden.\n\nBut she did host two fundraisers for Log Cabin Republicans, the largest conservative LGBTQ+ organization: one at {"uri": "8232917118", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "05:56:28", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T05:56:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T05:55:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://lasvegassun.com/news/2024/jul/18/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appea/", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the Republican convention's last night", "body": "J. Scott Applewhite / AP\n\nRepublican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump is joined on stage by former first lady Melania Trump at the Republican National Convention Thursday, July 18, 2024, in Milwaukee.\n\nBy Jonathan J. Cooper, Associated Press\n\nThursday, July 18, 2024 | 10:46 p.m.\n\nMILWAUKEE -- Melania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n--\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.", "source": {"uri": "lasvegassun.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Las Vegas Sun"}, "authors": [{"uri": "associated_press@lasvegassun.com", "name": "Associated Press", "type": "author", "isAgency": true}, {"uri": "jonathan_j_cooper@lasvegassun.com", "name": "Jonathan J. Here's which Trumps have appeared", "body": "In 2020, the first family -- Melania Trump, Barron Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump and Tiffany Trump -- attended the Republican National Convention in unity to support former President Donald Trump.\n\nFor the 2024 RNC, as Trump prepares to formally accept the Republican nomination Thursday, July 18, most of the Trump family will have definitively attended, except for one.\n\nSince it started Monday, July 15, Donald Trump has made an appearance each night of the convention, seen with a bandage over his right ear where he was injured in an assassination attempt at his July 13 rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.\n\nOne notable absence on the RNC speaker lineup is former first lady Melania Trump. The low-profile spouse is expected to be in the family box for her husband's remarks, officials said, but they would not otherwise comment on her activities, according to USA TODAY.\n\nBarron Trump was initially selected to serve as a Florida delegate at the RNC, but Melania Trump stated May 10 Barron would not be able to attend due to \"prior commitments.\"\n\nHere's what we know about the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee and which Trump family members played a role.\n\nThe low-profile spouse is expected to be in the family box for her husband's remarks, officials said, but they would not otherwise comment on her activities.\n\nShe has no public schedule.\n\nMelania Trump has rarely been seen in public during her husband's 2024 campaign. She did issue a lengthy written statement after the July 13 assassination attempt: \"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,\" she wrote.\n\nBarron Trump, the sole child of Donald and the former president's third wife Melania Trump, made his Trump rally speech debut July 9, 2024, at the Trump family golf resort west of Miami.\n\nDonald Trump's youngest son did not speak at the event, and his older brothers, Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, were there. Tiffany Trump, Ivanka Trump and Melania Trump did not appear to attend the Florida rally.\n\nBarron Trump was initially selected to serve as a Florida delegate at the 2024 Republican National Convention, but Melania Trump stated May 10 Barron would not be able to attend due to \"prior commitments.\"\n\nBarron Trump, who turned 18 on March 20, graduated from Oxbridge Academy near West Palm Beach, Florida, on May 17. At the Florida rally earlier this month, Donald Trump alluded to Barron's next step -- his choice of university to attend in fall 2024 -- but did not reveal where Barron would seek his college degree.\n\nDonald Trump Jr., the eldest son of the former president, appeared on stage Wednesday night at the RNC along with headliner Sen. JD Vance, R-Ohio, Trump's running mate, who officially accepted the vice president nomination.\n\nTrump's son Eric Trump and daughter Tiffany Trump attended night two (Tuesday, July 16) of the Republican National Convention. Trump had appeared by video conference the night before and made his first in-person appearance at the RNC that night. Eric Trump's wife, Lara Trump, is a co-chair of the Republican National Committee.\n\nEric Trump is the Florida delegation chair and Monday he cast the votes for former president Donald Trump, putting him over the number needed to be the official nominee.\n\nTrump's daughter Ivanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, are expected to appear on the last day of the convention, Thursday, July 18.\n\nDonald Trump's youngest daughter, Tiffany Trump, attended the Republican National Convention with her brother, Eric Trump, on Tuesday, July 16.\n\nDonald Trump's oldest granddaughter, Kai Trump, became the first of his grandchildren to talk about what it's like to have one of the most famous people in the world as a grandfather. Her Wednesday, July 17, speech at the Republican National Convention marked her first significant campaign role.\n\n\"I'm speaking today to share the side of my grandpa that people don't often see,\" she said. \"To me, he's just a normal grandpa. He gives us candy and soda when our parents aren't looking. He always wants to know how we're doing in school.\"\n\nKai Trump is the oldest of Donald Trump's 10 grandchildren and the oldest child of Donald Trump Jr.'s five children. She celebrated her 17th birthday on May 12.\n\nKai was born and mostly raised in New York, but now lives in South Florida with her mother, former model Vanessa Kay Trump, formerly Vanessa Kay Pergolizzi. Vanessa and Donald Jr. married in 2005 and had five children together before they eventually divorced, after 13 years of marriage, in 2018.\n\nDuring the week of Aug. 24, 2020, the Trump family supported then-president Donald Trump as he delivered his nomination acceptance speech from the White House.\n\nBecause of the coronavirus pandemic, however, most of the Republican National Convention speeches took place in a largely empty auditorium in Washington, D.C., or were pre-recorded from locations across the country.\n\nBarron Trump, former first lady Melania Trump, former president Donald Trump, Tiffany Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Kimberly Guilfoyle, Lara Trump, Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner and Michael Boulos (now Tiffany Trump's husband) posed for photos after Trump delivered his acceptance speech for the Republican Party nomination for re-election during the final day of the Republican National Convention at the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, D.C., on Aug. 27, 2020.\n\nContributing: Savannah Kuchar and David Jackson, USA TODAY, and C. A. Bridges, USA TODAY Network-Florida\n\nSangalang is a lead digital producer for USA TODAY Network-Florida. Follow her on Twitter or Instagram at @byjensangalang. Support local journalism. Here's which Trumps have appeared", "body": "Among the 116 seniors who received diplomas at Oxbridge Academy's Class of 2024 ceremony in West Palm Beach was Barron Trump, son of Donald and Melania Trump.\n\nIn 2020, the first family -- Melania Trump, Barron Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump and Tiffany Trump -- attended the Republican National Convention in unity to support former President Donald Trump.\n\nFor the 2024 RNC, as Trump prepares to formally accept the Republican nomination Thursday, July 18, most of the Trump family will have definitively attended, except for one.\n\nSince it started Monday, July 15, Donald Trump has made an appearance each night of the convention, seen with a bandage over his right ear where he was injured in an assassination attempt at his July 13 rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.\n\nOne notable absence on the RNC speaker lineup is former first lady Melania Trump. The low-profile spouse is expected to be in the family box for her husband's remarks, officials said, but they would not otherwise comment on her activities, according to USA TODAY.\n\nBarron Trump was initially selected to serve as a Florida delegate at the RNC, but Melania Trump stated May 10 Barron would not be able to attend due to \"prior commitments.\"\n\nHere's what we know about the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee and which Trump family members played a role.\n\nWill Melania Trump attend 2024 Republican National Convention?\n\nThe low-profile spouse is expected to be in the family box for her husband's remarks, officials said, but they would not otherwise comment on her activities.\n\nShe has no public schedule.\n\nMelania Trump has rarely been seen in public during her husband's 2024 campaign. She did issue a lengthy written statement after the July 13 assassination attempt: \"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,\" she wrote.\n\nWill Barron Trump attend 2024 Republican National Convention?\n\nBarron Trump, the sole child of Donald and the former president's third wife Melania Trump, made his Trump rally speech debut July 9, 2024, at the Trump family golf resort west of Miami.\n\nDonald Trump's youngest son did not speak at the event, and his older brothers, Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, were there. Tiffany Trump, Ivanka Trump and Melania Trump did not appear to attend the Florida rally.\n\nBarron Trump was initially selected to serve as a Florida delegate at the 2024 Republican National Convention, but Melania Trump stated May 10 Barron would not be able to attend due to \"prior commitments.\"\n\nBarron Trump, who turned 18 on March 20, graduated from Oxbridge Academy near West Palm Beach, Florida, on May 17. At the Florida rally earlier this month, Donald Trump alluded to Barron's next step -- his choice of university to attend in fall 2024 -- but did not reveal where Barron would seek his college degree.\n\nDid Donald Trump Jr. attend 2024 Republican National Convention?\n\nDonald Trump Jr., the eldest son of the former president, appeared on stage Wednesday night at the RNC along with headliner Sen. JD Vance, R-Ohio, Trump's running mate, who officially accepted the vice president nomination.\n\nDid Eric Trump attend 2024 Republican National Convention?\n\nTrump's son Eric Trump and daughter Tiffany Trump attended night two (Tuesday, July 16) of the Republican National Convention. Trump had appeared by video conference the night before and made his first in-person appearance at the RNC that night. Eric Trump's wife, Lara Trump, is a co-chair of the Republican National Committee.\n\nEric Trump is the Florida delegation chair and Monday he cast the votes for former president Donald Trump, putting him over the number needed to be the official nominee.\n\nDid Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner attend 2024 Republican National Convention?\n\nTrump's daughter Ivanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, are expected to appear on the last day of the convention, Thursday, July 18.\n\nDid Tiffany Trump attend 2024 Republican National Convention?\n\nDonald Trump's youngest daughter, Tiffany Trump, attended the Republican National Convention with her brother, Eric Trump, on Tuesday, July 16.\n\nWho is Kai Trump?\n\nDonald Trump's oldest granddaughter, Kai Trump, became the first of his grandchildren to talk about what it's like to have one of the most famous people in the world as a grandfather. Her Wednesday, July 17, speech at the Republican National Convention marked her first significant campaign role.\n\n\"I'm speaking today to share the side of my grandpa that people don't often see,\" she said. \"To me, he's just a normal grandpa. He gives us candy and soda when our parents aren't looking. He always wants to know how we're doing in school.\"\n\nKai Trump is the oldest of Donald Trump's 10 grandchildren and the oldest child of Donald Trump Jr.'s five children. She celebrated her 17th birthday on May 12.\n\nKai was born and mostly raised in New York, but now lives in South Florida with her mother, former model Vanessa Kay Trump, formerly Vanessa Kay Pergolizzi. Vanessa and Donald Jr. married in 2005 and had five children together before they eventually divorced, after 13 years of marriage, in 2018.\n\nMelania Trump, Barron Trump attended 2020 Republican National Convention\n\nDuring the week of Aug. 24, 2020, the Trump family supported then-president Donald Trump as he delivered his nomination acceptance speech from the White House.\n\nBecause of the coronavirus pandemic, however, most of the Republican National Convention speeches took place in a largely empty auditorium in Washington, D.C., or were pre-recorded from locations across the country.\n\nBarron Trump, former first lady Melania Trump, former president Donald Trump, Tiffany Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Kimberly Guilfoyle, Lara Trump, Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner and Michael Boulos (now Tiffany Trump's husband) posed for photos after Trump delivered his acceptance speech for the Republican Party nomination for re-election during the final day of the Republican National Convention at the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, D.C., on Aug. 27, 2020.\n\nMelania, Barron Trump attended 2020 RNC. {"uri": "2024-07-426698087", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "05:11:32", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T05:11:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T00:41:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://www.usnews.com/news/politics/articles/2024-07-19/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appearance-on-the-republican-conventions-last-night", "title": "Former First Lady Melania Trump Makes a Rare Appearance on the Republican Convention's Last Night", "body": "MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Melania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. She walked into the Trump family box to take a seat by J.D. Vance, her husband's vice presidential nominee.\n\nBut Donald Trump had already exited the box to prepare to address the delegates. Despite her distain for politics, Melania seemed happy to be at the convention, smiling and waving to the delegates.\n\nThe Trumps were together earlier in the evening, however, when Melania, wearing Dior, watched Donald sign the paperwork for him to become the Republican presidential nominee.\n\nShe then stayed behind the scenes until shortly before Donald was scheduled to speak. The former first lady did not join the rest of the Trump family in walking out into the convention hall.\n\nIvanka Trump, Don Jr., and Tiffany were all with their father in the main box in the convention hall. They listened and cheered with the crowd while Hulk Hogan and Eric Trump fired up the delegates.\n\nThe former president was surrounded by his children and grandchildren as he prepared to address the convention, which marks his formal acceptance of the nomination. But Melania, who has rarely appeared on the campaign trail, waited until the last moments before his remarks to join the family.\n\nShe did not address the delegates on Thursday night, despite being offered the chance to do so.\n\nShe did speak to delegates at the 2016 and 2020 conventions but, this election year, she has stayed in the shadows while her husband runs for a second term.\n\nThursday was also Ivanka Trump's first night at the convention and also marked a rare political appearance. The former first daughter is there in her 'personal capacity' to support her father, sources close to her said.\n\nShe has stayed away from politics since her father decided to run for a second term, despite previously being involved in his campaigns and his administration.\n\nHer brothers have stayed active. Both Don Jr. - who addressed the convention on Wednesday - and Eric have been surrogates on the campaign trail. Eric's wife Lara joined the Republican National Committee to help run the former president's re-election effort.\n\nThe family has gathered around its patriarch since an assassin attempted to kill him on July 13th.\n\nMelania Trump, who rarely makes public statements, spoke to the horror when she realized her and son Barron's life were on the brink of 'devastating change' after the hearing the news about her husband's assassination attempt.\n\nThe former first lady called the gunman a 'monster' and described the moment she watched the bullet strike her husband's ear at a Pennsylvania rally in front of thousands of his adoring fans.\n\n'A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,' Melania said in an emotional statement on X on Sunday morning.\n\n'When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband.'\n\nShe called for people to 'reunite' and said she is thinking of her fellow Americans.\n\n'This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence,' her statement continued.\n\n'The winds of change have arrived. For those of you who cry in support, I thank you. I commend those of you who have reached out beyond the political divide - thank you for remembering that every single politician is a man or a woman with a loving family.'\n\nThere was no sign of Barron Trump on Thursday, the last night of the Republican National Convention, when the party crowns Donald Trump as its nominee.\n\nThe former president's youngest son attended his first political rally in early July, the week before the assassination attempt on his father. There he stood up and waved to the crowd, garnering massive cheers his father's faithful.\n\nThe 18-year-old graduated from high school in May and is expected to attend college in the fall.\n\nHis graduation was the last time Donald and Melania Trump were seen in public together.\n\nEarlier this summer, Barron Trump declined Florida's offer to be a delegate to the Republican National Convention this summer.\n\nA week after the state announced the 18-year-old would represent it at Donald Trump's nomination, Melania Trump's office announced Barron had 'prior commitments.'\n\n'While Barron is honored to have been chosen as a delegate by the Florida Republican Party, he regretfully declines to participate due to prior commitments,' the Office of Melania Trump said.\n\nNo further details were given.\n\nMeanwhile, Melania Trump has appeared publicly with her husband for campaign events just three times: his campaign kickoff in November 2022 at their Mar-a-Lago home, in March when she accompanied her husband to vote in the Florida presidential primary, and in April when she appeared at his side at a high-dollar fundraiser in Palm Beach.\n\nIn March, as she walked into the polling place, Melania was asked then if she would join the former president on the campaign trail.\n\nHer response: 'Stay tuned.'\n\nMelania Trump notably skipped the first presidential debate in Atlanta. A few fell asleep.\n\nThey rallied for the grand finale however, roaring their approval as the Trump family took the stage to wave as balloons rained down around them.\n\nSince the assassination attempt on him on July 13th, Trump has had his family at his side.\n\nMost of them were on hand Thursday night to see him crowned as the Republican presidential nominee.\n\nHis children walked onto the convention floor with him.\n\nLater, Melania Trump, in a bright red skirt suit by Dior, made a dramatic entrance, walking into the arena to cheers and the music from Beethoven's symphony no. 9.\n\nShe was introduced to the roaring crowd as the future first lady.\n\nDonald Trump and his wife Melania Trump are joined by the rest of the Trump family and Republican Vice Presidential nominee Sen. She was joined by Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner.\n\nShe will not address the delegates, despite being offered the chance to do so.\n\nShe did speak to delegates at the 2016 and 2020 conventions but, this election year, she has stayed in the shadows while her husband runs for a second term.\n\nShe spoke of the horror when she realized her and son Barron's life were on the brink of 'devastating change' after the hearing the news about her husband.\n\nThe former first lady called the gunman a 'monster' and described the moment she watched the bullet strike her husband's ear at a Pennsylvania rally in front of thousands of his adoring fans.\n\nRead More Biden holes up with Jill in Delaware during COVID battle as campaign plans event next week\n\n'A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,' Melania said in an emotional statement on X on Sunday morning.\n\n'When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband.'\n\nShe called for people to 'reunite' and said she is thinking of her fellow Americans.\n\n'This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence,' her statement continued.\n\n'The winds of change have arrived. For those of you who cry in support, I thank you. There he stood up and waved to the crowd, garnering massive cheers his father's faithful.\n\nThe 18-year-old graduated from high school in May and is expected to attend college in the fall.\n\nHis graduation was the last time Donald and Melania Trump were seen in public together.\n\nEarlier this summer, Barron Trump declined Florida's offer to be a delegate to the Republican National Convention this summer.\n\nA week after the state announced the 18-year-old would represent it at Donald Trump's nomination, Melania Trump's office announced Barron had 'prior commitments.'\n\n'While Barron is honored to have been chosen as a delegate by the Florida Republican Party, he regretfully declines to participate due to prior commitments,' the Office of Melania Trump said.\n\nNo further details were given.\n\nAs Usha Chilukuri Vance, Ivanka Trump former first lady Melania Trump and Eric Trump watch, Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump and Republican vice presidential candidate Sen. JD Vance, R-Ohio, sign paperwork to officially accept the nomination\n\nMeanwhile, Melania Trump has appeared publicly with her husband for campaign events just three times: his campaign kickoff in November 2022 at their Mar-a-Lago home, in March when she accompanied her husband to vote in the Florida presidential primary, and in April when she appeared at his side at a high-dollar fundraiser in Palm Beach.\n\nIn March, as she walked into the polling place, Melania was asked then if she would join the former president on the campaign trail.\n\nHer response: 'Stay tuned.'\n\nMelania Trump notably skipped the first presidential debate in Atlanta. Trump walked off the stage alone while Joe Biden was accompanied by Jill Biden.\n\nBut she did host two fundraisers for Log Cabin Republicans, the largest conservative LGBTQ+ organization: one at {"uri": "8231814301", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-18", "time": "13:02:31", "dateTime": "2024-07-18T13:02:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-18T13:01:57Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2024/07/18/trump-family-rnc-kai-donald-eric-melania-ivanka/", "title": "RNC is a Trump family show: Who does  --  and doesn't  --  have a speaking role?", "body": "Each of Trump's five children have already become minor political celebrities in their own right, and most have been heavily involved in Trump's campaign, his previous administration or the Trump Organization. And then there were some Trumps -- like the Republican front-runner's eldest grandchild Kai Trump -- who made their national stage debut this week.\n\nHere's what to know about the Trump family members at the Republican National Convention.\n\nDonald Trump Jr., 46, was one of the last to speak Wednesday -- just before Usha Vance, the wife of vice-presidential pick J.D. Vance, and the vice-presidential candidate himself.\n\nTrump's eldest son is a frequent proxy for his father and serves as an executive vice president in the Trump Organization.\n\nHe spoke at length about the assassination attempt against his father at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania and praised Trump's reaction as a show of strength. \"I've never been prouder of my father than I was in that moment,\" he said.\n\nDonald Trump Jr.'s daughter, Kai Trump, 17, gave what her father described as her \"first speech\" Wednesday and emphasized what a supportive grandfather the elder Trump has been.\n\n\"A lot of people have put my grandpa through hell, and he's still standing,\" she said. \"Grandpa, you are such an inspiration, and I love you. The media makes my grandpa seem like a different person.\"\n\nAfter she spoke, her father told her, \"You crushed that,\" while someone in the crowd yelled \"Kai 2040!\"\n\nTrump's second-oldest son, Eric Trump, 40, is expected to speak at the convention Thursday night. He, like his brother, is an executive vice president in the Trump Organization, and he has been supporting his father during the campaign, speaking at state conventions and to the media about the assassination attempt and their family.\n\n\"There's no family I don't think in political history that's remained closer than our family,\" Eric Trump said Wednesday in a television interview. \"And we're a family that's cohesive. We are a family that absolutely supports him, that absolutely loves him to death, and I'm honored to stand on that stage.\"\n\nLara Trump, 41, the co-chair of the Republican National Committee and Eric Trump's wife, was the first Trump family member to speak on the main stage of the convention Tuesday night.\n\nLara Trump spoke about her father-in-law's role as a family man who \"has sacrificed for his country,\" and she urged voters not to believe \"some outrageous narrative about the terrible things that Donald Trump will do if he becomes president.\"\n\nNotably, she gave a shout-out to \"gay supporters\" in her prime-time speech. The Republican Party just removed its platform's opposition to same-sex marriage.\n\nKimberly Guilfoyle, 55, Donald Trump Jr.'s fianc\u00e9e, was one of several speakers on Wednesday to say that Trump survived his attempted assassination due to divine intervention. Guilfoyle, who is also an adviser to Trump, began her speech by saying she knows that \"God has put an armor of protection over Donald Trump.\"\n\nGuilfoyle railed against President Biden and Democrats, arguing that Trump supporters are \"made to feel like enemies in our own country.\"\n\nNotable members of the Trump family have not spoken or been spotted at the convention -- yet. Trump's wife, Melania Trump, 54, and Trump's daughter, Ivanka Trump, 42, are not on the list of announced headliners and keynote speakers but are expected to make an appearance.\n\n\"They're coming in and in full force and effect, so they'll certainly be here,\" Eric Trump said about Melania and Ivanka Trump in an interview with CBS. \"Ivanka's been an incredible supporter of my father ... and obviously Melania, as well.\"\n\nIvanka Trump, who served as a senior adviser to her father during his presidency, said in 2022 that she would support her father outside the political arena moving forward because she wanted to preserve her family's privacy. And Melania Trump has increasingly retreated from the public eye since the end of Trump's presidency, though in a statement Sunday about the shooting she praised her husband as a \"generous and caring man.\"\n\nDonald and Melania Trump's son, Barron Trump, 18, is also not scheduled to speak.", "source": {"uri": "washingtonpost.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Washington Post"}, "authors": [{"uri": "annabelle_timsit@washingtonpost.com", "name": "Annabelle Timsit", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}, {"uri": "maham_javaid@washingtonpost.com", "name": "Maham Javaid", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_Jr.", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump Jr."}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Trump_Organization", "type": "org", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "The Trump Organization"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_the_United_States", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Vice President of the United States"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Ronald_Reagan", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Attempted assassination of Ronald Reagan"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Eric Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_2016_presidential_campaign", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump 2016 presidential campaign"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._D._Vance", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "J. {"uri": "2024-07-426817638", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "07:37:39", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T07:37:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:59:03Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.aol.co.uk/news/melania-makes-rare-appearance-rnc-020453262.html", "title": "Melania Trump takes to RNC floor in rare appearance alongside family for his nomination speech", "body": "Melania Trump takes to RNC floor in rare appearance alongside family for his nomination speech\n\nMike Bedigan\n\nUpdated 19 July 2024 at 5:23 am\n\nMelania Trump was greeted with rapturous applause as she made her entrance on the final night of the Republican National Convention, and offered her husband a brief peck on the cheek as he concluded his mammoth acceptance speech.\n\nThe former first lady was pictured standing behind Trump as he signed paperwork to accept his third nomination for the GOP presidential candidate on Thursday, alongside his newly selected running mate for 2024, JD Vance.\n\nVance's wife, Usha Vance, stood with Melania, as well as the president's daughter Ivanka, and son Eric. The former first lady was not mentioned on the list of speakers at the RNC for Thursday, but later made her official entrance to the convention floor to lilting classical music.\n\nWearing a red suit, Melania smiled and waved to supporters, before joining her husband and Vance in the box as the appplause continued.\n\nIn his acceptance speech - the longest in RNC history - Trump directed crowds towards Melania, saying: \"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania.\" To cheers, he continued: \"Melania, thank you very much. You also did something really beautiful, a letter to America, calling for national unity.\"\n\nAs he concluded his remarks after almost two hours, the former first lady returned to the stage to join her husband offering him a small kiss on the cheek. The pair held hands as they were joined by members of the Trump family as thousands of red, white and blue balloons fell.\n\nIn his speech former president thanked his entire family: \"Don, Kimberly, Ivanka and Jared, Eric and Lara, Tiffany and Michael, Barron, we love our Barron.\" Barron did not appear to be in the box alongside his other family members, nor on the stage later.\n\nThe 18-year-old recently made his entrance onto the political scene at a rally at Trump's Doral golf resort in Miami, Florida. Echoing his father's showmanship the teenager waved to crowds and pumped his fists, prompting Trump to joke that he was \"more popular\" than his other sons.\n\nBack in Milwaukee, Trump paid tribute to his 10 \"wonderful\" grandchildren. \"You saw a few of them up there on my lap before,\" he said.\n\nSpeculation about Melania's whereabouts have swirled for days as other members of the Trump familywere pictured on the convention floor, and in the box with the former president\n\nThe former president was also pictured dancing alongside his young grandchildren Spencer and Chloe, the children of Don Jr. He also spent time with Luke and Carolina - the children of Lara and Eric Trump.\n\nMelania's entrance in Milwaukee marks her first major political appearance with Trump since he announced his 2024 campaign almost two years ago.\n\nSources told Politico that the former first lady was deeply shaken by the shocking assassination attempt.\n\nShortly following the incident on Saturday during a campaign rally in Butler Pennsylvania, she released a statement in which she described the would-be assassin as a \"monster.\"\n\n\"When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband,\" Melania wrote.\n\n\"To the families of the innocent victims who are now suffering from this heinous act, I humbly offer my sincerest sympathy. Your need to summon your inner strength for such a terrible reason saddens me.\n\n\"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration. The core facets of my husband's life -- his human side -- were buried below the political machine. Donald, the generous and caring man who I have been with through the best of times and the worst of times.\"\n\nMelania has not remained completely out of politics, having headlined two fundraisers for the Log Cabin Republicans, a pro-LGBTQ+ rights Republican organization in spring.\n\nBoth were held at Trump properties -- Mar-a-Lago and Trump Tower -- and were closed to the press. However, Melania has not held any public campaign events or accompanied Trump at events out on the trail beyond a few private fundraisers and voting in Florida's primary.\n\nDonald Jr, his fiance\u00e9 Kimberly Guilfoyle, and now Eric Trump have all made speeches to supporters of the former president in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.", "source": {"uri": "aol.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": {"uri": "8233134542", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "08:37:34", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T08:37:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T08:36:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.firstpost.com/world/donald-trumps-wife-melania-makes-rare-appearance-on-last-night-of-republican-national-convention-13794680.html", "title": "Hug & kiss, but no speech: Melania Trump makes rare appearance but just to watch Trump", "body": "Donald Trump and wife Melania on stage at the Republican National Convention (RNC). Source: Reuters.\n\nMelania Trump, the elusive wife of Donald Trump, made a rare appearance at the Republican National Convention to support her husband in his third bid for the White House, but unlike in 2016 and 2020, this time she was not scheduled to deliver a speech.\n\nIt is tradition at party conventions for the candidates' spouses to give a speech and tell heavily-scripted anecdotes about family life. Trump's running mate and Republican Vice Presidential nominee JD Vance's wife Usha Chilukuri Vance also gave a speech on Wednesday.\n\nSoon after Trump's lengthy acceptance speech on the last day of RNC in Milwaukee ended, Melania, 54, walked to the podium alone as classical music played in the background. She was seen sporting a Republican red dress, appearing glamorous.\n\nOnce on stage, Melania was greeted with applause and balloons rained down on the crowd gathered to attend the RNC.\n\nA hug & kiss\n\nTrump greeted Melania with a hug and the couple shared a kiss on the cheek.\n\nHe then grabbed Melania's hand and walked across the stage with other members of his family including Ivanka Trump (Donald Trump's daughter), her husband Jared Kushner, joining them.\n\nMelania has been keeping a low profile since her husband's 2024 White House bid. She had not been spotted in Milwaukee since the convention kicked off on Monday.\n\nIn his speech on the final day of RNC 2024, Trump took a moment to express his appreciation for Melania, saying: \"I am deeply honoured to be joined by my amazing wife Melania.\"\n\nTrump said: \"Melania, thank you very much you also did something really beautiful, a letter to America for national Unity and it really took the Republican party by surprise, it was beautiful.\"\n\nLast week, after an assassination attempt on Trump at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania, Melania had issued a statement calling for unity.\n\n\"This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence. We all want a world where respect is paramount, family is first, and love transcends. We can realise this world again. Each of us must demand to get it back. We must insist that respect fills the cornerstone of our relationships again,\" she said in a statement.\n\nDonald Trump said that Meliana's letter \"captivated so many\".\n\nEver since Donald Trump was first elected in 2016, Melania has broken all the rules of normal American presidential politics.\n\nIn the White House during Trump's first term, she was a reclusive figure compared to other first ladies, focusing on a narrow set of interests. However, since her husband left office, she has not been seen by her husband's side on many occasions.", "source": {"uri": "firstpost.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Firstpost"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "8232923674", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "06:02:39", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T06:02:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:02:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://metro.co.uk/2024/07/19/melania-ivanka-appear-campaign-trail-first-time-support-trump-21256548/", "title": "Melania and Ivanka appear on campaign trail for first time to support Trump", "body": "Melania and Ivanka made a rare appearance to support former President Donald Trump's bid for re-election last night.\n\nThe former first lady and Trump's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, despite each playing larger roles in the lead-up to the 2016 and 2020 votes.\n\nMelania's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that has emerged prominently since the failed assassination of Trump last weekend.\n\nDuring a 14-minute account of the shooting, Trump - with his ear still heavily bandaged - told the Republican National Convention he was only there 'by the grace of Almighty God'.\n\nWhen he told the Milwaukee crowd that he was 'not supposed to be here', the delegates chanted back, 'Yes you are!'\n\nThe former president struck an unusually conciliatory tone during the speech's opening moments, when he formally accepted the Republican presidential nomination.\n\n'I am running to be president for all of America, not half of America, because there is no victory in winning for half of America,' he said, in a marked shift in tenor for the typically bellicose former president.\n\nBut he swiftly pivoted to well-worn attacks on the Biden administration, which he said was 'destroying' the country.\n\nHe claimed without evidence that his criminal indictments were part of a Democratic conspiracy, predicted that President Joe Biden would usher in 'World War Three' and described what he called an 'invasion' of migrants over the southern border.\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination.\n\nThey went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance.\n\nShe wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No 9 played.\n\n'On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,' Trump said to extended applause. 'And Melania, thank you very much.'\n\nHe said she 'did something really beautiful' when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nA day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to 'ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence'.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear.\n\nThe rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions.\n\nSome of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr, and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively.\n\nDaughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak.\n\nThe president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties.\n\nShe did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n'While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,' Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.", "source": {"uri": "metro.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Metro"}, "authors": [{"uri": "sam_corbishley@metro.co.uk", "name": "Sam Corbishley", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melania_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Melania Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_United_States_presidential_election", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "2016 United States presidential election"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_of_John_F._Kennedy", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Assassination of John F. {"uri": "2024-07-426238864", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-18", "time": "16:26:20", "dateTime": "2024-07-18T16:26:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-18T16:25:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://exbulletin.com/politics/2793388/", "title": "The RNC is a Trump family affair: Donald Trump Jr., Kai Trump, and Eric Trump speak out", "body": "Attendees at the Republican National Convention won't just see former President Donald Trump on stage, they'll see... lots and lots of Trump. Four family members have already appeared on stage in Milwaukee this week, with more expected Thursday.\n\nThe Trump family's presence not only shows how much of a family affair the convention has become, but also how closely tied members of the Trump family are to the Republican Party infrastructure, as co-chairs of the Republican National Committee or advisers.\n\nEach of Trump's five children has already become political celebrities in their own right, and most of them have been heavily involved in Trump's campaign, his previous administration or the Trump Organization. And then there have been some Trumps like the Republican frontrunner's eldest grandson, Kai Trump, who made his national debut this week.\n\nHere's what you need to know about the Trump family members at the Republican National Convention.\n\nDonald Trump Jr. and his daughter Kai\n\nDonald Trump Jr., 46, was one of the last to speak Wednesday, just before Usha Vance, the wife of vice presidential nominee J.D. Vance, and the vice presidential nominee himself.\n\nTrump's eldest son is a frequent proxy for his father and serves as executive vice president of the Trump Organization.\n\nHe spoke at length about the assassination attempt on his father at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania and hailed Trump's response as a show of strength. \"I've never been more proud of my father than I was at that moment,\" he said.\n\nDonald Trump Jr., the former president's son, said at the July 17 RNC that all they care about is persecuting my father. (Video: The Washington Post)\n\nDonald Trump Jr.'s daughter, Kai Trump, 17, gave what her father described as her first speech Wednesday and stressed what a supportive grandfather her dad was.\n\n\"A lot of people put my grandfather through hell, and he's still standing,\" she said. \"Grandpa, you're such an inspiration, and I love you. The media makes my grandfather look like a different person.\"\n\nAfter she spoke, her father told her: You crushed that, while someone in the crowd shouted Kai 2040!\n\nKai Trump, the eldest granddaughter of former President Donald Trump, explained to the crowd at the RNC what Trump was like as a grandfather on July 17. (Video: The Washington Post, Photo: Melina Mara/The Washington Post)\n\nEric Trump\n\nTrump's second-eldest son, Eric Trump, 40, is expected to speak at the convention Thursday night. Like his brother, he is an executive vice president of the Trump Organization and has supported his father during the campaign, speaking at state conventions and in the media about the assassination attempt and their family.\n\n\"I don't think there's a family in political history that's stayed as close as ours,\" Eric Trump said Wednesday in a televised interview. \"And we're a tight-knit family. We're a family that absolutely supports him, absolutely loves him to death, and I'm honored to stand on this stage.\"\n\nLara Trump\n\nLara Trump, 41, co-chair of the Republican National Committee and wife of Eric Trump, was the first member of the Trump family to speak on the convention's main stage Tuesday night.\n\nRNC co-chair Lara Trump recalls the assassination attempt on her father-in-law, former President Donald Trump, during her July 15 speech in Milwaukee. (Video: TWP)\n\nLara Trump spoke about her father-in-law's role as a family man who sacrificed for his country, and she urged voters not to believe some of the outrageous stories about the terrible things Donald Trump will do if he becomes president.\n\nShe notably praised supporters of homosexuality during her prime-time speech. The Republican Party has just removed its opposition to same-sex marriage from its platform.\n\nKimberly Guilfoyle\n\nKimberly Guilfoyle, 55, Donald Trump Jr.'s fianc\u00e9e, was one of several people to claim Wednesday that Trump survived his assassination attempt thanks to divine intervention. Guilfoyle, who is also a Trump adviser, began her speech by saying she knew God had placed protective armor on Donald Trump.\n\nGuilfoyle lashed out at President Biden and Democrats, saying Trump supporters feel like enemies in our own country.\n\nWhere are Melania Trump and Ivanka Trump?\n\nNotable members of the Trump family have yet to speak or be seen at the convention. Trump's wife, Melania Trump, 54, and Trump's daughter, Ivanka Trump, 42, are not on the list of announced headliners and keynote speakers, but are expected to make an appearance.\n\n\"They're coming in strong and in force, so they'll definitely be there,\" Eric Trump said of Melania and Ivanka Trump in an interview with CBS. Ivanka has been an incredible supporter of my dad and obviously Melania as well.\n\nIvanka Trump, who served as a senior adviser to her father during his presidency, said in 2022 that she would support her father outside the political arena in the future because she wanted to preserve her family's privacy. And Melania Trump has increasingly withdrawn from the public eye since the end of Trump's presidency, though in a statement Sunday about the shooting, she praised her husband as a generous and caring man.\n\nDonald and Melania Trump's son, Barron Trump, 18, is also not expected to speak.\n\nWhat Are The Main Benefits Of Comparing Car Insurance Quotes Online\n\nLOS ANGELES, CA / ACCESSWIRE / June 24, 2020, / Compare-autoinsurance.Org has launched a new blog post that presents the main benefits of comparing multiple car insurance quotes. For more info and free online quotes, please visit https://compare-autoinsurance.Org/the-advantages-of-comparing-prices-with-car-insurance-quotes-online/ The modern society has numerous technological advantages. One important advantage is the speed at which information is sent and received. With the help of the internet, the shopping habits of many persons have drastically changed. The car insurance industry hasn't remained untouched by these changes. On the internet, drivers can compare insurance prices and find out which sellers have the best offers. View photos The advantages of comparing online car insurance quotes are the following: Online quotes can be obtained from anywhere and at any time. Unlike physical insurance agencies, websites don't have a specific schedule and they are available at any time. Drivers that have busy working schedules, can compare quotes from anywhere and at any time, even at midnight. Multiple choices. Almost all insurance providers, no matter if they are well-known brands or just local insurers, have an online presence. Online quotes will allow policyholders the chance to discover multiple insurance companies and check their prices. Drivers are no longer required to get quotes from just a few known insurance companies. Also, local and regional insurers can provide lower insurance rates for the same services. Accurate insurance estimates. Online quotes can only be accurate if the customers provide accurate and real info about their car models and driving history. Lying about past driving incidents can make the price estimates to be lower, but when dealing with an insurance company lying to them is useless. Usually, insurance companies will do research about a potential customer before granting him coverage. Online quotes can be sorted easily. Although drivers are recommended to not choose a policy just based on its price, drivers can easily sort quotes by insurance price. Using brokerage websites will allow drivers to get quotes from multiple insurers, thus making the comparison faster and easier. For additional info, money-saving tips, and free car insurance quotes, visit https://compare-autoinsurance.Org/ Compare-autoinsurance.Org is an online provider of life, home, health, and auto insurance quotes. This website is unique because it does not simply stick to one kind of insurance provider, but brings the clients the best deals from many different online insurance carriers. In this way, clients have access to offers from multiple carriers all in one place: this website. On this site, customers have access to quotes for insurance plans from various agencies, such as local or nationwide agencies, brand names insurance companies, etc. \"Online quotes can easily help drivers obtain better car insurance deals. All they have to do is to complete an online form with accurate and real info, then compare prices\", said Russell Rabichev, Marketing Director of Internet Marketing Company. Congress in Milwaukee last night just days after he survived an attempt on his life sent the adoring crowd into raptures.\n\nBut the unexpected return of his wife Melania Trump to the limelight was arguably the biggest talking point of the night.\n\nThe former First Lady, 54, strode onto the stage sporting a striking red dress to thunderous applause and wild cheers prior to Trump's speech, after which she greeted her husband with an awkward kiss as balloons cascaded from the ceiling.\n\nMelania until last night had practically vanished from public life and the media, refusing to accompany her husband on the campaign trail and remaining absent even through his court battles in New York over the Stormy Daniels hush money payments.\n\nAmid a difficult period that saw the death of her mother in January, followed by Trump's legal strife and now the imminent departure of son Barron for college, many speculated that the former president had lost the support of his wife.\n\nBut Trump's brush the same age her husband is now - after a long period of illness.\n\n'It is with deep sadness that I announce the passing of my beloved mother, Amalija,' she said in a public statement at the time.\n\n'Amalija Knavs was a strong woman who always carried herself with grace, warmth, and dignity. charges on which he was ultimately convicted.\n\nBut Melania remained far away from the courtroom, opting to stay at the Trump residence in Mar-a-Lago, Florida.\n\nThe move was seen by many as damaging for Trump's defence, with legal experts telling DailyMail.com that it is often beneficial for a jury to see defendants with their spouse by their side in the courthouse.\n\n'Generally speaking, jurors pay attention to who is seated in the courtroom,' explained Anna Cominsky, Managing Attorney of New York Law School Legal Services.\n\n'Defense attorneys usually like to have ''support'' for their client evidenced by friends and family - it's something that humanizes the client.\n\n'That said, this is a very different case. The jurors know that this is the former president.'\n\nIn the aftermath of Trump's guilty verdict, Daniels - who alleged she had an affair with the billionaire just a year after he married Melania - said his wife 'needs to leave him' because 'it's been proven he is abusive' and he 'is now a criminal'.\n\nTrump himself admitted in an interview on Fox & Friends that his trial was 'very hard' on Melania.\n\nBalloons fall after Republican presidential nominee, former U.S. President Donald Trump officially accepted the Republican presidential nomination\n\nRepublican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump, left, stands on stage with Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner and Republican vice presidential candidate Sen. school this summer, so it's a difficult time for parents to go from having your child around all the time to leaving the nest,' former US Ambassador Ric Grenell said at a Bloomberg event on Monday.\n\nBut commentators have pointed out that Melania has never exhibited any great interest in politicking.\n\nWhile she has undoubtedly exhibited a greater degree of support for Trump in previous years, the former First Lady has been characterised as a 'very private person' who is fiercely independent and is loathe to spend time in Washington.\n\n'She's distancing herself even more from the Washington social-political scene,' Kate Andersen Brower, who's written several books on first ladies, told Axios.\n\n'I mean, she clearly hated being in Washington.'\n\n'Melania does what
