{"uri": "8232851413", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "04:58:34", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T04:58:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T04:58:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://www.econotimes.com/Melania-Trump-Snubs-RNC-Campaigning-for-Husband-Donald-Draws-Online-Ridicule-She-Has-No-Interest-Even-Being-There-1682039", "title": "Melania Trump Snubs RNC Campaigning for Husband Donald, Draws Online Ridicule: 'She Has No Interest Even Being There' - EconoTimes", "body": "Melania Trump snubs RNC campaigning for Donald, drawing online ridicule. Credit: President Duane The Owner of White House, CC BY 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons\n\nIt has been claimed that Melania Trump, who served as the first lady of the United States, has \"no interest\" in campaigning for her husband at the Republican National Convention.\n\nMany who criticize former President Donald Trump on social media did not notice that several famous individuals were not present during the first few nights of the convention. Above all others, the question is, \"Where is Melania?\"\n\nIn the end, Melania Trump appeared on the convention's final day; however, according to Kaitlan Collins of CNN, she declined to speak out in support of former President Donald Trump.\n\n\"I was told by sources they tried really hard to get her to give a speech tonight. They personally -- several people -- personally appealed to her and she had no interest in doing so,\" Collins reported, as per RawStory.\n\n\"Of course a lot has changed since 2016. Donald Trump was convicted in New York in the hush money case, something that became a real point of division between he and the first lady when that story broke when they were in the White House. And so it is notable to see her coming out as Melania Trump is known for doing in her own style, in her own way, coming out by herself to sit in this box,\" the CNN reporter went on.\n\nThe internet mocked Donald Trump over Melania's decision, saying, \"By the looks of it, she has no interest even being there.\" \"A smart choice on her part, to be honest,\" wrote @AreMond2 on Thursday.\n\nOne of the most vocal supporters of his father is Trump's eldest son, who is 46 years old and serves as executive vice president at the Trump Organization, which is owned by the Trump business family. JD Vance, the contender for vice president, was scheduled to speak on Wednesday night, but Trump Jr. spoke first. Vance is a friend of Trump Jr., and it has been stated that Trump Jr. campaigned for Vance to be chosen as the running mate.\n\nDuring his statement, Trump Jr. paid respect to Corey Comperatore, who was killed in a gunshot that occurred at a Trump rally on Saturday. He praised his father for having \"the heart of a lion\" and praised his father for his strength.\n\nAdditionally, Kimberly Guilfoyle, a former host on Fox News, who is now engaged to Donald Trump Jr., gave a speech in Milwaukee on Wednesday evening.\n\nWith her father, Trump Jr., introducing her, the granddaughter of the former president, who is now 17 years old, spoke at the Republican National Convention on Wednesday night.\n\n\"To me, he's just a normal grandpa. To me, he gives us candy and soda when our parents aren't looking,\" she told the audience of Trump. \"He always wants to know how we're doing in school.\"\n\nShe also referred to her grandfather as a \"inspiration\" as she concluded her remarks.\n\nThere is only one of the previous president's children that works directly for him in the White House, and that is Ivanka Trump, the one and only daughter of the former president. Together with her husband, Jared Kushner, she functioned as an official adviser for the administration.\n\nAs was the case with Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump was not included on the roster of speakers; however, she did make an appearance in the arena on Thursday when the former president addressed the audience. Ivanka Trump, who is 42 years old, also spoke at the Republican conventions in 2016 and 2020.\n\nIt is not unexpected that Ivanka Trump has been absent from the public eye because she has been making it clear for many years that she intends to retire from politics. She remarked, \"I love my father very much,\" in a statement that was released in 2022, just a few moments after her father revealed that he would be running for the White House for the third time. \"This time around, I am choosing to prioritize my young children and the private life we are creating as a family.\"\n\nEric Trump, like his father Donald Trump Jr., is an executive vice president at the Trump Organization, which is owned by the Trump family. He has also taken on a job that involves pushing for his father's political agenda in front of the public.\n\nHe is scheduled to speak at the conference on Thursday between the hours of 8 and 9 p.m. Central Time (CT). Eric, who is forty years old, is included on the official speakers' list for Milwaukee.\n\nIn addition to supporting their father, Eric Trump, who was standing next to Tiffany Trump and Donald Trump Jr., also spoke on behalf of Florida's representatives.\n\nOn Tuesday evening, the keynote presentation was delivered by Lara Trump, who is married to Eric Trump and serves as the handpicked co-chair of the Republican National Committee endorsed by the Republican nominee.\n\nWhile her father was in office and throughout her father's two prior campaigns, Tiffany Trump, who is now 30 years old, avoided politics as much as possible. Despite the fact that she spoke at the conventions in 2020 and 2016, she is not included on the official speakers' list for this year's event.\n\nWhile she was there on the floor with her two older brothers during the roll call nomination of their father, she is attending the Republican convention in 2024 as a delegate from the state of Florida.\n\nBarron Trump, the youngest child of Donald Trump, was initially chosen by the Florida Republican Party to serve as an official delegate in Milwaukee. This would have allowed him to enter the political arena alongside his siblings and other members of the Trump family. The young man, who is only 18 years old, has withdrawn his name from consideration and is not included on the list of speakers.\n\nBeginning at the beginning of this month, Barron made his debut at one of his father's campaign rallies. It is not apparent whether he will decide to take on a more public role.\n\nDuring the rally in Florida, his father stated, \"He is now going to college, and he got into every college he wanted to.\" \"He made his choice, and he is a very good guy.\"\n\n\"He might be more popular than Don and Eric... we gotta talk about this,\" his father joked after the audience gave him a standing ovation on his {"uri": "8232965890", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "06:37:48", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T06:37:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:36:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://pantagraph.com/partners/ap/national/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appearance-on-the-republican-conventions-last-night/article_5aa66258-2988-57ba-bf28-1beb9b46f8f0.html", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the Republican convention's last night", "body": "By JONATHAN J. COOPER - Associated Press\n\nMelania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nPeople are also reading... Police: Bloomington teen ran from crash before drowning in Illinois River Thousands in Central Illinois without power after second night of summer storms Normal backs enterprise zone taking in possible $200M Rivian expansion Normal residence heavily damaged, cat perishes in structure fire Trump injured but 'fine' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Dewon Griffin found guilty of murder in 2019 NYE shooting Illinois delegate caught in RNC commotion involving McCarthy, Gaetz Flick Fact: That J.D. Vance beard and its McLean County significance? Hundreds evacuate 'imminent' dam failure in Nashville, Ill. Highways flood and close. Update: Canton police say missing 2-year-old has been found alive Flick Fact: The LeRoy man who set an Illinois State Police record? Trump picks Sen. JD Vance of Ohio, a once-fierce critic turned loyal ally, as his GOP running mate Authorities hunt for clues, but motive of man who tried to assassinate Donald Trump remains elusive Trump heads to convention as authorities investigate motive, security in assassination attempt Jury deliberates fate of Bloomington man charged with murder of Decatur teen\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n--\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. {"uri": "8233456655", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "12:02:30", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T12:02:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T12:01:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://expressdigest.com/sealed-with-a-kiss-melania-and-donald-share-tender-moment-as-family-joins-them-on-stage-after-former-first-lady-broke-with-tradition-and-one-key-member-is-missing/", "title": "Sealed with a kiss: Melania and Donald share tender moment as family joins them on stage after former first lady broke with tradition... and one key member is missing", "body": "Three generations of Donald Trump's family surrounded him on stage after he accepted the Republican nomination during a marathon speech recounting the horrifying moment he was shot by a would-be assassin.\n\nMelania Trump came up behind her husband - still with a bandage on his ear - on stage then got a kiss on the cheek at the end of a historic night just days after he came within inches of losing his life.\n\nThe 77-year-old's 93-minute speech, a record in modern history, started by recounting the moment where he was within a 'quarter of an inch' of being killed and reliving the amount of blood that spilled on his face.\n\nBut after the somber opening of his address on 'unity', he returned to his trademark attacks on President Joe Biden, old enemies and his border and economic policies.\n\nHe joked about the 'late, great' Hannibal Lecter when riffing about immigration, said Kim Jong-un missed him and re-upped his promise to end taxes on tips from cheers from the crowd.\n\nIvanka, Don Jr., Eric, Tiffany and their significant others then came out on stage to cheers from the crowd as balloons fell from the arena's ceiling and Puccini's Nessun Dorma played.\n\nThe Trump grandkids tossed the red, white, blue and gold balloons around as they bounced on the stage.\n\nBut one family member was notably missing: the 6'7' Barron Trump.\n\nDonald and Melania Trump share a tender moment at the end of his Republican convention speech as his family joined him on stage\n\nBalloons rain down after Donald Trump's acceptance speech\n\nDonald Trump did mention his youngest son during his remarks but Barron was not seated in the family's box. He was originally selected as a convention delegate from Florida but Melania's office later announced Barron would not serve as he had a 'prior commitment.'\n\nHis absence was notable, particularly after he attended one of his father's campaign rallies earlier this month, where he stood and waved to the crowd.\n\nMelania has been fiercely protective of her only son throughout her husband's political career.\n\nBut Don Jr.'s and Eric's children were present. Kai Trump, 17, became the breakout star of the convention after she addressed the convention on Wednesday night, paying a sweet tribute to her grandfather.\n\nOn Thursday, it was the turn of Eric's daughter Carolina, four, as she stole the show when she sat on Trump's lap while Eric addressed the delegates.\n\nAt one point Carolina had her thumb in her mouth as her father spoke. Her older brother Eric Luke, 6, joined in on cheering on their dad as he sat on mom Lara's lap.\n\nDonald Trump, meanwhile, basked in the adoration of the delegates after he wrapped up his one hour and 32 minute speech.\n\nHe started off with a dramatic retelling of the assassination attempt on his life.\n\n'If I had not moved my head at that very last instant, the assassin's bullet would have perfectly hit its mark,' he said.\n\n'And I would not be here tonight. We would not be together.'\n\nThe nominee then rambled, going off the teleprompter, to slam Nancy Pelosi and name-check rival Joe Biden.\n\nThe delegates in the hall appeared restless with many taking their seats and taking out their phones. A few fell asleep.\n\nTrump failed to bring up abortion, an issue that has bedeviled Republicans ever since the U.S. Supreme Court struck down a federally guaranteed right to abortion two years ago.\n\nNor did he mention the insurrection at the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, in which Trump supporters tried to stop the certification of his loss to Democrat Joe Biden. Trump has long referred to the people jailed for the riot as 'hostages.'\n\nThey rallied for the grand finale however, roaring their approval as the Trump family took the stage to wave as balloons rained down around them.\n\nSince the assassination attempt on him on July 13th, Trump has had his family at his side.\n\nMost of them were on hand Thursday night to see him crowned as the Republican presidential nominee.\n\nHis children walked onto the convention floor with him.\n\nLater, Melania Trump, in a bright red skirt suit by Dior, made a dramatic entrance, walking into the arena to cheers and the music from Beethoven's symphony no. 9.\n\nShe was introduced to the roaring crowd as the future first lady.\n\nThe newly-anointed Republican nominee for president and his wife share a tender moment on stage after his marathon speech\n\nTrump appeared to be shocked when Melania came on stage at the end of his speech\n\nMelania smiles as the Donald leans in to give her a kiss while placing his hand on the lectern\n\nDonald Trump is joined on stage by his wife Melania, Republican vice presidential nominee J.D. Vance, Usha Chilukuri Vance, Donald Trump Jr., Kai Trump, Donald Trump III, and Spencer Trump\n\nDonald Trump and his wife Melania Trump are joined by the rest of the Trump family and Republican Vice Presidential nominee Sen. JD Vance and his wife Usha Vance\n\nMelania Trump joins Donald Trump on stage after his remarks\n\nTrump and Melania and running mate J.D. Vance and his wife Usha smile at the crowd after his speech\n\nOne of Trump's grandsons plays with the balloons at the conclusion of the Republican National Convention\n\nThe family affair was notable by the absence of Barron Trump\n\nMelania only joined the convention on its last night, taking her seat in the Trump family box shortly before Donald began his remarks.\n\nIvanka Trump and husband Jared Kushner also only attended on Thursday night, marking their first appearances in the campaign having stepped back from their key roles in the the former Apprentice host's inner political circle.\n\nIvanka has said that while she supports her father, she will not be campaigning for him.\n\nThe couple joined Don Jr. and Tiffany in the family box to sit with their father while Eric Trump addressed the crowd.\n\nBoth Don Jr. - who addressed the convention on Wednesday - and Eric have been surrogates on the campaign trail. Eric's wife Lara joined the leadership of Republican National Committee to help run the former president's re-election effort.\n\nThe former president was surrounded by his children and grandchildren as he prepared to address the delegates.\n\nHis family - except for Barron - was on hand while he spoke.\n\nMelania sat quietly during his speech, listening as he described the assassination attempt that nearly took his life. She smiled when he made little jokes but stared at her husband intently as he recounted the horrific event.\n\nDonald paid tribute to her during his remarks, calling her 'my amazing wife Melania.' She stood and waved as the crowd gave her a standing ovation.\n\n'Melania thank you very much. You also did something very beautiful. A letter to America calling for national unity,' he said.\n\nHe also thanked the rest of his family.\n\nDonald Trump's running mate J.D. Vance applauds and Melania smiles just as she arrives to take her seat\n\nTrump pumps his fist with his 17-year-old granddaughter Kai in the background\n\nThe Trump family, including some of his eleven grandchildren' swarm the stage to greet the cheering Milwaukee crowd\n\nThe traditional balloon dropped ended the convention\n\nDonald Trump after his acceptance speech\n\nThe delegates rose to their feet and cheered\n\nMelania, who rarely makes public statements, spoke to the horror when she realized her and son Barron's life were on the brink of 'devastating change' after the hearing the news about her husband's assassination attempt.\n\nThe former first lady called the gunman a 'monster' and described the moment she watched the bullet strike her husband's ear at a Pennsylvania rally in front of thousands of his adoring fans.\n\n'A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,' Melania said in an emotional statement on X on Sunday morning.\n\n'When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband.'\n\nShe called for people to 'reunite' and said she is thinking of her fellow Americans.\n\n'This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence,' her statement continued.\n\n'The winds of change have arrived. For those of you who cry in support, I thank you. I commend those of you who have reached out beyond the political divide - thank you for remembering that every single politician is a man or a woman with a loving family.'\n\nDonald Trump surrounded by his wife and children\n\nFormer President Donald Trump, Lara Trump, Eric Luke Trump, and Carolina Dorothy Trump watch Eric Trump address the convention\n\nAs Usha Chilukuri Vance, Ivanka Trump former first lady Melania Trump and Eric Trump watch, Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump and Republican vice presidential candidate Sen. JD Vance, R-Ohio, sign paperwork to officially accept the nomination\n\nJared Kushner, former White House senior adviser, Ivanka Trump, former White House senior adviser, Tiffany Trump and her husband Michael Boulos, attend the final day of the Republican National Convention\n\nMelania Trump makes her dramatic entrance into the convention\n\nProfessional wrestling icon Hulk Hogan wowed the crowd with a display of physical strength\n\nTrump barely mentioned Biden, often referring only to the 'current administration.'\n\n'It was Donald Trump who destroyed our economy, ripped away rights, and failed middle class families,' said Jen O'Malley Dillon, the Biden campaign chair, in a statement after the speech.\n\n'Now he pursues the presidency with an even more extreme vision for where he wants to take this country.'\n\nTrump's appearance came as Biden, the 81-year-old Democratic incumbent, clings to his party's presumptive nomination in the face of unrelenting pressure from key congressional allies, donors and even former President Barack Obama, who fear he may be unable to win reelection after his disastrous debate.\n\nHours before the balloons were scheduled to rain down on Trump and his family inside the convention hall, Biden deputy campaign manager Quentin Fulks appeared nearby in Milwaukee and insisted over and over that Biden would not step aside.\n\n'I do not want to be rude, but I don't know how many more times I can answer that,' Fulks told reporters. 'There are no plans being made to replace Biden on the ballot.'\n\nThursday's RNC program seemed designed to project strength and masculinity in an implicit rebuke of Biden.\n\nUltimate Fighting Championship President Dana White called Trump 'a real American bad ass.' Kid Rock performed a song with the chorus, 'Fight, fight!,' echoing the word Trump mouthed on stage in Pennsylvania as Secret Service agents surrounded him.\n\nAnd wrestling icon Hulk Hogan, marking his first appearance for Trump, he was not present during the 2016 campaign as he was in a period of exile after a video leaked of him using the N-word repeatedly in reference to a man who was dating his daughter, described the former president as 'an American hero.'\n\nAfter the convention, Trump heads to Detroit for a campaign rally on Saturday.\n\nIvanka Trump has said she supports her father but won't formally campaign for him.\n\nIt is unclear when or if Melania Trump will appear on the campaign trail.\n\nWhat Trump said about the July 13 assassination attempt\n\nTrump spoke at length about the assassination attempt on July 13\n\n'So many people have asked me what happened, and therefore, I'll tell you what happened, and you'll never hear it from me a second time, because it's too painful to tell.\n\nIt was a warm, beautiful day in the early evening in Butler Township in the great commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Music was loudly playing, and the campaign was doing well.\n\nI went to the stage, and the crowd was cheering wildly. I began speaking very happily because I was discussing the great job my administration did on immigration at the southern border.\n\nBehind me and to the right was a large screen that was displaying a chart of border crossings under my leadership.\n\nThe numbers were amazing. In order to see the chart, I started to turn to my right, and was ready to begin a further turn, which I'm lucky I didn't, when I heard a loud whizzing sound and felt something hit me, really hard, on my right ear.\n\nI said to myself, \"Wow, what was that -- it can only be a bullet,\" -- and moved my right hand to my ear, brought it down, and my hand was covered with blood.\n\nI immediately knew it was very serious, that we were under attack, and in one movement, proceeded to drop to the ground.\n\nBullets continued to fly as very brave Secret Service agents rushed to the stage and pounced on top of me for protection.\n\nThere was blood pouring everywhere, and yet, in a certain way I felt very safe, because I had God on my side.\n\nThe amazing thing is that prior to the shot, if I had NOT moved my head at the very last instant, the assassin's bullet would have perfectly hit its mark, and I would not be with you tonight.\n\nThe most incredible aspect of what took place on that terrible evening in the fading sun was seen later. In almost all cases, and when even a single bullet is fired -- and we had many -- crowds run for the exits or stampede, but not in this case.\n\nThis massive crowd of tens of thousands of people stood by and didn't move an inch. In fact, many of them bravely, but automatically, stood up looking for where the sniper would be, and then began pointing at him.\n\nNobody ran, and by not stampeding, many lives were saved. But that isn't the reason they didn't move -- the reason is that they knew I was in serious trouble, they saw all of the blood, and thought I was dead, and they just didn't want to leave me, and you can see that love written all over their faces.\n\nBullets were flying over us, yet I felt serene -- but now the Secret Service agents were putting themselves in peril. And then it all stopped. Our Secret Service sniper, from a much greater distance, and with only one bullet, took the assassin out.\n\nI am not supposed to be here tonight. I stand before you in this arena only by the grace of almighty God. Many people say it was a providential moment.\n\nWhen I rose, surrounded by Secret Service, the crowd was confused because they thought I was dead, and there was great sorrow on their faces until I raised my right arm, looked at the thousands of people that were breathlessly waiting, and started shouting FIGHT, FIGHT, FIGHT.\n\nOnce my clenched fist went up, high into the air, the crowd realized I was okay, and roared with pride for our country, like no crowd I have ever heard before.\n\nFor the rest of my life, I will be grateful for the love shown by that giant audience of patriots that stood bravely on that fateful evening in Pennsylvania.'", "source": {"uri": "expressdigest.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "expressdigest.com"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8233629913", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "13:56:41", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T13:56:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T13:56:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://www.deccanchronicle.com/world/americas/melania-trump-makes-rare-appearance-at-republican-national-convention-1811175", "title": "Melania Trump makes rare appearance at Republican National Convention", "body": "Milwaukee: Donald Trump's elusive wife Melania made a rare appearance at the Republican National Convention in support of his third bid for the White House, but broke with decades of tradition by not speaking at the high-profile event.Wearing Republican red, Melania, 54, walked, alone, into the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee on Thursday accompanied by classical music.\n\nShe has kept a low profile during her husband's 2024 White House bid. She had not been spotted in Milwaukee since the convention kicked off on Monday.\n\nLast week, Melania issued a statement calling for unity following an assassination attempt against Trump at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania.\n\n\"This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence. We all want a world where respect is paramount, family is first, and love transcends. We can realise this world again. Each of us must demand to get it back. We must insist that respect fills the cornerstone of our relationships again,\" she said in a statement.\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the convention arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the Republican nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the supporters of Trump.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honoured to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said during the acceptance speech to extended applause.\n\n\"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the attempt on his life.\n\nMelania later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his record 93-minute speech.\n\nIt is traditional at party conventions for the candidates' spouses to give a speech and tell heavily-scripted anecdotes about family life.\n\nOn Wednesday evening, Usha Vance - the wife of Trump's newly-minted running mate JD Vance - did just that. But Melania skipped delivering a speech.\n\nEver since her husband was first elected in 2016, Melania Trump has broken all the rules of normal American presidential politics.\n\nIn the White House during Trump's first term, she was a reclusive figure compared to other first ladies, focusing on a narrow set of interests.\n\nWith Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children.\n\nAnd since her husband left office, she has not been seen by her husband's side on many occasions.\n\nShe wasn't there when he had his mugshot taken in Atlanta. She wasn't there in New York when he became the first former president to be convicted of a crime. And she wasn't there when he officially won his party's presidential nomination, for the third time, on Monday.\n\nThe former first lady spoke in both 2020 and 2016 during Trump's presidential nomination. She was accused of borrowing from Michelle Obama's 2008 speech in her first appearance in 2016.", "source": {"uri": "deccanchronicle.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Deccan Chronicle"}, "authors": Son Eric provides update", "body": "Melania Trump has not been seen in public ever since her husband, Donald Trump, survived an assassination attempt at a Pennsylvania rally. She has not even been seen at the Republican National Convention, where other members of the Trump family were in attendance. As questions loomed over the former first lady's absence, she is now expected to appear at the Republican National Convention before it concludes.\n\nOn Wednesday, July 17, Trump's son Eric Trump revealed that both Melania and his sister Ivanka Trump will attend the convention on Thursday, July 18. Eric said that Melania and Ivanka would be \"in full force and effect\" at the convention. He added that the entire family is \"cohesive\" and is backing Trump.\n\n\"Ivanka's been an incredible supporter of my father. I think you know that; she's been in the White House for a four-year period of time and loves him dearly,\" Eric said in a conversation with CBS Mornings.\n\nMelania and Ivanka have been missing for most of Trump's 2024 campaign cycle, but it is Melania's absence from the public eye after the assassination attempt on her husband that surprised people. Other members of Trump's family joined him at the convention in the first few days, including Eric and his wife and GOP Lara Trump, Donald Trump Jr. and his fianc\u00e9e Kimberly Guilfoyle, Tiffany Trump and her husband Michael Boulos. Barron Trump, however, did not attend the event.\n\nMany called for Melania to speak at the convention, including libertarian political commentator Kennedy. In an article on Daily Mail, Kennedy blasted people with a lack of sympathy for Trump over his assassination attempt, and those who have been floating conspiracy theories.\n\nSpeaking of Melania, Kennedy wrote, \"As first lady, she intentionally steered clear of the political fray - keeping a low profile on the campaign trail and in the White House. According to her husband, she 'hates' political life - and what ordinary person wouldn't.\"\n\nKennedy then called out people who criticised Melania for her \"reluctance to get down and dirty in the partisan mud.\" \"They still seized on every opportunity to criticize her - whether it was over Christmas decorations or perceived fractures in her marriage. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior {"uri": "8232320519", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-18", "time": "19:06:24", "dateTime": "2024-07-18T19:06:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-18T19:05:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7137255072593689, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/melania-trump-shaken-husbands-shooting-185355786.html", "title": "Melania Trump, shaken by husband's shooting, to make rare RNC appearance", "body": "MILWAUKEE -- When Donald Trump formally accepts the Republican nomination on Thursday, he'll be joined by someone who is rarely seen on the campaign trail: His wife Melania.\n\nHer appearance in Milwaukee will mark her first major political appearance with Trump since he announced his 2024 campaign almost two years ago. But it also comes at a personally dark moment, just days after her husband survived an attempted assassination at a rally in Pennsylvania.\n\nThose close to Trump's family say the shooting deeply rattled Melania Trump, a private person who is also experiencing personal life changes beyond the shooting and her husband's campaign.\n\n\"I think she's shaken,\" said former Ambassador Ric Grenell at a Bloomberg event on Monday. Her 18-year-old son \"Barron goes to school this summer, so it's a difficult time for parents to go from having your child around all the time to leaving the nest.\"\n\nAnd then watching her husband almost be assassinated? \"I think it really shook her,\" he said.\n\nWhile the former president has been focused on his political and legal fate, Melania Trump has kept much of her life out of the public eye. She's spending time with her son and has remained involved in her business ventures while her husband travels around the country campaigning or sits in court. And she treasures her privacy.\n\nOn Thursday morning, a list of speakers for the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee did not include Melania Trump.\n\nThe former first lady hasn't remained completely out of politics. She headlined two fundraisers for the Log Cabin Republicans, a pro-LGBTQ+ rights Republican organization last spring. Both were held at Trump properties -- Mar-a-Lago and Trump Tower -- and were closed to the press. But she has not held any independent public campaign events or accompanied Trump at events out on the trail beyond a few private fundraisers and voting in Florida's primary. In December of last year, she did one solo public event at a naturalization ceremony at the National Archives in Washington.\n\nMelania Trump avoided accompanying her husband to his Manhattan criminal trial that centered around an alleged affair with a porn star and payments for her silence, which Trump denied. Hope Hicks, a longtime aide to Trump, testified at his trial that Trump at one time was concerned about what his wife might think of the scandal.\n\nThroughout the scandals over the years Melania Trump has provided some critical softening to her husband's rough exterior. In 2016 after the Access Hollywood tape scandal, she claimed he was \"egged on\" to say \"dirty and bad stuff\" back in 2005. And she defended her husband as a \"gentleman. He's kind. And I know he respects women.\"\n\nBut while she has been supportive of Trump, she has remained largely disinterested in politicking. Back in 2021, a Trump adviser said she would stand by her husband if he chose to run again for president but said, \"she's not going to have her own rallies. Did she ever?\"\n\nMelania Trump was never a major presence on the campaign trail. Even in 2016, she rarely joined her husband at rallies or events. Her reluctance to be in the spotlight, however, is a departure from other recent first ladies and candidate spouses, in particular Dr. Jill Biden, who is constantly at her husband's side and keeps a robust campaign schedule, sometimes acting as the public face of the campaign while her husband is in Washington.\n\n\"Melania Trump is completely an outlier on this. Not only Jill Biden, but Michelle Obama, Laura Bush, Barbara Bush, Hillary Clinton, there isn't an example of a first lady in the television era, who is this MIA during a convention. I know she's going to come, but usually at the conventions, they give a speech,\" said Kate Andersen Brower, the author of The Residence and First Women.\n\nRepublicans have complained that Melania Trump has been held to a different standard than her Democrat counterparts like Jill Biden or Michelle Obama. They point to the fact that Melania Trump, a former model, was never invited to appear on the cover of Vogue magazine, and she repeatedly said that coverage of her in the White House was \"unfair\" and \"vicious.\"\n\nWhile political spouses typically share personal anecdotes about their partner, other members of the Trump family have filled that role during the 2024 convention.\n\nTrump's daughter in law Lara Trump spoke on Tuesday. On Wednesday night, Kimberly Guilfoyle, Donald Trump Jr. and his daughter Kai Trump addressed the arena and Eric Trump is expected to speak on Thursday night.\n\nIvanka Trump and Jared Kushner and Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos are expected to attend on Thursday night but will not be speaking. Meanwhile Trump's 18-year-old son Barron Trump will not be attending the convention's final night in Milwaukee, according to a campaign official.\n\n\"We are all family who supports Donald Trump 100%, and anyone who is not fully out front, no one should ever assume that that means that they are any less supportive. We are 100% behind him as an entire family,\" Lara Trump told reporters at a Bloomberg event Tuesday.", "source": {"uri": "yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melania_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Melania Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milwaukee", "type": "loc", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Milwaukee"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "Milwaukee"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_of_John_F._Kennedy", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Assassination of John F. {"uri": "8232968462", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "06:39:40", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T06:39:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:39:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7137255072593689, "url": "https://wcfcourier.com/partners/ap/national/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appearance-on-the-republican-conventions-last-night/article_de9486a0-4927-55ec-a8bf-946ed8fe0933.html", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the Republican convention's last night", "body": "By JONATHAN J. COOPER - Associated Press\n\nMelania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nPeople are also reading... John Deere will lay off an undetermined number of salaried workers beginning next week One dead in early morning shooting in Hudson Interstate traffic shut down for person on bridge Waterloo day care operator charged with three counts of child endangerment One dead in lawnmower accident in rural Jesup Apartment hit in weekend shooting Man arrested for knife threats at Waterloo apartment building High School Baseball: Don Bosco wins substate thriller over Saint Ansgar Trump injured but 'fine' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Four injured in wrong-way crash UPDATE WITH NAME: One dead in tanker crash south of Hudson High School Baseball: Johnston survives Cedar Falls in 13-inning 4A substate classic Waterloo council votes 4-2 to allow for construction of tiny home Name released in Hudson fatal shooting Buchanan County Board of Adjustment denies music and arts festival permit\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n--\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. Son Eric provides big update", "body": "Melania Trump has remained out of the public eye since the attempted assassination of her husband, Donald Trump, at a rally in Pennsylvania. Her absence has been notable at the Republican National Convention (RNC), where other members of the Trump family have been present. Speculation about her whereabouts has been everywhere, but recent updates indicate she may appear at the convention before it ends.\n\nOn Wednesday, July 17, Eric Trump announced that Melania and his sister Ivanka Trump are scheduled to attend the RNC on Thursday, July 18. Eric assured Melania and Ivanka would be present \"in full force and effect.\" He emphasized that the entire Trump family remains united and supports Donald Trump.\n\n\"Ivanka has been an incredible supporter of my father. She was in the White House for four years and loves him dearly,\" Eric told CBS Mornings.\n\nCalls for Melania's RNC Appearance\n\nThroughout Donald Trump's 2024 campaign, both Melania and Ivanka have largely stayed out of the spotlight. Melania's prolonged absence, especially after the assassination attempt, has raised many eyebrows. While several Trump family members, including Eric and his wife Lara, Donald Trump Jr. and fianc\u00e9e Kimberly Guilfoyle, and Tiffany Trump with husband Michael Boulos, have made appearances at the RNC, Melania has remained absent. Barron Trump has also not attended the event.\n\nThere has been significant public demand for Melania to speak at the convention. Libertarian political commentator Kennedy, writing for the Daily Mail, criticized those lacking sympathy for Trump following the assassination attempt and those spreading conspiracy theories.\n\nRegarding Melania, Kennedy wrote, \"As first lady, she intentionally avoided political conflicts, keeping a low profile during the campaign and in the White House. According to her husband, she 'hates' political life - and who wouldn't?\" Kennedy condemned critics who attacked Melania for not engaging more politically, saying they took every chance to criticize her, from Christmas decorations to alleged marital issues. She added that some of the harshest critics even spread false rumors about her son, Barron.\n\nExpressing anticipation for Melania's appearance, Kennedy stated, \"I, for one, am looking forward to a possible Melania runaway appearance at the RNC on Thursday night - because if she speaks, it will be one of the only sane voices I've heard in some time.\"\n\nWhat Happens at the RNC and How Does It Work?\n\nThe RNC gathered approximately 2,400 delegates from across the United States to officially nominate Donald Trump as the party's candidate through a roll call vote. Each state announces the number of delegates they allocate to each candidate, following specific state party rules.\n\nTypically, the candidate's home state delegation, in Trump's case, Florida, will secure the nomination. However, this vote is largely ceremonial, as Trump clinched the nomination in March with 1,215 delegates and ultimately amassed 2,243 delegates by the end of the primary process, as reported by CBS News.\n\nOn Thursday night, Trump is expected to officially accept the nomination for the third time since 2016. Alongside the nomination process, the Republican Party will adopt a new platform, proposing a softened stance on abortion, and advocating for state-level decision-making on the issue. {"uri": "8233335946", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "10:45:04", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T10:45:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T10:44:42Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6980392336845398, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/galleries/article-13650783/Melania-Trump-joins-Donald-signs-paperwork-GOP-nominee.html", "title": "Melania Trump joins Donald as he signs paperwork to be GOP nominee", "body": "Melania Trump stunned the Republican convention crowd with dramatic entrance in a red skirt and to the soundtrack of Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 before her husband's marathon speech on Thursday night. The beaming former first lady walked onto the floor of the arena in Milwaukee, Wisconsin , to a roaring crowd as she made her way up to the VIP box and waved.\n\nAt the end of Donald Trump's remarks, she joined him on stage where they joined hands and he gave her a kiss on the cheek. The rest of the Trump family soon gathered around them as balloon's fell from the arena's ceiling and Puccini's Nessun Dorma played.\n\nBefore Trump began his remarks - clocking in at an hour and 32 minutes - Melania walked into the Trump family box to take a seat by J.D. Vance , her husband's vice presidential nominee. But Donald Trump had already exited the box to prepare to address the delegates. Despite her distain for politics, Melania seemed happy to be at the convention, smiling and waving to the delegates.\n\nThe Trumps were together earlier in the evening, however, when Melania, wearing Dior, watched Donald sign the paperwork for him to become the Republican presidential nominee. She then stayed behind the scenes until shortly before Donald was scheduled to speak. The former first lady did not join the rest of the Trump family in walking out into the convention hall.\n\nIvanka Trump , Don Jr ., and Tiffany were all with their father in the main box in the convention hall. They listened and cheered with the crowd while Hulk Hogan and Eric Trump fired up the delegates. The former president was surrounded by his children and grandchildren as he prepared to address the convention, which marks his formal acceptance of the nomination. But Melania, who has rarely appeared on the campaign trail, waited until the last moments before his remarks to join the family.\n\nMelania sat quietly when her husband spoke, listening as he described the assassination attempt that nearly took his life. She smiled when he made little jokes but stared at her husband intently as he recounted the horrific event. He paid tribute to her during his remarks, calling her 'my amazing wife Melania.' She stood and waved as the crowd gave her a standing ovation. 'Melania thank you very much. You also did something very beautiful. A letter to America calling for national unity,' he said.\n\nMelania did not address the delegates on Thursday night, despite being offered the chance to do so. She did speak to delegates at the 2016 and 2020 conventions but, this election year, she has stayed in the shadows while her husband runs for a second term.\n\nThursday was also Ivanka Trump's first night at the convention and also marked a rare political appearance. The former first daughter is there in her 'personal capacity' to support her father, sources close to her said. She has stayed away from politics since her father decided to run for a second term, despite previously being involved in his campaigns and his administration. Her brothers have stayed active. Both Don Jr. - who addressed the convention on Wednesday - and Eric have been surrogates on the campaign trail. Eric's wife Lara joined the Republican National Committee to help run the former president's re-election effort. The family has gathered around its patriarch since an assassin attempted to kill him on July 13th.\n\nMelania Trump, who rarely makes public statements, spoke to the horror when she realized her and son Barron's life were on the brink of 'devastating change' after the hearing the news about her husband's assassination attempt. The former first lady called the gunman a 'monster' and described the moment she watched the bullet strike her husband's ear at a Pennsylvania rally in front of thousands of his adoring fans. 'A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,' Melania said in an emotional statement on X on Sunday morning.\n\n'When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband.' She called for people to 'reunite' and said she is thinking of her fellow Americans. 'This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence,' her statement continued. 'The winds of change have arrived. For those of you who cry in support, I thank you. I commend those of you who have reached out beyond the political divide - thank you for remembering that every single politician is a man or a woman with a loving family.'\n\nWant more stories like this from the Daily Mail? {"uri": "2024-07-426363254", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-18", "time": "18:58:58", "dateTime": "2024-07-18T18:58:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-18T14:53:55Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://www.politico.com/news/2024/07/18/melania-trump-rnc-appearance-00169435", "title": "Melania Trump, shaken by husband's shooting, to make rare RNC appearance", "body": "Those close to Trump's family say the shooting deeply rattled Melania Trump, a private person who is also experiencing personal life changes beyond the shooting and her husband's campaign.\n\n\"I think she's shaken,\" said former Ambassador Ric Grenell at a Bloomberg event on Monday. Her 18-year-old son \"Barron goes to school this summer, so it's a difficult time for parents to go from having your child around all the time to leaving the nest.\"\n\nAnd then watching her husband almost be assassinated? \"I think it really shook her,\" he said.\n\nWhile the former president has been focused on his political and legal fate, Melania Trump has kept much of her life out of the public eye. She's spending time with her son and has remained involved in her business ventures while her husband travels around the country campaigning or sits in court. And she treasures her privacy.\n\nOn Thursday morning, a list of speakers for the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee did not include Melania Trump.\n\nThe former first lady hasn't remained completely out of politics. She headlined two fundraisers for the Log Cabin Republicans, a pro-LGBTQ+ rights Republican organization last spring. Both were held at Trump properties -- Mar-a-Lago and Trump Tower -- and were closed to the press. But she has not held any independent public campaign events or accompanied Trump at events out on the trail beyond a few private fundraisers and voting in Florida's primary. In December of last year, she did one solo public event at a naturalization ceremony at the National Archives in Washington.\n\nMelania Trump avoided accompanying her husband to his Manhattan criminal trial that centered around an alleged affair with a porn star and payments for her silence, which Trump denied. Hope Hicks, a longtime aide to Trump, testified at his trial that Trump at one time was concerned about what his wife might think of the scandal.\n\nThroughout the scandals over the years Melania Trump has provided some critical softening to her husband's rough exterior. In 2016 after the Access Hollywood tape scandal, she claimed he was \"egged on\" to say \"dirty and bad stuff\" back in 2005. And she defended her husband as a \"gentleman. He's kind. And I know he respects women.\"\n\nBut while she has been supportive of Trump, she has remained largely disinterested in politicking. Back in 2021, a Trump adviser said she would stand by her husband if he chose to run again for president but said, \"she's not going to have her own rallies. Did she ever?\"\n\nMelania Trump was never a major presence on the campaign trail. Even in 2016, she rarely joined her husband at rallies or events. Her reluctance to be in the spotlight, however, is a departure from other recent first ladies and candidate spouses, in particular Dr. Jill Biden, who is constantly at her husband's side and keeps a robust campaign schedule, sometimes acting as the public face of the campaign while her husband is in Washington.\n\n\"Melania Trump is completely an outlier on this. Not only Jill Biden, but Michelle Obama, Laura Bush, Barbara Bush, Hillary Clinton, there isn't an example of a first lady in the television era, who is this MIA during a convention. I know she's going to come, but usually at the conventions, they give a speech,\" said Kate Andersen Brower, the author of The Residence and First Women.\n\nRepublicans have complained that Melania Trump has been held to a different standard than her Democrat counterparts like Jill Biden or Michelle Obama. They point to the fact that Melania Trump, a former model, was never invited to appear on the cover of Vogue magazine, and she repeatedly said that coverage of her in the White House was \"unfair\" and \"vicious.\"\n\nWhile political spouses typically share personal anecdotes about their partner, other members of the Trump family have filled that role during the 2024 convention.\n\nTrump's daughter in law Lara Trump spoke on Tuesday. On Wednesday night, Kimberly Guilfoyle, Donald Trump Jr. and his daughter Kai Trump addressed the arena and Eric Trump is expected to speak on Thursday night.\n\nIvanka Trump and Jared Kushner and Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos are expected to attend on Thursday night but will not be speaking. Meanwhile Trump's 18-year-old son Barron Trump will not be attending the convention's final night in Milwaukee, according to a campaign official.\n\n\"We are all family who supports Donald Trump 100%, and anyone who is not fully out front, no one should ever assume that that means that they are any less supportive. {"uri": "8232967789", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "06:38:59", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T06:38:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:38:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://mcdowellnews.com/partners/ap/national/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appearance-on-the-republican-conventions-last-night/article_68d5369e-282d-5bc4-ad88-04a36baf6c64.html", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the Republican convention's last night", "body": "By JONATHAN J. COOPER - Associated Press\n\nMelania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nPeople are also reading... Roaming Buffalo Outpost moving from Rutherford Road to Marion's North Main Street McDowell leaders seek land for new animal shelter McDowell County to host country, bluegrass festivals in August McDowell County man charged with three counts of extortion 2 teens who died after crash during Greensboro police chase had just finished middle school. A 15-year-old also died. Picasso Keaton, a former WSSU football player, dies in a car crash McDowell ministry launches program to improve health of those in need Body found Sunday was Marion man; cause of death pending toxicology report McDowell High athlete appointed to NC Student-Athlete Advisory Council Marion councilman is delegate to Republican convention in Milwaukee Asheville hospital performs new heart procedure NC high school student on robotics trip drowns at Ocean Isle Beach McDowell softball player Sage Young commits to Lenoir-Rhyne What is DEI? Former Lenoir-Rhyne administrator talks about diversity, inclusion at university Trump injured but 'fine' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n--\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. The Inside Story", "body": "Did former first lady Melania Trump send a strong message to Donald Trump at the Republican National Convention where he was nominated as party nominee for the US Presidential Election 2024?She came, she saw, she did not conquer. Rather she shocked many people, including Republicans, present there. Former first lady Melania Trump received a grand welcome with classical music playing in the background and the crowd applauding her as she entered the Republican National Convention Thursday. But she broke the 30-year-old tradition of speaking on the stage and introducing the nominee for the US Presidential Election. Melania went straight to her seat and sat there silently, according to a report published in the MSN. Though she participated in the photo-ops and stood by the side of Donald Trump as he accepted the Republican nomination for the November 5 election, people present there did not miss the message she sent.\n\nBarbara Bush started the tradition of speaking at the RNC in 1992, she was followed by others. Melania Trump spoke at the RNC conventions of 2016 and 2020. The former model entered the event just before UFC CEO Dana White introduced Donald Trump before his address. She greeted Trump's running mate Senator JD Vance and his wife Usha. Melania also sat with them as the GOP nominee delivered his first speech since the assassination attempt at a campaign rally. Former president's daughter Ivanka Trump too did not speak at the convention. Unusually, a presidential nominee is not introduced by a spouse or family member.\n\nTrump thanked his wife for standing beside him when he was attacked. He said that he wanted to thank his entire family for being here, including Don, Kimberly, Ivanka and Jared, Eric and Lara, Tiffany and Michael, and Barron. The former model added the elements of drama and glamor as she smiled, waved, kissed and stood hand in hand with Donald Trump after he finished his acceptance speech. Her son Barron Trump did not attend the Republic National Convention though the Republican Party of Florida selected him to serve as one of the state's at-large delegates at the convention.\n\nWhich tradition did Melania Trump break at the Republic National Convention?\n\nMelania Trump broke the 30-year-old tradition of speaking on the stage and introducing the nominee for the US Presidential Election. Internewscast Journal", "body": "Donald Trump's family surrounded him on stage after he accepted the Republican nomination during a marathon speech recounting the horrifying moment he was shot by a would-be assassin.\n\nMelania Trump came up behind her husband - still with a bandage on his ear - on stage then got a kiss on the cheek at the end of a historic night just days after he was inches of losing his life.\n\nThe 77-year-old's 92-minute speech started by recounting the moment where he was within a 'quarter of an inch' of being killed and reliving the amount of blood that spilled on his face.\n\nBut after the sombre opening of his address on 'unity', he returned to his trademark attacks on President Joe Biden, old enemies and his border and economic policies.\n\nHe joked about the 'late, great' Hannibal Lecter when riffing about immigration, said Kim Jong-un missed him and re-upped his promise to end taxes on tips from cheers from the crowd.\n\nIvanka, Don Jr., Eric, Tiffany and their significant others then came out on stage to cheers from the crowd as balloons fell from the arena's ceiling and Puccini's Nessun Dorma played.\n\nThe Trump grandkids tossed the red, white, blue and gold balloons around as they bounced on the stage.\n\nBut one family member was notably missing: the 6'7' Barron Trump.\n\nThere was no sign of Barron Trump on Thursday, the last night of the Republican National Convention.\n\nDonald Trump mentioned his youngest son during his remarks but Barron was not seated in the family's box. He was originally selected as a convention delegate from Florida but Melania's office later announced Barron would not serve as he had a 'prior commitment.'\n\nHis absence was notable, particularly after he attended one of his father's campaign rallies earlier this month, where he stood and waved to the crowd.\n\nBut Don Jr.'s and Eric's children were present. Kai Trump, 17, addressed the convention on Wednesday night, paying a sweet tribute to her grandfather.\n\nAnd Eric's daughter Carolina, four, stole the show on Thursday when she sat on Donald Trump's lap while Eric addressed the delegates.\n\nAt one point Carolina had her thumb in her mouth as her father spoke. Her older brother Eric Luke, 6, joined in on cheering on their dad as he sat on mom Lara's lap.\n\nDonald Trump, meanwhile, basked in the adoration of the delegates after he wrapped up his one hour and 32 minute speech.\n\nHe started off with a dramatic retelling of the assassination attempt on his life but then rambled, going off the teleprompter, to slam Nancy Pelosi and name-check rival Joe Biden.\n\nThe delegates in the hall appeared restless with many taking their seats and taking out their phones. A few fell asleep.\n\nThey rallied for the grand finale however, roaring their approval as the Trump family took the stage to wave as balloons rained down around them.\n\nSince the assassination attempt on him on July 13th, Trump has had his family at his side.\n\nMost of them were on hand Thursday night to see him crowned as the Republican presidential nominee.\n\nHis children walked onto the convention floor with him.\n\nLater, Melania Trump, in a bright red skirt suit by Dior, made a dramatic entrance, walking into the arena to cheers and the music from Beethoven's symphony no. 9.\n\nShe was introduced to the roaring crowd as the future first lady.\n\nMelania Trump only joined the convention on its last night, taking her seat in the Trump family box shortly before Donald began his remarks.\n\nIvanka Trump and husband Jared Kushner also only attended on Thursday night. The couple joined Don Jr. and Tiffany in the family box to sit with their father while Eric Trump addressed the crowd.\n\nThe former president was surrounded by his children and grandchildren as he prepared to address the delegates.\n\nHis family - except for Barron - was on hand while he spoke.\n\nMelania sat quietly during his speech, listening as he described the assassination attempt that nearly took his life. She smiled when he made little jokes but stared at her husband intently as he recounted the horrific event.\n\nDonald paid tribute to her during his remarks, calling her 'my amazing wife Melania.' She stood and waved as the crowd gave her a standing ovation.\n\n'Melania thank you very much. You also did something very beautiful. A letter to America calling for national unity,' he said.\n\nHe also thanked the rest of his family.\n\nMelania and Ivanka have stayed away from politics since Donald decided to run for a second term.\n\nBut both Don Jr. - who addressed the convention on Wednesday - and Eric have been surrogates on the campaign trail. Eric's wife Lara joined the Republican National Committee to help run the former president's re-election effort.\n\nThe family has gathered around its patriarch since an assassin attempted to kill him on July 13th.\n\nMelania Trump, who rarely makes public statements, spoke to the horror when she realized her and son Barron's life were on the brink of 'devastating change' after the hearing the news about her husband's assassination attempt.\n\nThe former first lady called the gunman a 'monster' and described the moment she watched the bullet strike her husband's ear at a Pennsylvania rally in front of thousands of his adoring fans.\n\n'A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,' Melania said in an emotional statement on X on Sunday morning.\n\n'When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband.'\n\nShe called for people to 'reunite' and said she is thinking of her fellow Americans.\n\n'This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence,' her statement continued.\n\n'The winds of change have arrived. For those of you who cry in support, I thank you. I commend those of you who have reached out beyond the political divide - thank you for remembering that every single politician is a man or a woman with a loving family.'\n\nAfter the convention, Trump heads to Detroit for a campaign rally on Saturday.\n\nIvanka Trump has said she supports her father but won't formally campaign for him.\n\nIt is unclear when or if Melania Trump will appear on
