They were joined by their family, Vice President candidate JD Vance, and his spouse Usha Chilukuri at the Republican National Convention.\n\nShe wore a tailored red suit jacket and skirt as she walked out after the Trump family and Erik Trump's speech.\n\nThe former first lady joined all of Trump's children, their spouses, and their young children as they await for him to take the stage.\n\nDuring Trump's first speech since his assassination attempt on Saturday, the former president turned the attention to Melania.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" he said.\n\nIt comes as:\n\nShe got a standing ovation from the crowd as she rose and waved from the family box.\n\nTrump also thanked his wife for her letter to the American people after the shooting which he said \"took the Republican party by surprise.\"\n\nBREAKING TRADITION\n\nMelania was asked to speak at the convention, but she declined the offer, sources told CNN.\n\nShe had previously spoken at the RNC, introducing Trump in 2016 and 2020.\n\nInstead, Dana White, the CEO of Ultimate Fighting Championship, will introduce Donald Trump before his big speech at the RNC on Thursday night.\n\nDeclining to give an introduction speech for Trump breaks the traditional order of political events.\n\nIn the past, the candidate's husband or wife makes a speech to humanize them and share personal anecdotes.\n\nKEY TO SUCCESS\n\nDespite being present at this event, Melania has opted to distance herself from Trump's third presidential campaign. She has been seen at only two political events since the beginning of the campaign.\n\nShe attended the kickoff event in November 2022 at their Mar-a-Lago home in Palm Beach, Florida, and was also seen voting with Trump during the Florida presidential primary in March 2024.\n\nMelania missed the first two days of the RNC, but attendees are hoping to get a glimpse of her on Thursday night.\n\n\"I hope we'll see Melania this week,\" Marietta Bailey of West Bend, Wisconsin, told The U.S. Sun.\n\n\"I get all of my inspiration and fashion from her, she's amazing. An icon.\"\n\nAnother person said her appearance at the three-day event would be important to Trump's campaign.\n\n\"It would be nice to see her because it shows she would be invested in this election cycle,\" said Amy Jamieson from Chicago.\n\n\"I think we'll have to wait and see. It was nice to see prominent members of his family with him Monday.\"\n\nJamieson said she watched Trump make the \"emotional walk\" across the during his first appearance since the assassination attempt that rocked the world at one of his rallies in Butler, Pennsylvania.\n\nThe former president moved at the last moment narrowly missing a bullet aimed for his head, leaving him with a bloodied ear.\n\nJamieson was impressed by his strength and determination to walk on stage in front of thousands only days after the terrifying incident.\n\n\"I think we want somebody who's strong to get back on the horse and get going and that's what he did last night,\" she said.\n\n\"So, if Melania shows up, I think that would be just a little bit better.\"\n\n\"I can't imagine what it would be like to be married to the president, and having that traumatic event that happened this weekend,\" said Kathleen Hoban from Sussex, Wisconsin.\n\n\"I think, for her to come here and support him would be one of the biggest benefits to his nomination, and I think they really need to step in together as a family.\"\n\n'MONSTER'\n\nFollowing the assassination attempt, Melania released a statement on Sunday on X.\n\nIn her lengthy letter that called for unity across parties and the remembrance of love, she slammed the gunman 20-year-old Thomas Crooks, branding him a \"monster.\"\n\nShe also accused him of trying to \"ring out Donald's passion.\"\n\n\"His laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration. The core facets of my husband's life - his human side - were buried below the political machine,\" she wrote.\n\n\"Donald, the generous and caring man who I have been with through the best of times and the worst of times.\"\n\nShe then spoke about how differing opinions and politics are \"inferior to love.\"\n\n\"Our personal, structural, and life commitment - until death - is a serious risk,\" she shared.\n\n\"Political concepts are simple when compared to us, human beings.\"\n\nShe added, \"Let us remember that when the time comes to look beyond the left and the right, beyond the red and the blue, we all come from families with the passion to fight for a better life together, while we are here, in this earthly realm.\"\n\nMelania also mentioned change at the start and end of her statement -- she wrote \"devastating change\" and \"the winds of change.\"\n\nPeople close to the Trump family shared with Politico that Melania was deeply unnerved after the shooting.\n\n\"I think she's shaken,\" former Ambassador Richard Grenell said at a Bloomberg event, per Politico.\n\n\"Barron goes to school this summer, so it's a difficult time for parents to go from having your child around all the time to leaving the nest.\"", "source": {"uri": "internewscast.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Internewscast Journal"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_of_John_F._Kennedy", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Assassination of John F. {"uri": "8232961629", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "06:33:36", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T06:33:36Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:33:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6627451181411743, "url": "https://heraldcourier.com/partners/ap/national/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appearance-on-the-republican-conventions-last-night/article_e1febea7-c128-51ab-8cbe-8b79b60730f6.html", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the Republican convention's last night", "body": "By JONATHAN J. COOPER - Associated Press\n\nMelania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nPeople are also reading... Despite fame and fortune, Loggins was \"still from Bristol\" Kings Dominion gets approval to build new roller coaster Kilgore remembered as \"larger than life\" trailblazer HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL: Coaching innovator Mumme to serve on Sullivan East coaching staff Bristol Casino records solid $14.35M month during June BHC GIRLS BASKETBALL COACH OF YEAR: Funk found redemption at Eastside Bristol's Loggins had a massive musical impact Southern Gap Outdoor Adventure Unveils New Entrance Sign Shanghai Restaurant remains a downtown landmark BHC BOYS BASKETBALL COACH OF YEAR: Bearcats reload, reach first state finals in 64 years LOCALS IN THE PROS NOTES: Cole Harness (Eastside) pitching and hitting in Pecos League; Hunter Stratton (Sullivan East) begins injury rehab stint with Pirates; Greg Duncan (UVa-Wise) gets first Mexican League win Blood Eagle to offer unique, fine dining experience Virginia man stopped woman from opening plane's emergency door PREP BASEBALL: Porter Gobble (John Battle) and Hayden Reed (Abingdon) team to fire four-hitter, Landon Turman (Abingdon) scores winning run as West earns spot in Gold Medal game at Commonwealth Games LITTLE LEAGUE: Saturday's State Tournament Results\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n--\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. Donald Trump Jr. and Eric attended the convention with other family members.While Melania Trump did not attend any event this year, she arrived at the Republican National Convention and supported Donald Trump on Thursday. The former first lady and her stepdaughter joined Donald Trump on stage at the Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, wearing matching red and white outfits. Eric said that Ivanka has been a great supporter and that the family has stayed very close during their political careers.\n\nFrom 2017 to 2021, Ivanka Trump acted as a top counselor to Donald Trump during his administration. It was clear that she supported her father during the RNC by standing by him. Jared Kushner, Ivanka's husband, and Tiffany Trump, the youngest of Donald Trump's daughters, were also present in the crowd.\n\nAs per the reports of 'Page Six', Donald Trump Jr. brought his daughter Kai Trump with him to the RNC as well. Kai, a seventeen-year-old, stood up to show her support for her grandpa. She seemed as inscrutable and distant as ever.\n\nShe joined him on stage after his lengthy acceptance speech, walking to the podium just before balloons rained down on thousands in the crowd. Donald Trump greeted her with a hug and the pair shared a kiss on the cheek.\n\nHe then grabbed her hand and walked across the stage as other members of the Trump family joined them.\n\nEver since her husband was first elected in 2016, Melania Trump has broken all the rules of normal American presidential politics.\n\nIn the White House during Trump's first term, she was a reclusive figure compared to other first ladies, focusing on a narrow set of interests. The US national archives descibes her as having been an \"ambassador for kindness\" and an advocate for children's issues.\n\nAnd since her husband left office, she has refused to be seen by her husband's side on many occasions when the public would expect her to be present.\n\nShe wasn't there when he had his mugshot taken in Atlanta. She wasn't there in New York when he became the first former president to be convicted of a crime. And she wasn't there when he officially won his party's presidential nomination, for the third time, on Monday.\n\nFollow live updates on this story\n\nFive takeaways from Trump's convention speech\n\nWatch: 'It can only be a bullet' - Trump describes moment he was shot at\n\nRepublicans put abortion disagreements aside at 'unity' convention\n\nThe Trump family: A guide to an American dynasty\n\n\"Melania does what Melania wants,\" said Mary Jordan, who wrote The Art of her Deal, a biography on the former first lady. \"She is fiercely independent and won't do something just because other people do it. She doesn't feel any obligation to do it.\"\n\nWe are now all accustomed to the fact that she doesn't turn up at many of Donald Trump's events, but on Monday, when he walked into the arena here in Milwaukee to a roaring welcome, greeted like a Messiah after his survival of the assassination attempt, her absence felt particularly obvious.\n\nIt was certainly noticed by the Republicans gathered here, but that didn't mean they weren't excited for her appearance, when it finally came.\n\nMelania is the most enigmatic first lady in modern history and we rarely hear what she thinks.\n\nAn exception was the lengthy statement she released after the shooting targeting her husband, which read as though she may have dictated it directly.\n\n\"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,\" she said.\n\n\"The core facets of my husband's life - his human side - were buried below the political machine. Donald, the generous and caring man who I have been with through the best of times and the worst of times.\"\n\nIt is traditional at party conventions for the candidate's spouse to give a speech and tell heavily-scripted anecdotes about family life.\n\nOn Wednesday evening, Usha Vance - the wife of Trump's newly-minted running mate JD Vance - did just that. She called her husband a \"meat and potatoes\" man, but - in an apparent sign of his devotion - said he now cooked her Indian vegetarian food.\n\nAnd while Donald Trump's oldest son Don Jr, middle son Eric, daughter-in-law Lara and granddaughter Kai have all spoken at this convention, Melania has declined the opportunity to speak. She very clearly does not do anything she does not want to do.\n\nWhen she did introduce her husband at the 2016 convention when he first ran for president - things went horribly wrong.\n\nShe was criticised for plagiarising the speech Michelle Obama gave in 2008 when she introduced her husband Barack at the Democratic convention. Melania's speechwriter later accepted the blame.\n\nFirst ladies are always heavily scrutinised for the image they project, the causes they adopt, and the clothes they wear.\n\nBut Melania Trump is the first who was previously a professional model. She looks fabulous in photographs and is well aware of the power of her image. By offering so few photo opportunities, she makes each one infinitely more powerful.\n\n\"She is very savvy and has cultivated the mystery woman mystique by going underground and then when she does come out, it's a much bigger deal,\" says Ms Jordan.\n\n\"She doesn't appear very often, but she does show up when Donald Trump really needs her.\"\n\nAfter Saturday's attempt on his life, Melania felt MIA. But on Thursday night, as she slowly walked the stairs to the VIP section, paused at the top and waved to all corners of the arena, she showed her mastery of the power of an image.\n\nHer absence may, at times, be her strength.\n\nWhat Republicans want from a second Trump presidency\n\nLara Trump's meteoric rise signals changing of Trump family guard", "source": {"uri": "aol.com", "dataType": {"uri": "8232970689", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "06:41:52", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T06:41:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:41:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6549019813537598, "url": "https://lacrossetribune.com/partners/ap/national/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appearance-on-the-republican-conventions-last-night/article_5edd0240-1a7d-51a7-8dd2-9d318d0a817a.html", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the Republican convention's last night", "body": "By JONATHAN J. COOPER - Associated Press\n\nMelania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nPeople are also reading... Steve Cahalan: Pastissimo closing Sunday in La Crosse, moving to Texas La Crosse woman arrested after Onalaska traffic stop on drug trafficking charges Steve Cahalan: Melrose gets an event center; La Crosse Aldi store opening date set UW-La Crosse faculty committee recommends Joe Gow to be fired from tenured position on campus Police standoff with 33-year-old man wanted for child sexual assault ends peacefully with arrest RNC: Trump campaign upset with empty Wisconsin delegate floor seats One dead after head-on collision on Highway 93 near Arcadia Baseball: Viroqua community mourns loss of legendary coach Pete Swanson Anti-war protester arrested after confrontation with US Rep. Derrick Van Orden in Milwaukee Massive expansion of MSP airport will bring with it years of demolitions and disruptions UPDATE: Motorcyclist who died in rural De Soto crash identified Steve Cahalan: New South Side Aldi store to open July 25 in La Crosse 'Slow, long crunch and then a bang': Neighbor hears car crash through roof of La Crescent garage Felony charge for man who allegedly punched off-duty officer in La Crosse Tavern owners celebrate 'Old Style Day' in La Crosse with beer's return to City Brewery\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n--\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. Vance as his running mate, a new addition to the inner circle.\n\n\"He couldn't choose one of his sons or daughters or daughter-in-law, that just wouldn't work, of course,\" Natasha Lindstaedt, a political scientist at the University of Essex, told AFP.\n\n\"J.D. Vance and Don Jr. are very close. So he chose someone that maybe reminds him of his son or is close to his son,\" she said.\n\nA notable absence on the campaign trail this year, however, has been former first lady Melania Trump, who has been all but invisible throughout Trump's rallies and protracted court appearances.\n\n- Where is Melania? -\n\nIn a marked break from precedent, Melania has been largely absent in recent months from her husband's political life, with the notable exception of a fiery statement after an attempted assassination attempt on him on Saturday.\n\nIn this file photo, former president Donald Trump and his first lady Melania Trump meet Indian prime minister Narendra Modi on February 24, 2020\n\nPrior to that, however, she had spoken sparingly and not accompanied her husband during court appearances in a case that saw him convicted of covering up hush money payments made to porn star Stormy Daniels, who alleged she had a sexual encounter with the real estate tycoon.\n\n\"She's a complete enigma,\" Lindstaedt said, adding that the former model did not \"play the typical role\" of a former first lady.\n\n\"Although she seemed to share similar views to Trump on a lot of issues, not on all, but on a lot of issues, she has a very conservative world view, she doesn't seem to care that much what people think and kind of does her own thing.\"\n\n- Three generations -\n\nThe rest of Trump's family has offered the former president a way to soften his image in the aftermath of the recent convictions and other legal woes.\n\nHis eldest granddaughter, 17-year-old Kai Trump, spoke at the RNC Wednesday night to describe the \"very caring and loving\" patriarch.\n\nTrump's eldest granddaughter, 17-year-old Kai Trump, spoke at the RNC Wednesday night to describe the \"very caring and loving\" patriarch\n\n\"He's just a normal grandpa, he gives us candy and soda when our parents aren't looking,\" she said.\n\nThe teenage daughter of Donald Jr. spoke of their shared love of golf, even when the former president tries to psych her out when playing against her.\n\n\"I don't let him get to me, but I have to remind him I'm a Trump, too,\" she said.\n\n- Nepotism -\n\nLike wagons hitched to their father's train, Donald Jr., Eric and Ivanka have been pulled along to success, along with their friends and families.\n\nLindstaedt pointed to two examples of Trump spouses achieving power: Eric Trump's wife Lara Trump, who was recently appointed co-chair of the Republican National Committee, and Ivanka's husband Jared Kushner, who Trump appointed as an advisor and entrusted with figuring out peace in the Middle East.\n\nEric Trump's wife Lara Trump was recently appointed co-chair of the Republican National Committee\n\n\"Suddenly people who have no expertise, no training, no ethics training, maybe they're not even going properly through security clearances, are given access to the most powerful positions,\" Lindstaedt said.\n\n\"And we see when this happens in non-democracies and the dictatorships, how it usually goes very badly.\"\n\nNatalie Koch, who researches geopolitics and authoritarianism at Syracuse University, said Trump's nepotism is nothing new.\n\n\"The Trump organization is a family business, but once he took office the first time, and then you could really see that he brought that into the political realm and into the White House,\" Koch told AFP.\n\n- Children's roles -\n\nEach of Trump's children has been entrusted with different duties during this campaign.\n\nDon Jr., the eldest at age 46, is a big proponent of his father's far-right \"Make America Great Again\" (MAGA) ideology.\n\nSpeaking at the Republican National Convention, he extolled the image of his father raising his fist after the assassination attempt last weekend.\n\nIvanka, 42, had played a role in Trump's administration but has since devoted herself to personal matters.\n\nEric, 40, has doubled down on Trump's claims that the 2020 election was rigged. {"uri": "8232961188", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "06:33:16", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T06:33:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T06:32:34Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6431372761726379, "url": "https://napavalleyregister.com/partners/ap/national/former-first-lady-melania-trump-makes-a-rare-appearance-on-the-republican-conventions-last-night/article_c5d30dd3-27c1-5c07-8fe2-c40f3414a77c.html", "title": "Former first lady Melania Trump makes a rare appearance on the Republican convention's last night", "body": "By JONATHAN J. COOPER - Associated Press\n\nMelania Trump and Ivanka Trump were at the Republican National Convention Thursday, making a rare appearance in support of former President Donald Trump's third bid for president.\n\nThe former first lady and the former president's eldest daughter have largely steered clear of the campaign trail this year, a contrast with Trump's 2016 and 2020 campaigns when both played a larger role. Neither gave speeches.\n\nMelania Trump's presence helps the Republican Party show widespread unity, a theme that emerged prominently after the attempt on Trump's life last weekend. A day after the attack, Melania issued a statement calling on Americans to \"ascend above hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence.\"\n\nPeople are also reading... Customers are raving about Moulin -- downtown Napa's new caf\u00e9 and bakery $400K in unpaid bills for grapes lead to slew of lawsuits against Napa winemaker Letter: Concerns about St. Helena Agritourism Initiative Fight between Le Petit Elephant and Alta Heights neighbors gets personal Vallejo man dies, Napan hurt in Highway 29 crash Ryan Seacrest's Napa County home up for sale at $22 million Napa City Council votes to sell Dwight Murray Plaza, other downtown land to developers Napa City Council to weigh selling land for downtown development Why is that? Here's the lowdown on some Napa head-scratchers Trump injured but 'fine' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Napa County, Hoopes winery file closing arguments in legal clash Report: Visit Napa Valley staff allege toxic comments, secrecy by CEO Gallagher 2023-24 Napa County Boys Soccer Player of the Year: Avi\u00f1a did it all for first-time section champ Calistoga One lane of southbound Highway 221 closing in south Napa for Soscol Junction work Authorities hunt for clues, but motive of man who tried to assassinate Donald Trump remains elusive\n\nCampaigns often use spouses and families to humanize a candidate, but with Melania Trump taking a backseat this year, that job fell to other speakers, who painted a sympathetic portrait of Trump by sharing anecdotes of warm interactions between him and their children. Trump's 17-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump, called him \"just a normal grandfather.\"\n\nTrump's family, minus Melania, entered the arena after Trump signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination. They went to the family box and stood throughout a boisterous speech by the wrestler Hulk Hogan.\n\nMelania entered later, smiling and waving to the crowd as she walked alone into the arena and up a flight of stairs to take her seat next to vice presidential nominee JD Vance. She wore a red skirt suit as Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 played.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania,\" Trump said to extended applause. \"And Melania, thank you very much.\"\n\nHe said she \"did something really beautiful\" when she wrote her statement pleading for unity after the shooting.\n\nMelania Trump later joined Trump on stage, startling him as she walked up behind him after his 93-minute speech, then whispered in his ear. The rest of the Trump family joined and balloons fell from the ceiling, an iconic tradition of political conventions. Some of Trump's younger grandchildren, big smiles on their faces, batted balloons with their hands and feet.\n\nAs the family lingered on stage for 20 minutes, Melania Trump stood by Trump's side being quietly affectionate, touching her husband's arm at times and sometimes chatting with Vance and his wife, Usha Vance.\n\nTrump's two oldest sons, Donald Trump Jr., and Eric Trump, both spoke to delegates this week, as did their partners, Kimberly Guilfoyle and Lara Trump, respectively. Daughter Tiffany Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, were at the convention but did not speak. The president's youngest child, 18-year-old Barron Trump, did not appear at the convention. He declined an invitation to be a Florida delegate.\n\nMelania Trump has skipped key moments of her husband's campaign, including rallies and primary-night victory parties. She did not join him in court as he faced trial over hush money payments to a porn star or for his remarks responding to the guilty verdict.\n\nIvanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, held senior roles on Donald Trump's White House staff but did not attend Trump's 2022 announcement that he planned another presidential campaign.\n\n\"While I will always love and support my father, going forward I will do so outside the political arena,\" Ivanka Trump said in a statement at the time.\n\n--\n\nCooper reported from Phoenix.\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. {"uri": "8232719281", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "02:39:24", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T02:39:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T02:38:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6392157077789307, "url": "https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/melania-trump-rnc-trump-1235063752/", "title": "Melania Shows Up at RNC to Remind Everyone That Trump Has a Wife", "body": "After months of conspicuous absence from public life, former First Lady Melania Trump made a rare appearance at the Republican National Convention on Thursday.\n\nIn a break with longstanding precedent among former first ladies and the wives of presidential hopefuls, Melania did not address the convention -- as she did in 2016 and 2020 (the 2020 speech was made from the White House as Covid-19 prevented an in-person convention). She did stride through the arena in Milwaukee, though, getting a few minutes of screen time as classic music played.\n\nKid Rock performed an abrasive \"Fight! Fight!\" song shortly after Melania took her seat in the former president's box. It's unclear if Trump was still in the box when Melania arrived, although the two were photographed together backstage.\n\nHer appearance comes days after Trump survived an assassination attempt at a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, on Saturday. The former president continued sporting a bandage on Thursday, covering the wound where the would-be assassin's bullet grazed his right ear.\n\nIn response to the shooting, Melania issued a rare public statement. \"When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change.\" she wrote. \"Let us remember that when the time comes to look beyond the left and the right, beyond the red and the blue, we all come from families with the passion to fight for a better life together, while we are here, in this earthly realm.\"\n\nThe former first lady has largely disengaged from her husband's political life since leaving the White House. Melania has not made an appearance alongside her husband at a political event since April. The last time she attended anything resembling a campaign rally was in November 2022, when the former president formally announced his bid for reelection.\n\nMelania was notably absent throughout Trump's hush-money trial and conviction, which took place between April and May, despite the parade of other family members and political figures who descended upon the Manhattan courthouse to show solidarity with the former president.\n\nSeveral other Trump family members delivered speeches at the convention, including Donald Trump Jr., Don Jr.'s long-term fianc\u00e9 Kimberly Guilfoyle and his daughter Kai Trump, Eric Trump, Eric's wife and RNC Chairwoman Lara Trump. {"uri": "2024-07-426567437", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "01:11:03", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T01:11:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T00:38:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6392157077789307, "url": "https://www.seattletimes.com/nation-world/nation-politics/ever-elusive-melania-trump-is-expected-to-appear-at-gop-convention/", "title": "Ever elusive, Melania Trump is expected to appear at GOP convention", "body": "MILWAUKEE -- The Republican National Convention has been chockablock with Trumps.\n\nLara Trump, the co-chair of the Republican Party and Donald Trump's daughter-in-law, delivered a keynote address. Her husband, Eric, has made the rounds on cable news. Another Trump son, Donald Trump Jr., spoke for 19 minutes Wednesday night, long enough even to hand the mic to his teenage daughter, Kai.\n\nAnd yet, where is Melania?\n\nDonald Trump's wife has remained out of sight. She has not been in the VIP box where Trump has presided over the prime-time show each night. She has not been on television. She is sparsely featured in the videos played for delegates between speakers and in the photos plastered on the arena's walls.\n\nMelania Trump is set to appear Thursday as her husband delivers his acceptance speech on the convention's final night. But, in a break from tradition, she is not expected to speak. (Other Trumps are likely to make their first appearances, too: Ivanka, the former president's daughter who is keeping a distance from his current campaign, and Barron, 18, Donald Trump's youngest son.)\n\nAt this celebration of all things Trump, nobody knows quite what to make of this.\n\nScott Walker, the former governor of Wisconsin, speculated Wednesday from the floor of the convention hall that it is probably just \"too overwhelming\" for Melania Trump, given the assassination attempt on her husband Saturday. \"I think it's going to be emotional even to be with him,\" Walker said, \"let alone speak.\"\n\nAsked about the former first lady Tuesday, Matt Schlapp, a former White House aide, shrugged. \"I don't know whether she's coming or not,\" he said. \"Melania has always taken full measure of her ability to have private time for as long as possible. I know that she's completely behind this campaign.\"\n\nMelania Trump has been disappearing from view for a while now. She did not show up at her husband's trial for falsifying business records to cover up hush payments to Stormy Daniels, a porn actor who claimed to have had a tryst with him while his wife was home with a newborn. So far in this campaign, Melania Trump has done two fundraisers with gay Republicans, but little else.\n\n\"Melania will be out whenever it's appropriate for her,\" Lara Trump said in an interview with The New York Times last week. \"Just because people are not overtly out front with banners or signs or whatever it might be, doesn't mean they are not 100% on board.\"\n\nMelania Trump was overtly out front at the last two Republican conventions.\n\nIn 2016, she gave a speech that plagiarized chunks of a Michelle Obama speech. In 2020, when the country was being rocked by COVID-19 and unrest after the death of George Floyd, Melania Trump delivered a speech from the Rose Garden that was seen as more compassionate than anything at that convention. \"I know many people are anxious, and some feel helpless,\" she said then. \"I want you to know that you are not alone.\"\n\nOrdinarily, wives play a central role at these conventions, humanizing their spouse. Donald Trump has relied on his son's wife and former aides to do that this time around.\n\n\"Last night, when we heard Lara, she told us a lot of things that we already knew about Donald, but we didn't know his personal side, his family side, how compassionate he really is,\" a Nebraska delegate, Mary Gerdes, said Wednesday. Did she think it was odd that the candidate's wife seemed to want nothing to do with this convention? \"It would've been great to hear from her,\" Gerdes said, \"but she's had a rough week.\"\n\nAfter Ronald Reagan was shot in 1981, Nancy Reagan rushed to the emergency room to be by his side, spending the next 13 days at the hospital with him. (\"Honey, I forgot to duck,\" Ronald Reagan told his wife.)\n\nDonald Trump's wife was not by his side for his first public appearance since the shooting here Monday. She did put out a letter, though. \"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion,\" she wrote, citing her husband's \"laughter\" and his \"love of music.\"\n\nOn Wednesday night, Trump chose to walk out onto the convention floor to James Brown's \"It's a Man's Man's Man's World\" (it was the version featuring Luciano Pavarotti).\n\nThis is a man's world, but it wouldn't be nothing, nothing without a woman or a girl.\n\nA little while later, the founder of Turning Point USA, Charlie Kirk, watched as Kai Trump spoke onstage. At this introduction of yet another Trump, Kirk smiled and remarked that \"this political dynasty goes a lot longer than liberals realize.\"\n\nMelania Trump's role in that dynasty, however, continues to be a mystery. Kirk, asked if he thought she would join her husband in the White House if he won in November, wouldn't even speculate. \"I have no idea.\"", "source": {"uri": "seattletimes.com", "dataType": "news", The former first lady was not mentioned on the list of speakers at the RNC for Thursday, but later made her official entrance to the convention floor.\n\nWearing a red suit, Melania smiled and waved to supporters, before joing her husband and Vance in the box as the appplause continued.\n\nSpeculation about Melania's whereabouts have swirled for days, and she has yet to be pictured at the convention which has been running since Monday. Other members of the Trump family have been pictured on the convention floor, and in the box with their father.\n\nThe former president was later pictured dancing alongside his young grandchildren Spencer and Chloe, the children of Donald Jr. He also spent time with Luke and Carolina - the children of Lara and Eric Trump.\n\nMelania's entrance in Milwaukee marks her first major political appearance with Trump since he announced his 2024 campaign almost two years ago.\n\nSources told Politico that the former first lady, who is a deeply private person, was deeply shaken by the shocking assassination attempt.\n\nShortly following the incident on Saturday during a campaign rally in Butler Pennsylvania, she released a statement in which she described would-be-assassin as a \"monster.\"\n\n\"When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of devastating change. I am grateful to the brave secret service agents and law enforcement officials who risked their own lives to protect my husband,\" Melania wrote.\n\n\"To the families of the innocent victims who are now suffering from this heinous act, I humbly offer my sincerest sympathy. Your need to summon your inner strength for such a terrible reason saddens me.\n\n\"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration. The core facets of my husband's life -- his human side -- were buried below the political machine. Donald, the generous and caring man who I have been with through the best of times and the worst of times.\"\n\nMelania has not remained completely out of politics, having headlined two fundraisers for the Log Cabin Republicans, a pro-LGBTQ+ rights Republican organization last spring.\n\nBoth were held at Trump properties -- Mar-a-Lago and Trump Tower -- and were closed to the press. I do not plan to be involved in politics.\"\n\nBut, on Thursday night, Ivanka made a rare public appearance at the RNC as her father accepted the Republican party's presidential nomination and delivered a record-breaking, 93-minute long speech to his supporters, in what marked his first public comments since an assassination attempt at the weekend.\n\nDressed in a white suit and joined by Kushner and other members of the Trump family in the family box, Ivanka beamed as Trump's wife Melania entered the Milwaukee auditorium to rapturous applause.\n\nThe two women - who have both avoided taking part in Trump's 2024 campaign to date - then joined Trump on stage as he and vice presidential pick JD Vance signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination.\n\nThe night continued to be a family affair with several Trump family members all joining the presidential candidate on stage after his speech, as the crowd went wild and red, white and blue balloons filled the air.\n\nOne of the Trump children was noticeable absent: his youngest son Barron Trump.\n\nMelania's office said back in May that Barron \"regretfully\" could not accept an invitation to attend as a delegate due to prior, unspecified, commitments.\n\nDuring his speech, Trump thanked his family members as he gave a shout-out to his wife, children and their partners.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania. And, Melania, thank you very much. You also did something really beautiful, a letter to America calling for national unity,\" he said.\n\n\"I also want to thank my entire family -- Don and Kimberly, Ivanka and Jared, Eric and Lara, Tiffany and Michael, Barron, we love our Barron. And of course, my 10 wonderful grandchildren.\"\n\nBut, despite the show of unity, Ivanka and Melania notably both missed the first three days of the convention - a contrast to Don Jr, Eric and Tiffany who were seen there every day.\n\nNeither Ivanka nor Melania gave speeches at the four-day event either - something both did at both the 2016 and 2020 convention.\n\nDespite being absent from his 2024 campaign events to date and her bid to keep a low-profile, Ivanka did put out a statement in the wake of the assassination attempt on her father last week.\n\n\"Thank you for your love and prayers for my father and for the other victims of today's senseless violence in Butler, Pennsylvania,\" she wrote on Instagram.\n\n'I am grateful to the Secret Service and all other law enforcement officers for their quick and decisive actions today. including his children, grandchildren and wife - joined him on stage as balloons fell from the ceiling and younger members of the family batted them with their hands and feet.\n\nShowing slight signs of affection, the former first lady was seen occasionally touching her husband's arm and chatting with Mr Trump's newly appointed pick for vice president, JD Vance.\n\nThe presence of the presidential nominee's family comes as the Republican Party sought to portray him as a caring family man and selfless public servant who has been unfairly represented by Democratic opponents.\n\nThis image makeover - But this week's events made it clear that the family is at the center of the modern Republican Party more than ever before.\n\nPolitics has become the family business. Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump have been fixtures of the convention. Lara Trump, Eric's wife, spoke Tuesday as the co-chair of the Republican Party. Donald Trump Jr.'s teenage daughter, Kai, spoke Wednesday night, after the younger Mr. Trump's longtime fianc\u00e9e, Kimberly Guilfoyle. Tiffany Trump, Mr. Trump's younger daughter, was in the audience on Monday.\n\nBut Mr. Trump's wife, his youngest son and his older daughter have been notably absent -- not just this week, but throughout the campaign. (Barron Trump, 18, has not appeared in the family seats Thursday night.)\n\nMelania Trump, whose politics and relationship with her husband have long drawn considerable interest, has largely opted out of this campaign. Her last known political appearance with Mr. Trump was when they went together to cast their primary ballots on Super Tuesday in March. The next week, he clinched the nomination.\n\nAs Mr. Trump took the stage, Mrs. Trump was seated next to J.D. Vance, his vice-presidential pick.\n\nIvanka Trump, 42, introduced Mr. Trump at the conventions in 2016 and 2020. She was a senior adviser to her father in the White House.\n\nThis time, she said at the outset of his run that she would not be involved. Ms. Trump, a mother of three, has focused on family life and has not appeared on the campaign trail.\n\nBarron Trump has always been removed from his father's political life: His mother, Melania Trump, has fiercely protected his privacy and has kept him close. He graduated in May from a private school in South Florida, an event Mr. Trump attended in the middle of his criminal trial in Manhattan.\n\nJust a week before his graduation, Barron was chosen as a Florida delegate to the Republican National Convention. Headlines and memes varied on the color, describing the dress as lime green, bright green, very green ... The low-profile spouse is expected to be in the family box for her husband's remarks, officials said, but they would not otherwise comment on her activities.\n\nIt's a far cry from the Republican National Convention the week of Aug. 24, 2020, when then-first lady Melania Trump - wearing a military-style suit - spoke from the newly renovated White House Rose Garden, seeking to provide comfort to families suffering during the coronavirus pandemic.\n\nPhotos of Melania Trump's infamous 'green screen dress' at 2020 Republican National Convention\n\nOn Aug. 27, 2020, the final day of the 2020 Republican National Convention, former first lady Melania Trump wore the Valentino lime green dress on the night of her husband's acceptance speech for the Republican nomination.\n\nAlso in attendance at the 2020 RNC? JD Vance's wife, Usha Vance, spoke about her husband on Wednesday.\n\nBut Melania has never been a typical first lady and has notably withdrawn from her husband's political endeavors since leaving the White House in 2021.\n\nShe does not attend Trump's rallies or event speeches. She did not attend any day of her husband's criminal trial in New York. She seemed as inscrutable and distant as ever.\n\nShe joined him on stage after his lengthy acceptance speech, walking to the podium just before balloons rained down on thousands in the crowd. Donald Trump greeted her with a hug and the pair shared a kiss on the cheek.\n\nHe then grabbed her hand and walked across the stage as other members of the Trump family joined them.\n\nEver since her husband was first elected in 2016, Melania Trump has broken all the rules of normal American presidential politics.\n\nIn the White House during Trump's first term, she was a reclusive figure compared to other first ladies, focusing on a narrow set of interests. The US national archives descibes her as having been an \"ambassador for kindness\" and an advocate for children's issues.\n\nAnd since her husband left office, she has refused to be seen by her husband's side on many occasions when the public would expect her to be present.\n\nShe wasn't there when he had his mugshot taken in Atlanta. She wasn't there in New York when he became the first former president to be convicted of a crime. And she wasn't there when he officially won his party's presidential nomination, for the third time, on Monday.\n\n\"Melania does what Melania wants,\" said Mary Jordan, who wrote The Art of her Deal, a biography on the former first lady. \"She is fiercely independent and won't do something just because other people do it. She doesn't feel any obligation to do it.\"\n\nWe are now all accustomed to the fact that she doesn't turn up at many of Donald Trump's events, but on Monday, when he walked into the arena here in Milwaukee to a roaring welcome, greeted like a Messiah after his survival of the assassination attempt, her absence felt particularly obvious.\n\nIt was certainly noticed by the Republicans gathered here, but that didn't mean they weren't excited for her appearance, when it finally came.\n\nMelania is the most enigmatic first lady in modern history and we rarely hear what she thinks.\n\nAn exception was the lengthy statement she released after the shooting targeting her husband, which read as though she may have dictated it directly.\n\n\"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,\" she said.\n\n\"The core facets of my husband's life - his human side - were buried below the political machine. Donald, the generous and caring man who I have been with through the best of times and the worst of times.\"\n\nIt is traditional at party conventions for the candidate's spouse to give a speech and tell heavily-scripted anecdotes about family life.\n\nOn Wednesday evening, Usha Vance - the wife of Trump's newly-minted running mate JD Vance - did just that. She called her husband a \"meat and potatoes\" man, but - in an apparent sign of his devotion - said he now cooked her Indian vegetarian food.\n\nAnd while Donald Trump's oldest son Don Jr, middle son Eric, daughter-in-law Lara and granddaughter Kai have all spoken at this convention, Melania has declined the opportunity to speak. She very clearly does not do anything she does not want to do.\n\nWhen she did introduce her husband at the 2016 convention when he first ran for president - things went horribly wrong.\n\nShe was criticised for plagiarising the speech Michelle Obama gave in 2008 when she introduced her husband Barack at the Democratic convention. Melania's speechwriter later accepted the blame.\n\nFirst ladies are always heavily scrutinised for the image they project, the causes they adopt, and the clothes they wear.\n\nBut Melania Trump is the first who was previously a professional model. She looks fabulous in photographs and is well aware of the power of her image. By offering so few photo opportunities, she makes each one infinitely more powerful.\n\n\"She is very savvy and has cultivated the mystery woman mystique by going underground and then when she does come out, it's a much bigger deal,\" says Ms Jordan.\n\n\"She doesn't appear very often, but she does show up when Donald Trump really needs her.\"\n\nAfter Saturday's attempt on his life, Melania felt MIA. Please try again later{{ /verifyErrors }}\n\nIvanka Trump made her return to politics and her father's campaign trail on Thursday night as she joined her family on stage to close out the Republican National Convention.\n\nThe former president's eldest daughter worked as a senior adviser in the Trump administration but - following his exit from the White House in January 2021 in the wake of the January 6 Capitol riot - has distanced herself from his releection goals and the world of politics altogether.\n\nAfter leaving Washington DC, Ivanka and her husband Jared Kushner moved to Miami with their three children.\n\nAnd when, in November 2022, Donald Trump announced that he would run for the White House for a third time, she made it clear she did not want to return to politics. \"I love my father very much,\" she wrote in a statement at the time. \"This time around, I am choosing to prioritize my young children and the private life we are creating as a family. I do not plan to be involved in politics.\"\n\nBut, on Thursday night, Ivanka made a rare public appearance at the RNC as her father accepted the Republican party's presidential nomination and delivered a record-breaking, 93-minute long speech to his supporters, in what marked his first public comments since an assassination attempt at the weekend.\n\nDressed in a white suit and joined by Kushner and other members of the Trump family in the family box, Ivanka beamed as Trump's wife Melania entered the Milwaukee auditorium to rapturous applause.\n\nThe two women - who have both avoided taking part in Trump's 2024 campaign to date - then joined Trump on stage as he and vice presidential pick JD Vance signed paperwork formally accepting the GOP nomination.\n\nThe night continued to be a family affair with several Trump family members all joining the presidential candidate on stage after his speech, as the crowd went wild and red, white and blue balloons filled the air.\n\nOne of the Trump children was noticeable absent: his youngest son Barron Trump.\n\nMelania's office said back in May that Barron \"regretfully\" could not accept an invitation to attend as a delegate due to prior, unspecified, commitments.\n\nDuring his speech, Trump thanked his family members as he gave a shout-out to his wife, children and their partners.\n\n\"On this journey, I am deeply honored to be joined by my amazing wife, Melania. And, Melania, thank you very much. You also did something really beautiful, a letter to America calling for national unity,\" he said.\n\n\"I also want to thank my entire family -- Don and Kimberly, Ivanka and Jared, Eric and Lara, Tiffany and Michael, Barron, we love our Barron. And of course, my 10 wonderful grandchildren.\"\n\nBut, despite the show of unity, Ivanka and Melania notably both missed the first three days of the convention - a contrast to Don Jr, Eric and Tiffany who were seen there every day.\n\nNeither Ivanka nor Melania gave speeches at the four-day event either - something both did at both the 2016 and 2020 convention.\n\nDespite being absent from his 2024 campaign events to date and her bid to keep a low-profile, Ivanka did put out a statement in the wake of the assassination attempt on her father last week.\n\n\"Thank you for your love and prayers for my father and for the other victims of today's senseless violence in Butler, Pennsylvania,\" she wrote on Instagram.\n\n'I am grateful to the Secret Service and all other law enforcement officers for their quick and decisive actions today. When she stepped off Air Force One at Palm Beach International Airport three hours later, the third Mrs. Trump wore a much more colorful, Florida-style caftan.\n\n\"Serving as your first lady has been my greatest honor,\" Trump said minutes before boarding Air Force One with the former president. \"Thank you for your love and support. You will be in my thoughts and prayers, God bless you all. God bless your families and God bless this great nation.\"\n\nWith her hair in a loose bun, Melania Trump wore a short Chanel jacket over a black Dolce & Gabbana dress, along with her Christian Louboutin stilettos and a crocodile Herm\u00e8s Birkin.\n\nThe Trumps opted to skip President Joe Biden's Inauguration Day festivities and instead return to their private Mar-a-Lago beach club.\n\nMelania Trump's outfit, a long-sleeved orange, white and navy patterned Gucci dress, reportedly cost $3,700, according to thedesigner website.\n\nOn June 21, 2018, former first lady Melania Trump arrived at Andrews Air Force Base in Maryland wearing a Zara jacket that read, \"I really don't care. {"uri": "8232824305", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "04:32:26", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T04:32:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T04:31:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6000000238418579, "url": "https://www.the-star.co.ke/news/world/2024-07-19-melania-trump-watches-husbands-convention-speech-in-rare-appearance/", "title": "Melania Trump watches husband's convention speech in rare appearance", "body": "Donald Trump's elusive wife Melania has appeared in public for the first time since the former president narrowly missed an assassin's bullet.\n\nWearing Republican red she walked, alone, into the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee accompanied by classical music - a marked contrast from the country music anthems and rock ballads we've been hearing all week.\n\nGlossy and glamorous, she looked more like she was walking down a catwalk than into a political convention. She seemed as inscrutable and distant as ever.\n\nEver since her husband was first elected in 2016, Melania Trump has broken all the rules of normal American presidential politics.\n\nIn the White House during Trump's first term, she was a reclusive figure compared to other first ladies, focusing on a narrow set of interests. The US national archives descibes her as having been an \"ambassador for kindness\" and an advocate for children's issues.\n\nAnd since her husband left office, she has refused to be seen by her husband's side on many occasions when the public would expect her to be present.\n\nShe wasn't there when he had his mugshot taken in Atlanta. She wasn't there in New York when he became the first former president to be convicted of a crime. And she wasn't there when he officially won his party's presidential nomination, for the third time, on Monday.\n\n\"Melania does what Melania wants,\" said Mary Jordan, who wrote The Art of her Deal, a biography on the former first lady. \"She is fiercely independent and won't do something just because other people do it. She doesn't feel any obligation to do it.\"\n\nWe are now all accustomed to the fact that she doesn't turn up at many of Donald Trump's events, but on Monday, when he walked into the arena here in Milwaukee to a roaring welcome, greeted like a Messiah after his survival of the assassination attempt, her absence felt particularly obvious.\n\nIt was certainly noticed by the Republicans gathered here, but that didn't mean they weren't excited for her appearance, when it finally came.\n\nMelania entered the hall shortly before her husband was set to speak and officially accept the Republican nomination\n\nMelania is the most enigmatic first lady in modern history and we rarely hear what she thinks.\n\nAn exception was the lengthy statement she released after the shooting targeting her husband, which read as though she may have dictated it directly.\n\n\"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion - his laughter, ingenuity, love of music, and inspiration,\" she said.\n\n\"The core facets of my husband's life - his human side - were buried below the political machine. Donald, the generous and caring man who I have been with through the best of times and the worst of times.\"\n\nIt is traditional at party conventions for the candidate's spouse to give a speech and tell heavily-scripted anecdotes about family life.\n\nShe made her way up to the family VIP box to listen to her husband's speech\n\nOn Wednesday evening, Usha Vance - the wife of Trump's newly-minted running mate JD Vance - did just that. She called her husband a \"meat and potatoes\" man, but - in an apparent sign of his devotion - said he now cooked her Indian vegetarian food.\n\nAnd while Donald Trump's oldest son Don Jr, middle son Eric, daughter-in-law Lara and granddaughter Kai have all spoken at this convention, Melania has declined the opportunity to speak. She very clearly does not do anything she does not want to do.\n\nWhen she did introduce her husband at the 2016 convention when he first ran for president - things went horribly wrong.\n\nShe was criticised for plagiarising the speech Michelle Obama gave in 2008 when she introduced her husband Barack at the Democratic convention. Melania's speechwriter later accepted the blame.\n\nMelania's last public statement came after her husband was nearly assassinated at a rally\n\nFirst ladies are always heavily scrutinised for the image they project, the causes they adopt, and the clothes they wear.\n\nBut Melania Trump is the first who was previously a professional model. She looks fabulous in photographs and is well aware of the power of her image. By offering so few photo opportunities, she makes each one infinitely more powerful.\n\n\"She is very savvy and has cultivated the mystery woman mystique by going underground and then when she does come out, it's a much bigger deal,\" says Ms Jordan.\n\n\"She doesn't appear very often, but she does show up when Donald Trump really needs her.\"\n\nAfter Saturday's attempt on his life, Melania felt MIA. Vance as his running mate, a new addition to the inner circle.\n\n\"He couldn't choose one of his sons or daughters or daughter-in-law, that just wouldn't work, of course,\" Natasha Lindstaedt, a political scientist at the University of Essex, told AFP.\n\n\"J.D. Vance and Don Jr. are very close. So he chose someone that maybe reminds him of his son or is close to his son,\" she said.\n\nA notable absence on the campaign trail this year, however, has been former first lady Melania Trump, who has been all but invisible throughout Trump's rallies and protracted court appearances.\n\nIn a marked break from precedent, Melania has been largely absent in recent months from her husband's political life, with the notable exception of a fiery statement after an attempted assassination attempt on him on Saturday.\n\nPrior to that, however, she had spoken sparingly and not accompanied her husband during court appearances in a case that saw him convicted of covering up hush money payments made to porn star Stormy Daniels, who alleged she had a sexual encounter with the real estate tycoon.\n\n\"She's a complete enigma,\" Lindstaedt said, adding that the former model did not \"play the typical role\" of a former first lady.\n\n\"Although she seemed to share similar views to Trump on a lot of issues, not on all, but on a lot of issues, she has a very conservative world view, she doesn't seem to care that much what people think and kind of does her own thing.\"\n\nThe rest of Trump's family has offered the former president a way to soften his image in the aftermath of the recent convictions and other legal woes.\n\nHis eldest granddaughter, 17-year-old Kai Trump, spoke at the RNC Wednesday night to describe the \"very caring and loving\" patriarch.\n\n\"He's just a normal grandpa, he gives us candy and soda when our parents aren't looking,\" she said.\n\nThe teenage daughter of Donald Jr. spoke of their shared love of golf, even when the former president tries to psych her out when playing against her.\n\n\"I don't let him get to me, but I have to remind him I'm a Trump, too,\" she said.\n\nLike wagons hitched to their father's train, Donald Jr., Eric and Ivanka have been pulled along to success, along with their friends and families.\n\nLindstaedt pointed to two examples of Trump spouses achieving power: Eric Trump's wife Lara Trump, who was recently appointed co-chair of the Republican National Committee, and Ivanka's husband Jared Kushner, who Trump appointed as an adviser and entrusted with figuring out peace in the Middle East.\n\n\"Suddenly people who have no expertise, no training, no ethics training, maybe they're not even going properly through security clearances, are given access to the most powerful positions,\" Lindstaedt said.\n\n\"And we see when this happens in non-democracies and the dictatorships, how it usually goes very badly.\"\n\nNatalie Koch, who researches geopolitics and authoritarianism at Syracuse University, said Trump's nepotism is nothing new.\n\n\"The Trump organization is a family business, but once he took office the first time, and then you could really see that he brought that into the political realm and into the White House,\" Koch told AFP.\n\nEach of Trump's children has been entrusted with different duties during this campaign.\n\nDon Jr., the eldest at age 46, is a big proponent of his father's far-right \"Make America Great Again\" (MAGA) ideology.\n\nSpeaking at the Republican National Convention, he extolled the image of his father raising his fist after the assassination attempt last weekend.\n\nIvanka, 42, had played a role in Trump's administration but has since devoted herself to personal matters.\n\nEric, 40, has doubled down on Trump's claims that the 2020 election was rigged. At the convention, he appeared with delegates from Florida and claimed -- without evidence -- that the Democratic Party was planning to win this year's election fraudulently.\n\nTrump's fourth child, Tiffany, 30, was also in attendance at the Republican National Convention.\n\nHis youngest child, 18-year-old Barron, whom he had with current wife Melania, appears to take after his mother's preference for the background, declining to be a delegate from Florida at the convention this year.", "source": {"uri": "arab.news", "dataType": "news", "title": "Arab News"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_Jr.", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump Jr."}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Eric Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melania_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Melania Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milwaukee", "type": "loc", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Milwaukee"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "Milwaukee"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._D._Vance", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "J. This time, however, Melania took in the proceedings from the crowd.\n\nMelania has been noticeably absent from the campaign trail this cycle, only holding several closed-door events while declining to accompany her husband at his rallies and events.\n\nMelania was accompanied to the convention Thursday by Ivanka Trump and her husband, Jared Kushner, both of whom worked in Donald Trump's administration but disappeared from politics after he was voted out of office in 2020. He is now engaged to Kimberly Guilfoyle.\n\nLike his brother, Eric Trump, the third of the former president's children, has lobbied his father about issues important to him, according to reports.\n\nHe has kept a less public persona than his older brother but also maintains a leading presence in the Trump family business.\n\nIvanka Trump and Jared Kushner were arguably the most influential members of the former president's family during Trump's first stint in the White House.\n\nThe pair have been married since 2009 and share three children.\n\nDuring the former president's time in the White House, Ivanka Trump made numerous appearances on behalf of her father and his administration.\n\nKushner held a senior adviser role in the White House from 2017 to 2021.\n\nThe fourth child of the former president and the only one of Trump's children born to his second wife, Marla Maples.\n\nShe has not maintained any political role in her father's campaigns or time in the White House.\n\nShe has been married to Michael Boulos since 2022.\n\nKimberly Guilfoyle and Donald Trump Jr have been together for six years and engaged since 2020.\n\nShe was a Fox News presenter from 2006 to 2018, before leaving to become a member of a pro-Trump super PAC.\n\nLike her fianc\u00e9, she has been an outspoken supporter of the former president, particularly in TV appearances.\n\nShe was married to California Governor Gavin Newsom in the early 2000s.\n\nMarried to Eric, she is the rising star of the family, particularly since she began serving as RNC co-chair earlier this year. She has two children with Eric.\n\nShe told the convention what the former president was like as a father-in-law.\n\nFormer First Lady Melania Trump has been married to Trump since 2005.\n\nShe maintained a low profile during Trump's term in office and has rarely made public appearances since.\n\nWhile she has held Republican fundraisers in the past year, her expected appearance at the RNC this week would be her first major appearance of this election cycle.\n\nBarron Trump, 18, is her only child with Trump.\n\nBarron Trump made a campaign appearance earlier this month with his father, but otherwise has largely stayed out of the spotlight.\n\nIn May, it was reported he would be among the delegates from the state of Florida who would attend the RNC in July, but a day later his mother stated that he had declined the offer.\n\nHe graduated in May from Oxbridge Academy in Palm Beach, Florida, and will head to university in the autumn, according to Trump. However, the family has not said which institution he will attend.\n\nKai Trump is the eldest of Trump's grandchildren and the daughter of Donald Trump Jr and his former wife Vanessa Trump.\n\nThe The former first lady's only public moments included standing behind Trump while he signed his official nomination paperwork.\n\nUnlike her speeches at the 2016 and 2020 conventions, Melania did not address the audience this year. Her limited campaign involvement has garnered attention, particularly in light of recent events. As Donald Trump concluded his lengthy speech, Melania joined him on stage, sharing an awkward kiss and holding hands amidst falling balloons.\n\nIvanka Trump and Jared Kushner, who held influential positions in the Trump White House, were notably absent from Donald Trump's 2022 campaign announcement.\n\nIvanka, a 42-year-old mother of three, had introduced her father at the previous two conventions and served as a senior adviser during his presidency. However, she stated early on that she would not be involved in this campaign, instead focusing on her family life and refraining from making appearances on the campaign trail.\n\nAt TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. {"uri": "2024-07-426546827", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "00:22:57", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T00:22:57Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-18T23:44:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5882353186607361, "url": "https://www.ccenterdispatch.com/news/national/article_32806fbd-5f10-513a-9a82-7f406550e01a.html", "title": "Trump family reshapes Republican Party in its own image", "body": "For Donald Trump, the campaign to return to the White House is a family affair.\n\nHis sons Donald Jr. and Eric have been ubiquitous at the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee, flanking their father at almost all his public appearances.\n\nDuring Trump's first term in office between 2017 and 2021, they helped him make key decisions, and they now work to ensure the party leadership is comprised of loyal allies.\n\nMost recently, their input helped tip Trump towards picking Ohio Senator J.D. Vance as his running mate, a new addition to the inner circle.\n\n\"He couldn't choose one of his sons or daughters or daughter-in-law, that just wouldn't work, of course,\" Natasha Lindstaedt, a political scientist at the University of Essex, told AFP.\n\n\"J.D. Vance and Don Jr. are very close. So he chose someone that maybe reminds him of his son or is close to his son,\" she said.\n\nA notable absence on the campaign trail this year, however, has been former first lady Melania Trump, who has been all but invisible throughout Trump's rallies and protracted court appearances.\n\n- Where is Melania? -\n\nIn a marked break from precedent, Melania has been largely absent in recent months from her husband's political life, with the notable exception of a fiery statement after an attempted assassination attempt on him on Saturday.\n\nPrior to that, however, she had spoken sparingly and not accompanied her husband during court appearances in a case that saw him convicted of covering up hush money payments made to porn star Stormy Daniels, who alleged she had a sexual encounter with the real estate tycoon.\n\n\"She's a complete enigma,\" Lindstaedt said, adding that the former model did not \"play the typical role\" of a former first lady.\n\n\"Although she seemed to share similar views to Trump on a lot of issues, not on all, but on a lot of issues, she has a very conservative world view, she doesn't seem to care that much what people think and kind of does her own thing.\"\n\n- Three generations -\n\nThe rest of Trump's family has offered the former president a way to soften his image in the aftermath of the recent convictions and other legal woes.\n\nHis eldest granddaughter, 17-year-old Kai Trump, spoke at the RNC Wednesday night to describe the \"very caring and loving\" patriarch.\n\n\"He's just a normal grandpa, he gives us candy and soda when our parents aren't looking,\" she said.\n\nThe teenage daughter of Donald Jr. spoke of their shared love of golf, even when the former president tries to psych her out when playing against her.\n\n\"I don't let him get to me, but I have to remind him I'm a Trump, too,\" she said.\n\n- Nepotism -\n\nLike wagons hitched to their father's train, Donald Jr., Eric and Ivanka have been pulled along to success, along with their friends and families.\n\nLindstaedt pointed to two examples of Trump spouses achieving power: Eric Trump's wife Lara Trump, who was recently appointed co-chair of the Republican National Committee, and Ivanka's husband Jared Kushner, who Trump appointed as an advisor and entrusted with figuring out peace in the Middle East.\n\n\"Suddenly people who have no expertise, no training, no ethics training, maybe they're not even going properly through security clearances, are given access to the most powerful positions,\" Lindstaedt said.\n\n\"And we see when this happens in non-democracies and the dictatorships, how it usually goes very badly.\"\n\nNatalie Koch, who researches geopolitics and authoritarianism at Syracuse University, said Trump's nepotism is nothing new.\n\n\"The Trump organization is a family business, but once he took office the first time, and then you could really see that he brought that into the political realm and into the White House,\" Koch told AFP.\n\n- Children's roles -\n\nEach of Trump's children has been entrusted with different duties during this campaign.\n\nDon Jr., the eldest at age 46, is a big proponent of his father's far-right \"Make America Great Again\" (MAGA) ideology.\n\nSpeaking at the Republican National Convention, he extolled the image of his father raising his fist after the assassination attempt last weekend.\n\nIvanka, 42, had played a role in Trump's administration but has since devoted herself to personal matters.\n\nEric, 40, has doubled down on Trump's claims that the 2020 election was rigged. At the convention, he appeared with delegates from Florida and claimed -- without evidence -- that the Democratic Party was planning to win this year's election fraudulently.\n\nTrump's fourth child, Tiffany, 30, was also in attendance at the Republican National Convention.\n\nHis youngest child, 18-year-old Barron, whom he had with current wife Melania, appears to take after his mother's preference for the background, declining to be a delegate from Florida at the convention this year.\n\nmav/llu/jgc/aha/acb", "source": {"uri": "ccenterdispatch.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Clay Center Dispatch On-Line"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_Jr.", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump Jr."}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Eric Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melania_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Melania Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._D._Vance", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "J. Her stately introduction stood in stark contrast with the previous speaker, the professional wrestler Hulk Hogan, who ripped his shirt off in a particularly bombastic display.\n\nMelania was then followed up by a lively Kid Rock performance afterwards.\n\nShe had earlier been pictured backstage alongside Trump by The New York Times as the former president met her upon arrival.\n\nMelania moved towards the VIP box solo, where she was sandwiched between vice presidential pick J.D. Vance and Trump's second son, Eric.\n\nThe former first lady spoke in both 2020 and 2016. She appeared to be a mix of seriousness and smiles as she waited for husband Donald to take the stage. Barron Trump was not in attendance.\n\nAs Kid Rock raged on, Melania remained seated, despite the rest of the family giving him a standing ovation.\n\nMelania has been notably absent from the 2024 campaign trail, making only a few private appearances. She released a statement after the attempted assassination attempt of Trump last weekend, decrying political violence while giving fans some insight into her very personal life.\n\n\"When I watched that violent bullet strike my husband, Donald, I realized my life, and Barron's life, were on the brink of a devastating change.
