{"uri": "8232435765", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-18", "time": "20:56:42", "dateTime": "2024-07-18T20:56:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-18T20:54:24Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5333333611488342, "url": "https://dnyuz.com/2024/07/18/ever-elusive-melania-trump-is-expected-to-appear-at-g-o-p-convention/", "title": "Ever Elusive, Melania Trump Is Expected to Appear at G.O.P. Convention", "body": "The Republican National Convention has been chockablock with Trumps.\n\nLara Trump, the co-chair of the Republican Party and Donald J. Trump's daughter-in-law, delivered a keynote address. Her husband, Eric, has made the rounds on cable news. Another Trump son, Donald Trump Jr., spoke for 19 minutes on Wednesday night, long enough even to hand the mic to his teenage daughter, Kai.\n\nAnd yet, where is Melania?\n\nDonald Trump's wife has remained out of sight. She has not been in the V.I.P. box where Mr. Trump has presided over the prime-time show each night. She has not been on television. She is sparsely featured in the videos played for delegates between speakers and in the photos plastered on the arena's walls.\n\nMrs. Trump is set to appear on Thursday, as her husband delivers his acceptance speech on the convention's final night. But, in a break from tradition, she is not expected to speak. (Other Trumps are likely to make their first appearances, too: Ivanka, the former president's daughter who is keeping a distance from his current campaign, and Barron, 18, Mr. Trump's youngest son.)\n\nAt this celebration of all things Trump, nobody knows quite what to make of this.\n\nScott Walker, the former governor of Wisconsin, speculated on Wednesday from the floor of the convention hall that it is probably just \"too overwhelming\" for Mrs. Trump, given the assassination attempt on her husband on Saturday. \"I think it's going to be emotional even to be with him,\" Mr. Walker said, \"let alone speak.\"\n\nAsked about the former first lady on Tuesday, Matt Schlapp, a former White House aide, shrugged. \"I don't know whether she's coming or not,\" he said. \"Melania has always taken full measure of her ability to have private time for as long as possible. I know that she's completely behind this campaign.\"\n\nMrs. Trump has been disappearing from view for a while now. She did not show up at her husband's trial for falsifying business records to cover up hush payments to Stormy Daniels, a porn star who claimed to have had a tryst with Mr. Trump while his wife was home with a newborn. So far in this campaign, Mrs. Trump has done two fund-raisers with gay Republicans, but little else.\n\n\"Melania will be out whenever it's appropriate for her,\" Lara Trump said in an interview with The New York Times last week. \"Just because people are not overtly out front with banners or signs or whatever it might be, doesn't mean they are not 100 percent on board.\"\n\nMelania Trump was overtly out front at the last two Republican conventions.\n\nIn 2016, she gave a speech that plagiarized chunks of a Michelle Obama speech. In 2020, when the country was being rocked by Covid-19 and unrest after the death of George Floyd, Mrs. Trump delivered a speech from the Rose Garden that was seen as more compassionate than anything at that convention. \"I know many people are anxious and some feel helpless,\" she said then. \"I want you to know that you are not alone.\"\n\nOrdinarily, wives play a central role at these conventions, humanizing their spouse. Mr. Trump has relied on his son's wife and former aides to do that this time around.\n\n\"Last night, when we heard Lara, she told us a lot of things that we already knew about Donald, but we didn't know his personal side, his family side, how compassionate he really is,\" a Nebraska delegate, Mary Gerdes, said on Wednesday. Did she think it was odd that the candidate's wife seemed to want nothing to do with this convention? \"It would've been great to hear from her,\" Ms. Gerdes said, \"but she's had a rough week.\"\n\nAfter Ronald Reagan was shot in 1981, Nancy Reagan rushed to the emergency room to be by his side, spending the next 13 days at the hospital with him. (\"Honey, I forgot to duck,\" Mr. Reagan told his wife.)\n\nMr. Trump's wife was not by his side for his first public appearance since the shooting here on Monday. She did put out a letter, though. \"A monster who recognized my husband as an inhuman political machine attempted to ring out Donald's passion,\" she wrote, citing her husband's \"laughter\" and his \"love of music.\"\n\nOn Wednesday night, Mr. Trump chose to walk out onto the convention floor to James Brown's \"It's a Man's Man's Man's World\" (it was the version featuring Luciano Pavarotti).\n\nThis is a man's world, but it wouldn't be nothing, nothing without a woman or a girl.\n\nA little while later, the founder of Turning Point USA, Charlie Kirk, watched as Kai Trump spoke onstage. At this introduction of yet another Trump, Mr. Kirk smiled and remarked that \"this political dynasty goes a lot longer than liberals realize.\"\n\nMrs. Trump's role in that dynasty, however, continues to be a mystery. Mr. Kirk, asked if he thought she would join her husband in the White House if he won in November, wouldn't even speculate.", "source": {"uri": "dnyuz.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "DNyuz"}, {"uri": "8232730859", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "02:54:49", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T02:54:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T02:53:40Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5254902243614197, "url": "https://www.thesun.ie/news/13435257/eric-trump-donald-rnc-president-assassination-attempt/", "title": "Trump relives moment he came within inches of death in 1st speech since shooting", "body": "DONALD Trump has taken the stage at the Republican National Convention to address his assassination attempt.\n\nThe former president added that it was \"too painful\" to discuss more than once but recalled the moments before he knew he was shot.\n\n\"We rise together or we fall apart. I am running to be president for all of America, not half of America,\" he told the crowd.\n\n\"There is no victory in winning for half of America. So tonight with faith and devotion I proudly accept your nomination for president of the United States.\"\n\n\"I am running to president for all of America not half of America bc there is no victory in winning for half America\" he added.\n\nTrump said he would address the assassination attempt once because it was \"too painful\" to recall.\n\nHe set the scene as a warm Saturday in Pennsylvania and as he was discussing his administration's work at the Southern border, he turned to look at a screen behind him.\n\nTrump demonstrated his turn when he felt \"something\" hit him \"really really hard\" on his right ear.\n\n\"I said to myself 'wow what was that?' It could only be a bullet,\" Trump added.\n\nHe described \"blood all over the place\" and recalled immediately feeling the urgency of the moment.\n\nTrump thanked the Secret Service and said that even though there was \"blood pouring everywhere\" he felt safe because he had \"God\" on his side.\n\n\"If I had not moved my head at that moment, the assassin's bullet would've hit its mark,\" he told the crowd.\n\nEric gave a fiery speech as he became emotional describing the moment when he heard his father was shot.\n\nTrump sat with his family and held his four-year-old granddaughter, Carolina, as Eric spoke.\n\nToward the end of his speech, Eric directed his attention to his father, saying that their family \"held their breath\" as they saw \"blood pour across his face.\"\n\n\"The whole world saw your strength as you stood up and wiped blood across your face,\" Eric said, describing the assassination attempt as one of the most \"courageous\" moments in American politics.\n\nEric also discussed Trump's upbringing and praised his administration.\n\n\"My father saw potential when others saw disparity,\" Eric began his speech, adding that his father, \"built the New York City skyline.\"\n\n\"He restored hope, he restored a voice to millions of Americans who have been ignored, he restored the American Dream,\" Eric said of Trump's administration.\n\nEric praised the economy during his father's administration and said Trump \"made the United States safe.\"\n\n\"My father has been censored. The former president ripped off Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook. My father has been persecuted,\" he added.\n\n\"My father has been pulled off the ballots of states. My father even became the target of an assassin.\"\n\nEric also discussed illegal immigration, reiterating a common theme discussed throughout the RNC.\n\n\"Your government can do so much better - and it will,\" Eric added.\n\nHe said his father \"believed in the promise of America when others turned away.\"\n\nEric concluded his speech with a call to voters and a promise that Trump would \"Make America Great Again.\"\n\nKid Rock then took to the stage to hype up the crowd for Dana White and Trump.\n\nHe wore a black T-shirt with a leather jacket and a fedora hat.\n\nKid Rock screamed at the audience to chant \"Fight\" and \"Trump,\" as an American flag graphic was displayed behind him.\n\nDana White, CEO of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, took the stage next to introduce the former president.\n\nWhite and Trump are longtime friends, and the UFC tycoon is a strong supporter of Trump's presidency.\n\nDana said that Trump \"truly cares about people,\" and cited the former president's concern with interrupting Dana's family vacation for the RNC.\n\n\"Nobody in the Trump campaign has ever told me what to say. Nobody tells me what to say,\" he added.\n\nDana said that Trump was \"the toughest, most resilient human being,\" he's ever met in his life.\n\n\"I know President Trump is literally putting his life on the line for something bigger than himself,\" Dana said.\n\n\"He loves this country. And I know he wants what's best for the American people. I know he's running for president to save our American Dream,\" he added.\n\nDana concluded his speech with an enthusiastic endorsement, \"America needs a strong leader and the world needs a strong American. Donald Trump is the best choice. My fellow Americans it is my honor to introduce the 45th President of the United States, Donald Trump.\"\n\nThe Trumps have presented a united front for the former president's campaign and have reiterated the theme of family values throughout the RNC.\n\nTrump's granddaughter, Kai Madison, took the stage at the RNC last night to praise her grandfather.\n\nKai, 17, is the daughter of Donald Trump Jr. and the former president's eldest grandchild.\n\nHer father, who has also been active in the former president's re-election campaign, introduced her and told the crowd that she asked to speak after Trump's attempted assassination.\n\n\"To me, he's just a normal grandpa,\" Kai told the crowd.\n\n\"A lot of people have put my grandpa through hell and he's still standing,\" she continued.\n\nEric's wife and Kai's aunt, Lara, also gave a rousing speech on the first day of the RNC.\n\nLara was named the co-chair of the RNC and has been vocal on the campaign trail for her father-in-law.\n\n\"There's no doubt that Saturday was one of the most frightening moments of my father-in-law's life. Millimeters separated him from life and certain death,\" Lara told the RNC attendees.\n\nShe addressed the assassination attempt on Trump during a campaign rally and painted her father-in-law as a defiant political hero.\n\nIn addition to Trump's family, prominent Republicans are also rallying behind the former president's re-election campaign.\n\nFormer UN Ambassador and presidential candidate, Nikki Haley endorsed Trump on the second day of the RNC - a move that shocked many following her campaign.\n\nNikki was a strong critic of Trump during the primary election cycle but opted to support him in the general election.\n\nThe former South Carolina Governor admitted that she didn't always agree with Trump, but added, \"President Trump asked me to speak to this convention in the name of unity.\n\n\"It was a gracious invitation and I was happy to accept.\"\n\nFormer presidential candidates Florida Governor Ron DeSantis and Vivek Ramaswamy also rallied the crowd at the RNC in support of Trump.\n\nThe RNC kicked off just two days after an assassination attempt on Trump during a campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.\n\nA bullet grazed Trump's ear and he fell to the ground before the Secret Service ushered him off stage.\n\nThomas Matthew Crooks was identified as the gunman, but questions still loom over his motive.\n\nFBI agents have launched a case into the assassination and have reportedly found images of Trump and President Biden on the gunman's phone.\n\nThe New York Times also reported searches of an unnamed member of the Royal Family on Crooks' phone.\n\nFootage has also recently emerged of the gunman walking near the rally just an hour before opening fire.\n\nAn attendee turned over footage of the crowd which included Crooks walking behind a screen at the rally.\n\nCrooks was positioned on a nearby rooftop about 430 feet away from the stage.\n\nSecret Service snipers shot and killed him 26 seconds after he opened fire.\n\nLaw enforcement spotted him just minutes before he fired his first shots.\n\nSecret Service has taken heat for the incident, resulting in calls for director Kimberly Cheatle to step down.\n\nWhile Republicans are in Milwaukee to formally tap Trump as the presidential nominee, Democrats seem divided over supporting Biden's re-election campaign.\n\nAfter Biden and Trump's first presidential debate, discussions began on the possibility of Biden dropping out of the race.\n\nRepresentative Lloyd Doggett was the first lawmaker to publicly call for Biden to step aside, and nearly 20 members of Congress have since joined him.\n\nProminent Democrats are also reportedly having those conversations behind closed doors, with several sources close to the president telling Axios that they don't think he can win against Trump in November.\n\nSources also told ABC News that Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries are considering delaying the Democrat nomination process.\n\nA spokesperson for Schumer responded to the report with a statement saying the senator had already conveyed his views directly to Biden.\n\nCNN has also reported that former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi had a conversation with Biden over negative polling and her concern that Democrats will lose their bid for the House if he stays in the race.\n\nThe most recent report comes from former President Obama, who told allies that Biden's \"path to victory has greatly diminished and he thinks the president needs to seriously consider the viability of his candidacy,\" according to the Washington Post.\n\nThe concerns come as Biden announced on Wednesday that he was diagnosed with Covid-19 and had to cancel campaign events in the battleground state of Nevada.\n\nTrump's camp is capitalizing on the Democratic divide, with his co-campaign manager speculating that Democrats are staging a \"coup\" against Biden.\n\n\"They are actively engaged in an attempt - in my view and a lot of people share this view - in deposing the president of the United States,\" Chris LaCivita told Politico.\n\nThe Democrats must secure their plan and message by the Democratic National Convention, which is set to start on August 19 in Chicago, Illinois.\n\nThe Republicans have rallied around their message at the RNC, expressing support for Trump and echoing policies on strict immigration and an America-first mentality.\n\nTrump is anticipated to angle his speech on unity and outline his message ahead of the general election.\n\nHe reportedly ripped up his speech after the assassination attempt to focus more on unity and will not mention Biden by name.", "source": {"uri": "thesun.ie", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Irish Sun"}, "authors": [{"uri": She had not been spotted in Milwaukee since the convention kicked off on Monday.\n\nLast week, Melania issued a statement calling for unity following an assassination attempt against Trump at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania.\n\n\"This morning, ascend above the hate, the vitriol, and the simple-minded ideas that ignite violence. We all want a world where respect is paramount, family is first, and love transcends. We can realise this world again. Each of us must demand to get it back. We must insist that respect fills the cornerstone of our relationships again,\" she said in a statement.\n\nIt is traditional at party conventions for the candidates' spouses to give a speech and tell heavily-scripted anecdotes about family life.\n\nOn Wednesday evening, Usha Vance - the wife of Trump's newly-minted running mate JD Vance - did just that. But Melania skipped delivering a speech.\n\nEver since her husband was first elected in 2016, Melania Trump has broken all the rules of normal American presidential politics.\n\nIn the White House during Trump's first term, she was a reclusive figure compared to other first ladies, focusing on a narrow set of interests.\n\nAnd since her husband left office, she has not been seen by her husband's side on many occasions.\n\nShe wasn't there when he had his mugshot taken in Atlanta. She wasn't there in New York when he became the first former president to be convicted of a crime. And she wasn't there when he officially won his party's presidential nomination, for the third time, on Monday.\n\nThe former first lady spoke in both 2020 and 2016 during Trump's presidential nomination. She was accused of borrowing from Michelle Obama's 2008 speech in her first appearance in 2016. Mrs. Trump had worn the ensemble -- from Dior, with a New Look silhouette -- in 2017, when, as first lady, she visited Paris with her husband for the Bastille Day celebrations. {"uri": "8233691190", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "14:36:35", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T14:36:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T14:36:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5215686559677124, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/galleries/article-13652047/Melania-Trump-steps-limelight-RNC-amid-difficult-year.html", "title": "Melania Trump steps back into the limelight at RNC amid difficult year", "body": "Donald Trump 's address at the Republican National Congress in Milwaukee last night just days after he survived an attempt on his life sent the adoring crowd into raptures. But the unexpected return of his wife Melania Trump to the limelight was arguably the biggest talking point of the night. The former First Lady, 54, strode onto the stage sporting a striking red dress to thunderous applause and wild cheers prior to Trump's speech, after which she greeted her husband with an awkward kiss as balloons cascaded from the ceiling.\n\nMelania until last night had practically vanished from public life and the media, refusing to accompany her husband on the campaign trail and remaining absent even through his court battles in New York over the Stormy Daniels hush money payments. Amid a difficult period that saw the death of her mother in January, followed by Trump's legal strife and now the imminent departure of son Barron for college, many speculated that the former president had lost the support of his wife.\n\nBut Trump's brush with death in Pennsylvania last weekend seems to have prompted Melania's return to the fore as the Republican nominee pushes for a second term in the White House. The former First Lady declined to speak at yesterday's RNC in Milwaukee despite Trump and many members of his campaign staff urging her to do so, according to sources cited by CNN's Kaitlin Collins. But many commentators agreed that her presence alone was hugely significant, signalling an end to her total absence on the campaign trail that had undoubtedly harmed Trump's bid for the presidency.\n\nThough she'd still made a few notable public appearances of her own accord for various initiatives, Melania had not appeared alongside her husband since he announced his intention to run for office again almost two years ago. Her behaviour was a stark contrast to that of her counterpart Jill Biden, who is seemingly hellbent on appearing by her struggling husband's side at every public event, speech and rally. Melania is yet to comment on her decision to shelter away from the public's gaze, but Trump's wife has experienced a particularly turbulent period in her personal life as of late.\n\nIn January, she revealed her mother had died aged 78 - the same age her husband is now - after a long period of illness. 'It is with deep sadness that I announce the passing of my beloved mother, Amalija,' she said in a public statement at the time. 'Amalija Knavs was a strong woman who always carried herself with grace, warmth, and dignity. She was entirely devoted to her husband, daughters, grandson, and son-in-law. We will miss her beyond measure and continue to honor and love her legacy.' Melania missed most of the Christmas and New Year celebrations at Mar-a-Lago to care for her ailing mother prior to her death.\n\nMelania continued her absence from Trump's public appearances throughout the year, and refused to attend any of her embattled husband's court hearings in connection with his trial over hush money payments made to [adult entertainment] star Stormy Daniels. Over the course of almost two months of hearings, a series of Republican lawmakers, former administration officials, vice presidential hopefuls and even a few of his own kids were spotted lending their support in the New York courthouse.\n\nThey sat through hours of salacious testimony as the ex-president stood trial on 34 counts of falsifying business records - charges on which he was ultimately convicted. But Melania remained far away from the courtroom, opting to stay at the Trump residence in Mar-a-Lago, Florida. The move was seen by many as damaging for Trump's defence, with legal experts telling DailyMail.com that it is often beneficial for a jury to see defendants with their spouse by their side in the courthouse.\n\n'Generally speaking, jurors pay attention to who is seated in the courtroom,' explained Anna Cominsky, Managing Attorney of New York Law School Legal Services. 'Defense attorneys usually like to have ''support'' for their client evidenced by friends and family - it's something that humanizes the client. That said, this is a very different case. The jurors know that this is the former president.' In the aftermath of Trump's guilty verdict, Daniels - who alleged she had an affair with the billionaire just a year after he married Melania - said his wife 'needs to leave him' because 'it's been proven he is abusive' and he 'is now a criminal'.\n\nTrump himself admitted in an interview on Fox & Friends that his trial was 'very hard' on Melania. Though Melania had not stood by her husband's side amid the Stormy Daniels courtroom saga, the former first lady was at least spotted alongside her husband elsewhere.\n\nWant more stories like this from the Daily Mail? {"uri": "8232916077", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "05:55:11", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T05:55:11Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T05:54:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5137255191802979, "url": "https://www.ft.com/content/2687ce0c-9bfc-4de5-9e7c-071cd2fc6a35", "title": "'I'm not supposed to be here': 5 key points from Donald Trump's acceptance speech", "body": "Donald Trump accepted his party's nomination for president for the third time on Thursday night with the longest political convention speech in modern US history.\n\nHere are five key takeaways from his 92-minute speech that capped a dramatic four-day Republican National Convention, coming just days after he narrowly avoided death by a would-be assassin's bullet.\n\nTrump opened and closed his address with appeals for national unity and healing, saying: \"The discord and division in our society must be healed.\"\n\n\"I am running to be president for all of America, not half of America, because there is no victory in winning for half of America,\" Trump said at the outset, in an apparent bid to win over not only the thousands of ardent supporters packing the arena in Milwaukee but also the millions of Americans who were expected to tune in to the primetime address from home.\n\nTrump indicated that the trade fights that rattled markets and businesses around the world during his time in the White House would return if he were elected to another four years as president.\n\n\"We have long been taken advantage of by other countries\u2009.\u2009.\u2009.\u2009often times these other countries are considered so-called allies. They've taken advantage of us for years. We lose jobs, we lose revenue, and they gain everything and wipe out our businesses, wipe out our people. I stopped it for four years\u2009.\u2009.\u2009.\u2009and I will stop it again,\" Trump said, in remarks that underscored the Republican party's populist and protectionist shift under his leadership.\n\n\"We will not let countries come in, take our jobs and plunder our nation,\" Trump added. \"The way they will sell their product in America is to build it in America, and only in America.\"\n\nTrump repeatedly invoked God on Thursday night as he recounted the attempt on his life last weekend and insisted that a higher power had saved him from a premature death.\n\n\"I'm not supposed to be here,\" he said, before detailing what happened when a shooter attempted to kill him at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania. That prompted cheers from the crowd: \"Yes you are.\"\n\n\"I stand before you in this arena only by the grace of almighty God,\" added Trump.\n\nDivine intervention was a perennial theme of the four-day Republican National Convention, with countless speakers crediting God with saving Trump's life.\n\nBefore Trump's keynote speech on Thursday night, Franklin Graham, the son of famed evangelical pastor Billy Graham, led the arena in a prayer for the Republican nominee.\n\nTrump was flanked by nearly all of his close family members as he formally accepted the Republican party's nomination for president. That included a rare public appearance by his wife, Melania Trump, who has avoided the campaign trail since her husband launched his latest bid for the White House in November 2022.\n\nMelania, who is Trump's third wife, entered the convention arena on her own, while a recording of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony blared over the loudspeakers.\n\nAlso notable was the appearance of Trump's eldest daughter, Ivanka Trump, and her husband, Jared Kushner. The couple were fixtures of the Trump White House as senior advisers to the then president. But Ivanka had until Thursday elected not to appear publicly in support of her father's latest White House bid.\n\nShe joined three of her four siblings -- Donald Trump Jr, Eric Trump and Tiffany Trump -- along with their partners and several of her nieces and nephews on stage with the family patriarch after his speech.\n\nTrump's delivery on Thursday night was in many instances more sombre than usual, an apparent reflection of the seriousness of the assassination attempt he survived just days earlier.\n\nTrump nevertheless revived some of the jokes and one-liners he often invokes on the campaign trail, including: \"The late, great, Hannibal Lecter. We'd love to have you for dinner.\"\n\nHis energy level at times seemed low. His voice was muted and inaudible to some in the huge Milwaukee arena at some points.\n\nYet the crowd still cheered him on, and the display of stamina -- Trump spoke for more than 90 minutes, often digressing from his prepared remarks -- offered a contrast to Joe Biden's recent struggles.", "source": {"uri": "ft.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Financial Times News"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "8232636444", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "00:52:02", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T00:52:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T00:50:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5137255191802979, "url": "https://www.timesnownews.com/world/us/us-news/where-is-melania-donald-trump-arrives-solo-at-rnc-day-4-article-111848724", "title": "Where Is Melania? Trump Arrives Solo At RNC", "body": "The finale of the Republican National Convention is currently underway in Milwaukee. Former President Donald Trump has arrived for the event and is scheduled to address the crowd at 9:30 p.m., where he will formally accept his third GOP nomination for president. Over the past three days, several members of the Trump family, including Donald Trump Jr. and his daughter Kai, have spoken at the event. However, Melania Trump, whose absence was notable, was expected to attend the fourth day of the RNC but is nowhere to be found.", "source": {"uri": "timesnownews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "TimesNow"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Republican National Convention"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milwaukee", "type": "loc", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Milwaukee"}, "location": {"type": "place", "label": {"eng": "Milwaukee"}, "country": {"type": "country", "label": {"eng": "United States"}}}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_Jr.", "type": "person", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump Jr."}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melania_Trump", "type": "person", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "Melania Trump"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Committee", "type": "org", "score": 1, "label": {"eng": "Republican National Committee"}}], "categories": [{"uri": "dmoz/Health/Fitness/Advice_and_Guides", "label": "dmoz/Health/Fitness/Advice and Guides", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "dmoz/Society/History/On_This_Day_in_History", "label": "dmoz/Society/History/On This Day in History", "wgt": 100}, {"uri": "news/Politics", "label": "news/Politics", "wgt": 72}], "image": "https://static.tnn.in/thumb/msid-111848724,width-1280,height-720,resizemode-75/111848724.jpg?quality=100", "originalArticle": null, "storyUri": "eng-9739208", "eventUri": "eng-9739208", "location": null, "extractedDates": null, "sentiment": 0.0980392156862746, "wgt": 131, "relevance": 1}
{"uri": "8232400893", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-18", "time": "20:29:18", "dateTime": "2024-07-18T20:29:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-18T20:21:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5137255191802979, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/opinion-melania-trump-making-history-195942352.html", "title": "Opinion | Melania Trump is making history tonight", "body": "A year ago this spring, when the 2024 presidential campaign was just kicking off, it seemed evident that Melania Trump, wife of former President Donald Trump, had decided to give it a miss. Little has changed since then. Her continued detachment from campaign events and rallies, her absence in all the primaries save Florida's (where she voted), her skipping her husband's lengthy hush money trial and his June 28 debate against President Joe Biden come alongside the strong speculation that she won't live full-time in the White House again should Trump be re-elected.\n\nAll of it taken together seems only to confirm that her distance from Trump's political life will continue no matter what happens Nov. 5. Melania Trump has, it is true, held two campaign fundraisers for the Log Cabin Republicans at her homes; but by contrast, first lady Jill Biden has held frequent fundraising tours with multiple destinations.\n\nJill Biden, described as \"defender-in-chief\" of her husband's campaign by the Economist, and described by The New York Times as \"comforter-in-chief\" to some jittery Democrats, has visited red states and blue ones, often alone, and been an actively political surrogate for her husband. Melania Trump's limited appearances could not be in starker contrast.\n\nThough she has been harder to find, Melania Trump is planning to attend the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee. However, unlike she did in 2016 and 2020, this time she does not plan to speak. Her silence will end an unbroken tradition that goes back to Barbara Bush in 1992 of first ladies and candidates' spouses giving significant addresses at conventions.\n\nAs long as she is visible at the convention, even if she's silent, Melania Trump will win plaudits from Trump fans, many of whom only want more of her. Still, her silence and her rare appearances are further evidence, as Katie Rogers noted recently, that Melania Trump has significantly reshaped the role of first lady: \"She broke open the role and actually showed us [that] you don't have to do anything with it if you don't want to.\"\n\nFor more than a century, whether they desired it or not, first ladies have been highly visible campaigners. As many American women got to vote for the first time in 1920, for example, Florence Harding eagerly stood on her front porch, in what was called the Front Porch Campaign, hosting tens of thousands of visitors alongside her husband, President Warren G. Harding. Similarly, Eleanor Roosevelt called for Franklin D. Roosevelt's unprecedented third term during her \"no ordinary time\" speech at the Democratic convention in 1940, a step that, as First Ladies Association for Research and Education President Nancy Kegan Smith notes, \"was credited with helping FDR to unify the convention.\"\n\nTwo decades later, Lady Bird Johnson was the first to take to the hustings on her own, with the whistle-stop tour in 1964 -- a bold venture into a hostile South that helped bring about LBJ's victory. Pat Nixon was the next to appear at a convention, in 1972, thrilled to offer remarks about her husband, Richard Nixon, following an eight-minute standing ovation. Then in 1992, Barbara Bush, already known for a significant speech at Wellesley College, had the opportunity to speak \"about the centrality of family ... in a model of conciliatory rhetoric,\" as scholar Myra Gutin explains.\n\nSince then, first ladies' speeches at conventions have often focused on family matters; Hillary Clinton spoke of children and family in 1996, as did Michelle Obama in 2008: \"I come here as a wife; I come here as a mom.\" In 2012, Michelle Obama further highlighted hers and President Barack Obama's humble family histories. In 2020, during the coronavirus pandemic, Jill Biden offered a speech \"as a mother and a grandmother\" from a classroom at a high school where she once taught. Both Melania Trump's speeches in 2016 and 2020 were similarly focused on family, addressing mothers like herself -- and women as a whole.\n\nThis theme of family was also echoed by Melania Trump this past weekend in the wake of the assassination attempt on her husband. In an effort to reach across the aisle, she pointed out that \"every single politician is a man or a woman with a loving family.\" Her statement was heartfelt and empathic, calling for Americans to see each other as \"human beings.\" Considering her absence during so much of the campaign so far, her outspokenness at this moment was notable -- and will likely carry significant political weight. Her comments, of course, stand in stark contrast to the way her husband told supporters to \"fight like hell\" right before the Capitol riot on Jan. 6, 2021.\n\nMelania Trump's words were important in humanizing her husband, and they suggest that GOP strategist Alex Conant is overlooking something significant when he claims that \"people vote for the presidential candidate, not their spouse or their vice president.\" This is because for more than a century now, whether they are particularly interested in politicking or not, first ladies have served their spouses' campaigns immeasurably, by humanizing and broadening their appeal. With her statement, Melania Trump did just that after the assassination attempt in Butler, Pennsylvania. {"uri": "8232729392", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "02:52:33", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T02:52:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T02:51:47Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5137255191802979, "url": "https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/29331692/eric-trump-donald-rnc-president-assassination-attempt/", "title": "Trump relives moment he came within inches of death in 1st speech since shooting", "body": "DONALD Trump has taken the stage at the Republican National Convention to address his assassination attempt.\n\nThe former president added that it was \"too painful\" to discuss more than once.\n\nEric gave a fiery speech as he became emotional describing the moment when he heard his father was shot.\n\nTrump sat with his family and held his four-year-old granddaughter, Carolina, as Eric spoke.\n\nToward the end of his speech, Eric directed his attention to his father, saying that their family \"held their breath\" as they saw \"blood pour across his face.\"\n\n\"The whole world saw your strength as you stood up and wiped blood across your face,\" Eric said, describing the assassination attempt as one of the most \"courageous\" moments in American politics.\n\nEric also discussed Trump's upbringing and praised his administration.\n\n\"My father saw potential when others saw disparity,\" Eric began his speech, adding that his father, \"built the New York City skyline.\"\n\n\"He restored hope, he restored a voice to millions of Americans who have been ignored, he restored the American Dream,\" Eric said of Trump's administration.\n\nEric praised the economy during his father's administration and said Trump \"made the United States safe.\"\n\n\"My father has been censored. The former president ripped off Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook. My father has been persecuted,\" he added.\n\n\"My father has been pulled off the ballots of states. My father even became the target of an assassin.\"\n\nEric also discussed illegal immigration, reiterating a common theme discussed throughout the RNC.\n\n\"Your government can do so much better - and it will,\" Eric added.\n\nHe said his father \"believed in the promise of America when others turned away.\"\n\nEric concluded his speech with a call to voters and a promise that Trump would \"Make America Great Again.\"\n\nKid Rock then took to the stage to hype up the crowd for Dana White and Trump.\n\nHe wore a black T-shirt with a leather jacket and a fedora hat.\n\nKid Rock screamed at the audience to chant \"Fight\" and \"Trump,\" as an American flag graphic was displayed behind him.\n\nDana White, CEO of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, took the stage next to introduce the former president.\n\nWhite and Trump are longtime friends, and the UFC tycoon is a strong supporter of Trump's presidency.\n\nDana said that Trump \"truly cares about people,\" and cited the former president's concern with interrupting Dana's family vacation for the RNC.\n\n\"Nobody in the Trump campaign has ever told me what to say. Nobody tells me what to say,\" he added.\n\nDana said that Trump was \"the toughest, most resilient human being,\" he's ever met in his life.\n\n\"I know President Trump is literally putting his life on the line for something bigger than himself,\" Dana said.\n\n\"He loves this country. And I know he wants what's best for the American people. I know he's running for president to save our American Dream,\" he added.\n\nDana concluded his speech with an enthusiastic endorsement, \"America needs a strong leader and the world needs a strong American. Donald Trump is the best choice. My fellow Americans it is my honor to introduce the 45th President of the United States, Donald Trump.\"\n\nTrump took the stage late on Thursday night after a slew of speeches to formally accept the Republican nomination for president.\n\n\"We rise together or we fall apart. I am running to be president for all of America, not half of America,\" he told the crowd.\n\n\"There is no victory in winning for half of America. So tonight with faith and devotion I proudly accept your nomination for president of the United States.\"\n\n\"I am running to president for all of America not half of America bc there is no victory in winning for half America\" he added.\n\nTrump said he would address the assassination attempt once because it was \"too painful\" to recall.\n\nHe set the scene as a warm Saturday in Pennsylvania and as he was discussing his administration's work at the Southern border, he turned to look at a screen behind him.\n\nTrump demonstrated his turn when he felt \"something\" hit him \"really really hard\" on his right ear.\n\n\"I said to myself 'wow what was that?' It could only be a bullet,\" Trump added.\n\nHe described \"blood all over the place\" and recalled immediately feeling the urgency of the moment.\n\nTrump thanked the Secret Service and said that even though there was \"blood pouring everywhere\" he felt safe because he had \"God\" on his side.\n\n\"If I had not moved my head at that moment, the assassin's bullet would've hit it's mark,\" he told the crowd.\n\nThe Trumps have presented a united front for the former president's campaign and have reiterated the theme of family values throughout the RNC.\n\nHer father, who has also been active in the former president's re-election campaign, introduced her and told the crowd that she asked to speak after Trump's attempted assassination.\n\n\"To me, he's just a normal grandpa,\" Kai told the crowd.\n\n\"A lot of people have put my grandpa through hell and he's still standing,\" she continued.\n\nEric's wife and Kai's aunt, Lara, also gave a rousing speech on the first day of the RNC.\n\nLara was named the co-chair of the RNC and has been vocal on the campaign trail for her father-in-law.\n\n\"There's no doubt that Saturday was one of the most frightening moments of my father-in-law's life. Millimeters separated him from life and certain death,\" Lara told the RNC attendees.\n\nShe addressed the assassination attempt on Trump during a campaign rally and painted her father-in-law as a defiant political hero.\n\nIn addition to Trump's family, prominent Republicans are also rallying behind the former president's re-election campaign.\n\nFormer UN Ambassador and presidential candidate, Nikki Haley endorsed Trump on the second day of the RNC - a move that shocked many following her campaign.\n\nNikki was a strong critic of Trump during the primary election cycle but opted to support him in the general election.\n\nThe former South Carolina Governor admitted that she didn't always agree with Trump, but added, \"President Trump asked me to speak to this convention in the name of unity.\n\n\"It was a gracious invitation and I was happy to accept.\"\n\nFormer presidential candidates Florida Governor Ron DeSantis and Vivek Ramaswamy also rallied the crowd at the RNC in support of Trump.\n\nThe RNC kicked off just two days after an assassination attempt on Trump during a campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.\n\nA bullet grazed Trump's ear and he fell to the ground before the Secret Service ushered him off stage.\n\nThomas Matthew Crooks was identified as the gunman, but questions still loom over his motive.\n\nFBI agents have launched a case into the assassination and have reportedly found images of Trump and President Biden on the gunman's phone.\n\nThe New York Times also reported searches of an unnamed member of the Royal Family on Crooks' phone.\n\nFootage has also recently emerged of the gunman walking near the rally just an hour before opening fire.\n\nAn attendee turned over footage of the crowd which included Crooks walking behind a screen at the rally.\n\nCrooks was positioned on a nearby rooftop about 430 feet away from the stage.\n\nSecret Service snipers shot and killed him 26 seconds after he opened fire.\n\nLaw enforcement spotted him just minutes before he fired his first shots.\n\nSecret Service has taken heat for the incident, resulting in calls for director Kimberly Cheatle to step down.\n\nWhile Republicans are in Milwaukee to formally tap Trump as the presidential nominee, Democrats seem divided over supporting Biden's re-election campaign.\n\nAfter Biden and Trump's first presidential debate, discussions began on the possibility of Biden dropping out of the race.\n\nRepresentative Lloyd Doggett was the first lawmaker to publicly call for Biden to step aside, and nearly 20 members of Congress have since joined him.\n\nProminent Democrats are also reportedly having those conversations behind closed doors, with several sources close to the president telling Axios that they don't think he can win against Trump in November.\n\nSources also told ABC News that Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries are considering delaying the Democrat nomination process.\n\nA spokesperson for Schumer responded to the report with a statement saying the senator had already conveyed his views directly to Biden.\n\nCNN has also reported that former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi had a conversation with Biden over negative polling and her concern that Democrats will lose their bid for the House if he stays in the race.\n\nThe most recent report comes from former President Obama, who told allies that Biden's \"path to victory has greatly diminished and he thinks the president needs to seriously consider the viability of his candidacy,\" according to the Washington Post.\n\nThe concerns come as Biden announced on Wednesday that he was diagnosed with Covid-19 and had to cancel campaign events in the battleground state of Nevada.\n\nTrump's camp is capitalizing on the Democratic divide, with his co-campaign manager speculating that Democrats are staging a \"coup\" against Biden.\n\n\"They are actively engaged in an attempt - in my view and a lot of people share this view - in deposing the president of the United States,\" Chris LaCivita told Politico.\n\nThe Democrats must secure their plan and message by the Democratic National Convention, which is set to start on August 19 in Chicago, Illinois.\n\nThe Republicans have rallied around their message at the RNC, expressing support for Trump and echoing policies on strict immigration and an America-first mentality.\n\nTrump is anticipated to angle his speech on unity and outline his message ahead of the general election.\n\nHe reportedly ripped up his speech after the This request came shortly after an assassination attempt at one of her father's rallies in Pennsylvania.\n\nOn Wednesday, Kai took the stage with a beaming smile on her face to give her first big speech, according to her father.\n\nShe said she wanted to share a side of the former president \"people don't often see.\"\n\n\"To me, he's just a normal grandpa,\" Kai said, mentioning how he gives her candy and soda when her parents aren't around.\n\nThe 17-year-old also shares Trump's love of golf and mentioned how he tries to get in her head when they play together.\n\n\"And he's always surprised that I don't let him get to me,\" she said.\n\nMelania Trump made a rare public appearance at the RNC during the final day of the convention.\n\nShe came out alone after the rest of the family, waving to attendees with a bright smile on her face.\n\nDuring Trump's speech, the former First Lady sat with her family in the VIP box.\n\nHowever, when Trump concluded, Melania made her way out on stage surprising the former president when she appeared on his left.\n\nHe quickly wrapped his arm around her, smiled for what looked like some pictures, then went in for a kiss.\n\nMelania dodged his attempt, not returning his kiss.\n\nTo recover from the awkward moment, Trump kissed her cheek instead.\n\nThe former First Lady broke tradition on Thursday night after denying to introduce Trump before his speech.\n\nIn the past, the candidate's husband or wife makes a speech to humanize them at political events.\n\nShe had previously introduced Trump at the RNC in 2016 and 2020.\n\n'SHOULD'NT BE HERE'\n\nTrump spoke for the first time on Thursday night after the assassination attempt that left the former president with a bloody gunshot wound to the ear.\n\nA gunman, identified as Thomas Crooks, 20, was aiming for Trump's head, but he moved at the last second.\n\nDuring his 92-minute acceptance speech as the Republican nominee, he detailed the moment he realized he was shot, saying he would only tell it once because it was \"too painful.\"\n\nHe recalled talking about his administration's work at the Southern border and turned around to look at the chart behind him.\n\nTrump showed how he turned his head and then explained that all of a sudden he felt \"something\" hit him \"really really hard\" on his right ear.\n\n\"I said to myself 'Wow what was that?' It could only be a bullet,\" he said.\n\nHe described how there was \"blood all over the place\" but he felt \"serene\" and safe with the Secret Service protecting him.\n\n\"If I had not moved my head at that moment, the assassin's bullet would've hit its mark,\" he told the crowd.\n\nHe added: \"I'm not supposed to be here tonight. I'm not supposed to be here.\"\n\n\"I stand before you in this arena only by the grace of all mighty god\"\n\nTrump then honored volunteer firefighter, Corey Comperatore, who lost his life in the shooting.\n\nHe asked the crowd to join him in a moment of silence.\n\nHis family had sent Corey's helmet and jacket which was on stage while the former president spoke.\n\nIn a touching moment, Trump {"uri": "2024-07-427068133", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "11:27:16", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T11:27:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T11:24:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.501960813999176, "url": "https://www.sanluisobispo.com/entertainment/article290228679.html", "title": "Donald Trump 'Snubs' Daughter Tiffany in Viral Video", "body": "On Thursday, the former president delivered the longest convention speech in modern history, at just under 93 minutes, as he formally accepted the GOP's nomination for the 2024 presidential election.\n\nHe used the occasion to call President Joe Biden \"the worst president in history,\" before adding: \"America's future will be bigger, better, bolder, brighter, happier, stronger, freer, greater and more united than ever before. Quite simply put, we will very quickly make America great again.\"\n\nHowever, a blink-and-you'll-miss-it moment from the Milwaukee convention has become a talking point on social media because of an interaction -- or apparent lack thereof -- between the onetime business mogul and his daughter.\n\nIn the clip, which has been posted on X, formerly Twitter, Tiffany Trump, 30, was seen smiling at her 78-year-old father while walking up a set of stairs to take her seat at the event.\n\nDonald Trump appears to briefly glance at his daughter before turning his head away. Retaining her smile, Tiffany Trump placed a hand on The Apprentice star's chest and leaned toward him, in an apparent effort to kiss the side of his face. Instead, she kissed the air.\n\nWithout reaction, Tiffany Trump then turned and continued walking to her seat. She was followed by her husband, Michael Boulos -- whom, it appears, the patriarch also did not greet.\n\nThe Recount, a video journalism outlet, shared the clip on X, writing in the caption, \"Trump snubs his daughter Tiffany as she goes in for a kiss.\"\n\nThe footage has received more than 1.5 million views. Newsweek has contacted a representative of Donald Trump for comment.\n\nTiffany Trump is Donald Trump's only child with Marla Maples, to whom he was married between 1993 and 1999. The politician is also father to Donald Trump Jr., 46; Ivanka Trump, 42; and Eric Trump, 40, whose mother was Donald Trump's late first wife, Ivana Trump.\n\nBarron Trump, 18, is the former president's youngest son and only child with his current wife, former first lady Melania Trump.\n\nMelania Trump, who has largely shied away from the spotlight in recent years, also became a social media talking point following a moment at the event on Thursday, as she was accused of \"dodging\" a kiss from her husband.\n\nThe moment happened after Donald Trump's acceptance speech, during which he spoke of the attempt on his life on Saturday, when a gunman opened fire at his campaign rally in Pennsylvania, leaving him with an injured ear.\n\n\"I felt very safe because I had God on my side,\" he told the crowd, adding, \"I stand before you in this arena only by the grace of Almighty God.\"\n\nImmediately after the speech, the Republican nominee leaned in for a kiss on the lips with his wife, which she appeared to \"dodge,\" Steve Herman, a former White House bureau chief, wrote on the social media platform Mastodon.\n\nMelania Trump was seen turning her cheek to her husband onstage as he tried to kiss her before the couple walked offstage hand in hand.\n\nThe moment was posted on X by journalist Aaron Rupar, who also described the former first lady as \"dodging Trump's kiss.\"\n\nBefore the convention, X user Ian Miles Cheong, a Donald Trump supporter, posted a photo of the former president and his wife holding hands in a hallway at the RNC. {"uri": "8234091985", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "20:11:31", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T20:11:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T20:07:37Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.501960813999176, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/donald-melania-trump-don-jr-192931546.html", "title": "Donald and Melania Trump, Don Jr., Eric, Ivanka, Tiffany: Which weddings included Mar-a-Lago", "body": "Soon, Donald and Melania Trump will celebrate a milestone wedding anniversary. On Jan. 25, 2025, the former first couple will toast 20 years of marriage.\n\nTwenty years ago, Donald Trump and then-fianc\u00e9 Melania Knauss, her professional modeling name, were busy planning their lavish nuptials in Palm Beach, Florida - the wedding at Bethesda-By-the-Sea Episcopal Church, followed by a wedding reception in the new Donald J. Trump Ballroom at his private club.\n\nMuch has happened since the Trumps tied the knot; his third trip down the aisle and her first:\n\nAnd a lot has happened to the wedding venue Mar-a-Lago since 2005: Several Trump family members were married or hosted wedding receptions there. Ahead of the milestone wedding anniversary of Donald and Melania Trump, here's a look at who (and who didn't) include Trump's private club Mar-a-Lago in their wedding nuptials.\n\nMelania Trump was born Melanija Knavs April 26, 1970, in Novo Mesto, Slovenia, according to her bio on the White House Historical Association's website. As Melania Knauss, she began her modeling career at age 16 and moved to New York in 1996. Donald Trump met the model in 1998 at a New York fashion party, became engaged in 2004 and married in 2005.\n\nTwenty years ago, Melania Knauss was just a bride-to-be, squeezing in wedding dress fittings, finalizing celebrity invites and reception dinner at Mar-a-Lago. Melania Knauss became Mrs. Donald Trump on a Saturday evening in January 2005.\n\nThe photo gallery below is a look back at wedding preparations for Donald and Melania Trump and what we know about their Jan. 25, 2005, wedding, from archived photos and coverage of the Palm Beach Post, the Palm Beach Daily News and USA TODAY Network-Florida.\n\nOn Nov. 12, 2005, Donald Trump Jr., the eldest son of Donald Trump and first wife Ivana Trump, married former model Vanessa Kay Trump, formerly Vanessa Kay Pergolizzi. Donald Trump introduced Donald Trump Jr. to Vanessa at a fashion show in 2003. The couple married at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach in front of about 370 guests, reports show, with the service officiated by Donald Trump's sister, Judge Maryanne Trump Barry. Donald Trump Jr. and Vanessa Trump were 27 years old when they wed, weeks before they both turned 28 in December 2005.\n\nDonald Trump Jr.'s siblings were in the wedding party: Ivanka Trump was a bridesmaid, and Eric Trump was a groomsman.\n\nVanessa and Donald Trump Jr. had five children together - Kai Trump, Donald Trump III, Tristan Trump, Spencer Trump and Chloe Trump - before they eventually divorced, after 12 years of marriage, in 2018.\n\nDonald Trump Jr. is engaged to Kimberly Guilfoyle.\n\nOn Nov. 8, 2014, after a six-year relationship, Lara Yunaska married Eric Trump in a ceremony at Mar-a-Lago. Eric Trump, then 30 and son of Donald Trump and his first wife, Ivana Trump, married the TV producer in a ceremony that included 450 guests and was held on the lawn of the Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Florida, USA TODAY reports in a November 2014 story.\n\nWedding guests included Eric Trump's mom Ivana Trump, radio personality Elvis Duran and former \"Real Housewives of New York\" star Jill Zarin, according to People magazine.\n\nThe family of Eric Trump's sister, Ivanka Trump, had roles in the wedding: Ivanka Trump's daughter was a flower girl and Ivanka Trump's husband, Jared Kushner, officiated at the wedding, according to the Daily News. The Daily Mail reports that Lara Trump's dog, Charlie, was the ring bearer.\n\nTwo weeks before her wedding to Eric Trump, the bride, Lara Yunaska, broke both of her wrists in a horse riding accident. She chose to wear Vera Wang -- one gown for the ceremony and another for the reception.\n\nOn Oct. 25, 2009, Ivanka Trump, eldest daughter of Donald and Ivana Trump, married Jared Kushner, who previously owned the New York Observer. The 27-year-old bride and 28-year-old groom tied the knot at Trump National Golf Club in Bedminster, New Jersey, in front of about 500 guests.\n\nNews reports show the guest list included celebrities such as Russell Crowe, Regis Philbin, Natalie Portman, Barbara Walters, Rudy Giuliani, Andrew Cuomo, country singer Jamey Johnson, Emmy Rossum and then-boyfriend Adam Duritz of the band Counting Crows.\n\nIvanka Trump wore a Vera Wang gown reminiscent of Princess Grace Kelly's wedding dress. Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner are parents to three children, Arabella Rose Kushner, Joseph Frederick Kushner and Theodore James Kushner.\n\nOn Nov. 12, 2022, Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos were married at Donald Trump's private club Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Florida. More than 500 guests attended the wedding of the former president's youngest daughter, then 29, to the 25-year-old Lebanese-American billionaire. Tiffany Trump is the younger daughter of the former president and his second wife Marla Maples.\n\nThe couple, who got engaged after two years of dating, met in 2018, when Boulos was studying project management at City University of London and Tiffany Trump was a law student at Georgetown University in Washington, D.C. Both were vacationing in Santorini and met in Mykonos at Lindsay Lohan's Beach Club, according to People magazine.\n\nTiffany Trump announced her engagement to Boulos on her father's last day in office; her fiance proposed in the White House Rose Garden. In an homage to her husband's Lebanese heritage, the bride chose Lebanese designer Elie Saab to design her dress, according to the Palm Beach Daily News.\n\nThree days before the wedding, Florida was in the path of Hurricane Nicole. The wedding occurred without issue from the storm.\n\nThey do! Tiffany Trump weds her billionaire boo at a glam shindig at Mar-a-Lago\n\nContributing: Shannon Donnelly, Palm Beach Daily News, and Ann Oldenburg, USA TODAY\n\nSangalang is a lead digital producer for USA TODAY Network-Florida. Melania Trump arrived at the convention at around 9 p.m. CT on Thursday, which is her first appearance at the convention.\n\nThe post, made by X user Ian Miles Cheong, a Trump supporter, has already received 56,100 in the past 20 minutes.\n\nWhile the Trumps have held hands while posing for photos in the past, they are not known to partake in a lot of public displays of affection. MelaniaTrump has been seen pulling her hand away from Donald Trump or even swatting away the gesture from her husband.\n\nMelania Trump is wearing a red skirt suit in the photo and Donald Trump is wearing his signature Blue suit with a red tie. Donald Trump's head is turned to show the bandage on his right ear, which was injured during a recent assassination attempt.\n\nWhile speaking at a campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, on Saturday at around 6 p.m. ET, Trump was struck with a bullet to the ear in what the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is investing as an assassination attempt.\n\nThe shooter, Thomas Matthew Crooks, was killed by a U.S. Secret Service counter-sniper. One rally attendee, 50-year-old former firefighter Corey Comperatore, was killed in the shooting and two more were seriously injured, according to the Secret Service.\n\nPresident Joe Biden said in an Oval Office address Sunday night that law enforcement officials are investigating the shooting. Meanwhile, House Speaker Mike Johnson, a Lousiana Republican and Trump ally, said that the House will conduct a full investigation of the shooting.\n\nAs a sign of solidarity, Trump supporters at the convention have been wearing bandages on their right ears.\n\nTrump made his first appearance at the RNC on Monday, the same day Ohio Senator JD Vance was announced as the former president's running mate. During his RNC speech on Wednesday, Vance said, \"I pledge to every American, no matter your party, I will give everything I have.\"\n\n\"To serve you and to make this country a place where every dream you have for yourself, your family and your country will be possible once again,\" he said.\n\nVance, a Trump critic turned fierce ally, is fairly new to Congress. He was elected to the Senate in 2022. {"uri": "2024-07-426603378", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "02:29:49", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T02:29:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T02:16:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4980392158031464, "url": "https://internewscast.com/news/eric-trump-gets-emotional-as-he-recounts-seeing-blood-on-his-fathers-face-during-a-passionate-speech-while-donald-trump-watches-with-his-grandchildren-on-his-lap/", "title": "Eric Trump gets emotional as he recounts seeing blood on his father's face during a passionate speech, while Donald Trump watches with his grandchildren on his lap. - Internewscast Journal", "body": "DONALD Trump is set to formally accept the Republican nomination for president, just days after he survived an assassination attempt.\n\nAt the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, Eric, Trump's son, took the stage. His goal was to prepare the audience and generate enthusiasm for Trump's upcoming speech.\n\n\"My father saw potential when others saw disparity,\" Eric said when discussing his father's upbringing.\n\nEric claimed that Trump \"built the New York City skyline\" and said his father didn't care about being \"politically correct.\"\n\nEric praised his father's administration, stating, \"He brought back hope, gave a voice to millions of overlooked Americans, and reignited the American Dream.\"\n\nEric praised the economy during his father's administration and said his father \"made the United States safe.\"\n\n\"My father has been censored. The former president ripped off Twitter, Instagram and Facebook. My father has been persecuted,\" he added.\n\n\"My father has been pulled off the ballots of states.\"\n\n\"My father even became the target of an assassin.\"\n\nEric also discussed illegal immigration, reiterating a common theme discussed throughout the RNC.\n\n\"Your government can do so much better - and it will,\" Eric added.\n\nHe said his father \"believed in the promise of America when others turned away.\"\n\nEric added that he has \"never been more proud to be a Trump.\"\n\n\"Never have I been more proud to be by my father's side,\" he said as his voice cracked.\n\nEric then directed his attention to his father, saying that their family \"held their breath\" as they saw \"blood pour across his face.\"\n\nHe praised his father for his strength and his ability to fight.\n\nDescribing a specific incident, Eric highlighted Trump's strength, recalling a moment where Trump bravely faced a challenging situation by wiping blood across his face. Eric called this act one of the most courageous moments in American political history.\n\nThe Trumps have presented a united front for the former president's campaign and have reiterated the theme of family values throughout the RNC.\n\nTrump's granddaughter, Kai Madison, took the stage at the RNC last night to praise her grandfather.\n\nKai, 17, is the daughter of Donald Trump Jr. and the former president's eldest grandchild.\n\nHer father, who has also been active in the former president's re-election campaign, introduced her and told the crowd that she asked to speak after Trump's attempted assassination.\n\n\"To me, he's just a normal grandpa,\" Kai told the crowd.\n\n\"A lot of people have put my grandpa through hell and he's still standing,\" she continued.\n\nEric's wife and Kai's aunt, Lara, also gave a rousing speech on the first day of the RNC.\n\nLara was named the co-chair of the RNC and has been vocal on the campaign trail for her father-in-law.\n\n\"There's no doubt that Saturday was one of the most frightening moments of my father-in-law's life. Millimeters separated him from life and certain death,\" Lara told the RNC attendees.\n\nShe addressed the assassination attempt on Trump during a campaign rally and painted her father-in-law as a defiant political hero.\n\nRED UNITY\n\nIn addition to Trump's family, prominent Republicans are also rallying behind the former president's re-election campaign.\n\nFormer UN Ambassador and presidential candidate, Nikki Haley endorsed Trump on the second day of the RNC - a move that shocked many following her campaign.\n\nNikki was a strong critic of Trump during the primary election cycle but opted to support him in the general election.\n\nThe former South Carolina Governor admitted that she didn't always agree with Trump, but added, \"President Trump asked me to speak to this convention in the name of unity.\n\n\"It was a gracious invitation and I was happy to accept.\"\n\nFormer presidential candidates Florida Governor Ron DeSantis and Vivek Ramaswamy also rallied the crowd at the RNC in support of Trump.\n\nASSASSINATION QUESTIONS LOOM\n\nThe RNC kicked off just two days after an assassination attempt on Trump during a campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.\n\nA bullet grazed Trump's ear and he fell to the ground before the Secret Service ushered him off stage.\n\nThomas Matthew Crooks was identified as the gunman, but questions still loom over his motive.\n\nFBI agents have launched a case into the assassination and have reportedly found images of Trump and President Biden on the gunman's phone.\n\nThe New York Times also reported searches of an unnamed member of the Royal Family on Crooks' phone.\n\nFootage has also recently emerged of the gunman walking near the rally just an hour before opening fire.\n\nAn attendee turned over footage of the crowd which included Crooks walking behind a screen at the rally.\n\nCrooks was positioned on a nearby rooftop about 430 feet away from the stage.\n\nSecret Service snipers shot and killed him 26 seconds after he opened fire.\n\nLaw enforcement spotted him just minutes before he fired his first shots.\n\nSecret Service has taken heat for the incident, resulting in calls for director Kimberly Cheatle to step down.\n\nON THE DEM SIDE\n\nWhile Republicans are in Milwaukee to formally tap Trump as the presidential nominee, Democrats seem divided over supporting Biden's re-election campaign.\n\nAfter Biden and Trump's first presidential debate, discussions began on the possibility of Biden dropping out of the race.\n\nRepresentative Lloyd Doggett was the first lawmaker to publicly call for Biden to step aside, and nearly 20 members of Congress have since joined him.\n\nProminent Democrats are also reportedly having those conversations behind closed doors, with several sources close to the president telling Axios that they don't think he can win against Trump in November.\n\nSources also told ABC News that Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries are considering delaying the Democrat nomination process.\n\nA spokesperson for Schumer responded to the report with a statement saying the senator had already conveyed his views directly to Biden.\n\nCNN has also reported that former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi had a conversation with Biden over negative polling and her concern that Democrats will lose their bid for the House if he stays in the race.\n\nThe most recent report comes from former President Obama, who told allies that Biden's \"path to victory has greatly diminished and he thinks the president needs to seriously consider the viability of his candidacy,\" according to the Washington Post.\n\nThe concerns come as Biden announced on Wednesday that he was diagnosed with Covid-19 and had to cancel campaign events in the battleground state of Nevada.\n\nTrump's camp is capitalizing on the Democratic divide, with his co-campaign manager speculating that Democrats are staging a \"coup\" against Biden.\n\n\"They are actively engaged in an attempt - in my view and a lot of people share this view - in deposing the president of the United States,\" Chris LaCivita told Politico.\n\nThe Democrats must secure their plan and message by the Democratic National Convention, which is set to start on August 19 in Chicago, Illinois.\n\nThe Republicans have rallied around their message at the RNC, expressing support for Trump and echoing policies on strict immigration and an America-first mentality.\n\nTrump is anticipated to angle his speech on unity and outline his message ahead of the general election.\n\nHe reportedly ripped up his speech after the assassination attempt to focus more on unity and will not mention Biden by name.\n\nDana White, CEO of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, is taking the stage next to introduce the former president.\n\nWhite and Trump are longtime friends, and the UFC tycoon is a strong supporter of Trump's presidency.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8233298781", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-19", "time": "10:21:34", "dateTime": "2024-07-19T10:21:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-19T10:20:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4901960790157318, "url": "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/trump-family-wealth-what-is-the-net-worth-of-donald-melania-ivanka/articleshow/111856255.cms", "title": "Trump family wealth: What is the net worth of Donald, Melania & Ivanka? - Times of India", "body": "Nearly each member of the Trump family has heavily involved themselves in the politics of the US, each of them amassing huge wealth from its rewards combined with those of their personal side ventures.\n\nCurious about how much the Trumps have to their names? Read on to find out.\n\n1. Donald Trump - $7.2 billion\n\nEven before politics, Donald Trump had made for himself a somewhat of a dynasty with a multimillion-dollar inheritance.Ever since, his earnings have grown manifold with the support of his political ventures.\n\nHis social media network, 'Truth Social' is responsible for the bulk of his worth, with the $5 billion+ investment currently making him the 382nd richest person in the world at the time of writing, per Forbes.\n\n2. Melania Trump - $50 million\n\nIn 2005, Melania became Donald Trump's third wife.\n\nMelania used to own a jewellery brand and skincare line, though she no longer has ties with the companies. She also worked as a supermodel, having graced the covers of Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, InStyle and Harper's Bazaar in the past.\n\nIn January of 2016, Melania paid $1.5 million for a 1-bedroom apartment on the 33rd floor of Trump Tower to allegedly use as a library, as per Celebity Net Worth.\n\nIn 2023, the former first lady reportedly renegotiated her marriage contract to protect herself financially in case Donald's fortune suffers heavily amidst his multiple indictments, reports Newsweek.\n\n3. Donald Trump Jr - $35 million\n\nHe is Donald Trump's first child with his first wife, Ivana.\n\nA businessperson and TV personality, Donald Trump Jr earned his net worth as Executive Vice President at his father's company, The Trump Organisation.\n\nWhile he technically does not have ownership stakes in the vast majority of his father's businesses, he does own 7.5% of Trump International Hotel in Washington, D.C., also earning around $35 million in salary from the company over the years, as per Forbes.\n\nHe was married to Vanessa Trump from 2015 to 2018.\n\n4. Ivanka Trump - $800 million (combined with husband Jared Kushner)\n\nThe second child of Donald and Ivana, Ivanka is a business person, writer and fashion model.\n\nShe worked as a senior adviser for the Trump administration until 2021, working on issues such as workforce development, women's empowerment, and child care. Her amassed wealth is from both her fashion line earnings and marriage to real estate heir Kushner.\n\nIvanka has been involved in various philanthropic endeavours, including her work with the Women's Global Development and Prosperity Initiative.\n\n5. Eric Trump - $35 million\n\nThough Eric, the youngest of the three children from Donald's first marriage, has maintained a low profile in the public and political arena compared to his brother Trump Jr, he has a leading role in his father's business. He oversees the management and operations of the company's global property empire as executive Vice President of the Trump Organisation.\n\nHe is also the founder of the charitable Eric Trump Foundation, which raises funds for Saint Jude Children's Hospital.\n\nHis wife, Lara Trump, is the co-chair of the Republican National Committee.\n\n6. Tiffany Trump - $10 million\n\nShe is the only child from Donald's second marriage to Marla Maples.\n\nAn aspiring singer, Tiffany graduated Georgetown University Law Center in 2020. She worked as a law researcher before taking up a job at Vogue.\n\nIn 2022, she wed businessperson Michael Boulos, the heir to a multibillion-dollar family fortune, according to Business Insider.\n\n7. Barron Trump - $60 million\n\nBorn to Melania and Donald Trump, 18-year-old Barron is the youngest of the five of the latter's children.\n\nHe was educated at the priciest of the countries' schools - including Columbia Grammar & Preparatory School, the annual tuition of which is $64,990.\n\nBarron reportedly has numerous real-estate holdings in his trust fund, including the $19 million-worth estate in New Jersey and $11 million-worth mansion in Palm Beach, Florida, according to Celebrity Net Worth.\n\nAt TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock.
